text: Came here on a Friday evening. Was a very lively crowd, about an hour wait for 3 of us (ended up being about 40 minutes). Stood in the bar area and had beers ($3 tecates!!!) and chips and guacamole and salsa. Guacamole was unreal good, chips were decent (but not the really really good kind), and salsa was not good. One red smoky flavored one, and a green salsa (which is usually my fave) but just didn't hit. Shared a pitcher of margaritas, they were okay. I've definitely had better, just tasted like a mix which is always disappointing. Tacos were great! Had a fish taco and a steak taco. Friends got the pork belly and the pastor and the fish as well, everyone was pleased. Pretty basic street taco style, 2 tacos was perfect with drinks, big appetites would need 3-5 but they aren't crazy priced ($3-5 each). Fun vibes probably keep this place as popular as it is.

5 stars for the food, but 2 stars for the staff. The food is amazing, hands down. We've been here multiple times and ate our way through the menu, top to bottom, back and forth and it's consistently great. My personal favorite is the fish taco, it's sooooo good, and they serve a big chunk of fish! However, the staff seems the be constantly in a weird mood. Maybe I'm just having bad luck, but every time we've been here we had a strange encounter. The last time around, our waitress  would simply not show up. We would have to ask other waiters if they could take our order, or if they could bring us the check. They would then tell our waitress who was just casually hanging out at the bar making goggly eyes to another waiter. But clearly not doing her job. Another time someone mentioned that the tacos come with cilantro and I should order them that way, and not have it removed. What an odd thing to say: half the tacos come with cilantro and you can't expect everyone to like it. I also don't think that cilantro will be the game changer of the dish: either the taco is good, or it's not. But if you add cilantro to my taco then it will be a bad taco for me, guaranteed.

Oh big star. Sometimes you are super fun. And you know, have great tacos. But today , alas, the blondish girl bartender was in a dark place I think. Dark , dark , dark , dark place.  She absolutely would not look our way as much as we shouted. And hey, we shouted. Just to order food . So let it be known, the service , kinda erratic. I know it can stink being on the other side of the bar, but don't agree to it then, ok?  Ok. So consider yourself warned and stuff. Ok we went back and Blerg. Ceviche special had no lime and was raw. The waitress got our order wrong - gave us chicken tacos when we ordered fish. The sound, whoa, was really bad. Speakers were terrible. Are they new? Cuz sheesh , they stink. Very muddled sound, caustic and unnerving. Not sure what happened here. Sorry big star. Frowny face.
Sit on the patio and drink a marg pitcher so you can forget about the overpriced, small tacos and bad salsa.

The only reason to go to Big Star is their outdoor seating area, which is nice on a summer day, but their tacos are over priced, underwhelming, and small. Try the many small, local spots near here instead.

Big Star is such a well known Wicker Park staple that I've passed by countless times when I've been in the area.  It was great to check this place out the other night with a couple of my friends for a taco dinner.   Positives from my experience: -The traditional lime margarita was perfect in every way. It tastes really natural and not overly sweet.   -The guac was super fresh, and I loved both of the spicy salsas that were served with the chips.   -The large outdoor seating area is ideal for the warmer months.   -The fish taco was my favorite taco out of the three different ones I tried.       -The service was really fast (considering how busy it was).  The tacos came out about 5 minutes after ordering.   The one negative thing from my experience: -I really wish they would add some black beans or rice to the menu as a side.   A taco dinner doesn't feel complete to me without one or both of those sides.

I've never eaten at the restaurant, only the walk up window, so my review only pertains to that section of Big Star. They are always super nice, and the food comes quickly. Only downer is that the walk up window is CASH ONLY! I always get my food within 5 minutes, and the sit down area is perfect for a quick lunch on a nice day. One of my favorites is the Pescado taco, but because it's fried, you'll want to eat it first because it just isn't the same soggy. The pastor is freakin' fantastic, and I love the little bit of pineapple on top. I am also all about the chorizo taco and the steak taco. The only taco that I've had from here that I wasn't a fan of was the zanahoria (carrot), but I suppose for those vegetarians out there it's nice to have that option. I'm such a big fan of the walk up window, I have made it my mission to eat in the sit down section ASAP, and I will update my review when I do.

Oh, Big Star, you are definitely a FIVE star! We were recommended to come here for amazing tacos by locals that we met during the solar eclipse event. This was by far one of the best recommendations! Visiting from New York, we always get a variety of food, but Big Star is something else. It is a family style taco spot where you can choose any of their unique tacos. We ended up getting the following tacos: - Taco De Panza- this wasn't a bad combo, braised pork belly with tomato guajillo sauce. - Taco Al Pastor- the grilled pineapple goes well with the marinated roasted pork shoulder. - Taco De Pescado- Delicious beer battered tilapia fillet. You can taste every inch of crispiness! We got three rounds of this! - Taco De Chorizo Discada- my husband said this was his least favorite. - Taco Alambre De Res- grilled steak- how could you go wrong? so gooood! My husband also ordered a beer (lone star) and a drink. I can't remember the names of either or, but he absolutely loved both!  Overall, great and friendly staff and the food is banging! There's no doubt we will be back! Note: they check ID when you enter the premises. Have them out ready! The guy was nice enough to let me in since I didn't have mine.

I love the outdoor patio. Be prepared to wait, there's always at least a 20 to 30 minute wait minimum during the week. Even longer on the weekends. The margaritas are good and pretty strong. The chips and guac are good but I feel like the amount of guac is a little small. They gave us salsa too but their salsa isn't chunky. It reminds me more of the hot sauce you get at Chipotle.

Don't sit at the bar if you're looking for decent service. Sat and waited to be attended to for 4 minutes without a single bartender or Barback to greet. Bar was only half full. Barback was attentive in giving water but no greeting. Bartender took another 4 minutes to finally walk over to take my order and the orders of the people around me. He took my order and asked if I wanted a glass w my beer. I said I'd be ok without one. I watched as he opened the fridge to grab one and another bottle fell out. He went to grab it off the floor and placed it back into the cooler, then proceeded to open my can without washing his hands. I saw his hands touch the rim of the can. Needless to say I changed my mind and asked for a glass. Food was delicious! But when it came time to end the meal, I was curious if there might be dessert. I made eye contact w the bartender to signal that I had a question. He stood there 6 feet away expecting me to yell across the bar. He answered with knowledge and even some emotion/humanity. I asked for the bill and paid. Meanwhile the bartender didn't even thank me for coming in nor did he bid a farewell. On the screen to pay I had to choose a pre-determined tip starting at 18%. I wish I could have left less. Sadly I regret coming into big star this time around. Too bad the bartender is too inhospitable to treat a guest with decency.

This place is trendy and fun, but the food could be a lot better. Tacos are my favorite food group, and if you're specializing in them, they better be stellar. My favorite part about going to Big Star is the part when we leave and go to Jeni's! A place that ROCKS at what they specialize in!  Favs:  -They have Lone Stars here!!!  -The margs are strong and nice and everyone I go with usually enjoys them.  -Al Pastor - hard to mess this one up  -Walking Taco - I appreciate that they have this comfort food!  Mehs:  -Panza - the meat is perfectly tender but always a little too salty (and I love salty) -Pescado - okay, but Antique Taco down the street does it better -Chorizo - too salty and the meat is always a little burnt  My opinion on the taco places in this area:  1. Antique Taco  2. Tamale Spaceship  3. Big Star  4. Flash Taco (nobody sane should ever go to Flash Taco) 3 stars for foodie, 4 stars for bar and patio atmosphere

I had a decent experience at Big Star. We ordered chips, salsa, and guacamole to start. The red salsa had a lovely smoky flavor. The guacamole was good but nothing to write home about. For drinks, I tried both a paloma and a margarita. Both were enjoyable but again, nothing special. I do not eat meat or dairy, so I ordered the potato taco without cheese, and the carrot taco without the yogurt sauce. Points to Big Star for the unique nature of these items. The typical vegetarian taco option is beans, maybe mushrooms if you're lucky. I really enjoyed the carrot one in particular. But, I've had more interesting fillings like tofu or jackfruit elsewhere. My meat-eating dinner companion enjoyed the three tacos he ordered. Service was friendly and we were seated promptly on the very spacious patio. The music was a little too loud for my liking but we could still carry on a conversion okay. I got the sense that if you were there late on a Friday or Saturday night, it might be the sort of place where it could get reeeeally loud. But I can't say for sure. I'll probably go back, mostly because I really liked the large patio, and the tacos were pretty good.

We've been big fans of Big Star since we moved to Chicago years ago so we were excited to have their food truck cater our wedding at the end of July 2017 at Prairie Production. We worked closely with their catering manager, Jennifer, throughout the planning process. Cannot say enough good things about her! She was so sweet, very responsive via email, and really made us feel so relaxed about the whole thing! Jennifer was knowledgeable about food truck weddings and had a lot of great suggestions from past experiences.  We used Big Star for our appetizers, bar service, and dinner (one of the two food trucks we had). All of the staff from Big Star was amazing, our guests raved about how nice and efficient they were. We loved how Jennifer already had connections with Tablescapes, so she handled our rentals as well, which we appreciated! She also went out of her way to do things for us, we were constantly raving about her! Thank you, Big Star, for making our wedding so fun, delicious, and stress-free!
I don't know how good the food is because after 2 full hrs (they don't take reservations) we gave up. Seriously why can't you take reservations!?

I love this establishment until today where they have a very offensive staff. We would have gladly left if we were asked but they didn't have to rudely interfere our conversation and drinking. I hate the new staff and will not go here again. I hate this establishment!!!

tacos tacos and more tacos hand made tortillas savory tacos  no dessert available but they recoment places next door  tree bite tacos i order 3 and i was satisfasing $12 i be back whit friends to try the micheladas & palomas
Margarita pitcher waaaay over-priced! $40 for a pitcher... 75% of pitcher  was filled with ice, so you're only getting 25% of a margarita.... but tacos are good.

Expect to wait but we came here on a Saturday at 4:00 PM, put our name down and were lucky enough to find a seat at the bar. We ended up eating there but with over 25 people in front of us I got a text 30 minutes later saying a table was ready for us. They move people quick. We ordered and all 8 of our tacos came out not even 10 minutes later. Margaritas are a must; I am super picky with margaritas and usually don't like them but I will drink one there. I have had most of the tacos on the menu and they are delicious. The reason I go there though are the fish tacos. They are amazing and the chipotle mayo on there is SOOOO good. Service was also excellent. You could tell they were slammed but everything we got was timely and tasty. Bartender checked on us multiple times to make sure we didn't need anything else.

Okay so if you're going during Summer there's gonna be a huge friggin line. Just know that. HOWEVER this place is delicious, very reasonably priced (can you say unlimited chips and salsa for like 3 bucks??), plays great music, and has pitchers of margaritas that will get you sufficiently sloshed.  They're also awesome about allergies (bf is anaphylactic to wheat so that's a majorly important point for us). Doesn't hurt that most of the servers are cute as hell in like a normal person way, not in like a "we were hired for our looks" way.  Don't have the time for a sit down meal? Get food at the taco window - don't forget to try a "walking taco" which is like meat and cheese and salsa inside a bag of fritos. So dope. Weird thing - they'll let kids in, but if you're like a teen they will ID you and deny you entry if you're under 21. Not really sure where the line is on that one but it's just something to be aware of.

I have lived in the city for 9 years and I consider myself a Chicagoan. I went to big star years ago and I remember it to be good. Today was the worst experience ever and I will never return. We put our name in at 4pm and was told to come back with half of our party around 530. We did and we're told we were next. 7:00 comes around and we were still on the list. We were told we were next! 8:00 came and still no table. The waitress and manager were so unpleasant and the food was not impressive.
Update: tried their breakfast tacos. Much prefer to their, erm...non-breakfast tacos. 4 stars upgrade!

Expect to wait!  This happens to be a very popular taco restaurant to socialize at. Crowd was about mid-late 20's at around 7pm. The wait for a table was about 30 minutes. But you checked in with your number so there were able to text you when it was ready. The bar had open seating though! So we just walked in to the back.  Small menu, but good options! I ordered the Walking Taco and potato taco (forgot the name). My boyfriend got the steak taco and pork belly taco.  I wouldn't recommend the walking taco (basically a taco in a bag), it sounded pretty interesting but flavor wasn't all there. It only came with beans, onions, sour cream, cilantro, and the chips were Fritos. It kind of just reminded me of a 3-layered bean dip.  Potato, Steak, and Pork Belly Tacos were pretty good though! Meat was seasoned well so had a lot of flavor. Tortillas were soft.  Recommend the pink daiquiri drink I got!! (Sorry, forgot the name ) But it did the job and was enjoyable to drink!

This was my second time visiting Big Star. As usual, very busy. This is regarding my experience yesterday (Wednesday).  As we approached what seemed to be the host stand there was a lot of people around it was hard to figure out if they were waiting to talk to the host like we were or just standing around. But eventually around the crowd we got to the hostess, she put me down for 2 and with my phone number she mentioned she would text me when my table was ready. Sweet, so no need to stand around. We headed to the bathrooms but in the entrance there was a men asking for our ID's which was odd but then I asked what he needed them for, he said it was if we decided to have something in the bar, oh okay. The bathrooms in this place are just plain weird they have two tiny bathrooms and a large stall with writing all over the doors. Eventually we headed to the bar, we saw the menu and went for the micheladas one with Tecate & one with Pacifico for a surprising price of $14 . They didn't give any receipt so perhaps there was an up charge for changing the beer. We waited exactly 35 minutes for them to text us that our table was ready, we were impatient and looking online for other options close by.  Once we got to the table we were starving and just wanted to order. The server didn't take long to come ask us if we wanted something or needed more time, oh no we were ready to go. Started with the famous walking taco (really good) and the queso fundido. They were delicious! We also had the salsas, they were okay.  Then we finished it off with 7 tacos! Wow, so many flavors. My favorite had to be the pescado and pastor. At the end we payed $40.33 for our food.  Not bad! Oh and btw those margarita pitchers are a joke; as we were standing at the bar we were just seeing the bartenders pour them and only 3/4 of that pitcher was margarita and well the rest ice. ~$36 if I'm not remembering wrong. That's some expensive ice your getting!

Cute little neighborhood taco spot with a casual upbeat vibe. I was visiting from out of town and ate dinner here with friends on a Wednesday night. It was packed but it didn't take too long to get seated. The tacos were served tapas style all on the same plate and were very tasty. Although it was pretty busy and loud the service was really quick. We sat, ordered, ate and were on our way in less than an hour.   One thing to note - I came here around 7 pm and there was a doorman IDing so I assume at night this spot turns into more of a bar than a restaurant.

Super fun atmosphere to get drinks and a few tacos with friends! It definitely feels like you're out at a bar though so I wouldn't recommend coming here to have a serious or intimate talk with someone. I thought the margarita was awesome - tasty and strong (maybe a little too strong...). I ordered the fish taco (delicious), potato taco (good but too spicy for me), and the mushroom tostada (just alright). Overall I liked the food, but wished there were more fish options outside of fried tilapia. I also think they could up their salsa game - maybe some fresh pico de gallo instead of pureed verde and chipotle salsa. Lastly it would have been nice to have had complimentary chips and salsa given how small the taco portions are and how underwhelming the salsa is. I do like that they used corn tortillas for the tacos. Also our waiter couldn't have been nicer. Overall I'm happy I checked this place out!

Not the best tacos I've ever had but they were certainly good and worth the price. The outdoor atmosphere was nice. If it's busy you can skip the wait and get tacos to go at their outdoor window which is a nice bonus.

I heard nothing but great reviews about this place so I decided to hop in an Uber and give it a try. First, I've never been carded at the door for tacos but when in Rome. Second, my server was horrible. Not being from the city I asked her recommendations. You would have thought I asked her a question in a made up alien language. She said they're known for their whiskeys and would recommend a whiskey sour. Again, strange but when in Rome. When she brought my drink, it was a cup of whiskey. I like whiskey as much as the next girl but again, strange.  The tacos were alright. I'd recommend the fish tacos. The atmosphere of this place is great but I wouldn't go out of my way to come back.

Love it here! Perfect place for a lunch or dinner or happy hour on a beautiful chicago summer day. All the tacos are amazing, and are served family style. They explain what each one is when they bring it to the table. The beer is cold, the margaritas are good and the music is awesome. I'm already planning my next visit!!
Great outdoor space, great palomas, great tacos. service has always been on point. when they're slammed you can always pop over to the togo window and eat over there.

Paid a visit to the local taco craze Big Star during my summer trip 2017 to Chicago. From what I'd hear, waits can be up to 2 hours! Great ambiance during a Friday afternoon and luckily our wait was of 25 mins. I was amazed that a San Diego craft beer company was listed on their menu (made me a proud San Diegan and felt at home) GO BALLAST POINT! Tacos were decent. Would return when I visit Chicago again.

Trendy taco place draws in big crowds... so we opted in for the carry out next door. Best idea ever! Skipped the hour wait and got to sit outside instead of in the packed bar section (patio was closed).  Tacos are amazing and will leave you satisfied!
Best FISH tacos! Hands down! Great location, great people and service. Love, Love, Love the fish tacos! Must try.

Everytime I walked through this place, I was think that it should be very nice place, and a place for destination. Me and my gf came Sunday night. We have ordered 4 different taco's. Im gonna say that only steak taco was nice, just nice! 3 other was so nasty, not even nice!  THERE IS A LOT OF MEXICAN RESTAURANTS which is way better than this one! Still not understand why you should pay for chips and guac, I've been in a lot of restaurants and they serving chips for free

Love the atmosphere, it has a cute outdoor seating area as well as an open indoor dining area.  I absolutely loved their fish taco, it was perfection! Crispy and flavorful. We also ordered the pork belly taco and pretty much all their beef tacos, which we loved.

First off, the tacos were not that great. I can taste the gentrification in them. The staff was extremely rude and we waited around for the check for a good twenty minutes. The water was thrown in front of us without much acknowledgment. Not somewhere I would go again.
I love the carrot tacos.and sitting outside sipping a cool drink. Fun vibe , good food.
I use to love you big star. Before you became bro star. Before you raised your taco prices. Before you were too big. Now you're just ok and not a destination anymore.  Goodbye

I love Big Star even though the people who go there are pretty mainstream/touristy and it is crowded many times.  The patio is obviously a wonderful feature of it and it always has a nice chill, lively atmosphere. I go here during off-times so I can get a table and not wait. I think this place has the best Micheladas in town!  I love the spicy hot sauce in it, which is the main feature.  It's also really well-priced at $6.  Every other place I have had a Michelada at has failed in comparison to Big Star. I also love their chips, guacamole and salsa.  Their guacamole is fresh, lime-flavored, and very tasty.  I also really enjoy their red salsa that comes with the chips/guacamole platter.  The serving is pretty generous so be sure to bring your appetite.   I really appreciate that they have good vegetarian and pescatarian options.  The walking taco is by far my favorite, it sounds weird being in a Frito's bag, but it tastes so good with the tomato sauce, the refried, beans, Frito's, and cheese.  It's such a gluttonous combination.  My other favorite taco is their fish taco which is a decently-sized piece of fried fish served with aioli and cabbage.  I have also had their potato taco, which tastes good, but is pretty lite and is not as exciting as the two other tacos I mentioned. The service is always good, reliable, and fast, which I appreciate.  Big Star is definitely a go to spot of mine.
Really good queso fundido and carne asada tacos. Love the atmosphere and how packed it is on a regular night. They're open pretty late too, which is such a plus.

I am confused as to why this place is only 3.5 stars.  I had a great meal here.  There was a wait, but on a beautiful summer Sunday evening, it was expected, and took less than half an hour for a table.  The server was friendly and the food came out quick.  WE got a variety of tacos and liked them all.  Even ordered a second round of the pork belly (amazing) and chorizo tacos.  Also, I loved the beans we ordered.  I could have kept eating cup after cup.  Queso is not something I would ever order, but someone else did and it was really good, cheesy with the perfect amount of spice from jalapenos.  Chips and guacamole were very good.  Margarita was good too.

Would be 4 stars but this place is way overpriced. The pitchers of margs are potent but at $40 per it's a little much. The chips and guacamole are so so good and worth sharing! Tacos are fine, nothing to phone home about. Maybe I'm just hard to please since I've lived in Arizona or maybe the prices are that awful to me but overall I think it's too expensive  a price to pay for the Big Star atmosphere locals love

Upon finding my seat, I was instantly handed a glass of water. The ambiance was excellent for a Monday night with many water drinkers socializing and enjoying their time. Staff was friendly. Although I didn't finish my water, it hit the spot.
Steak tacos have large chunks of fat in them. It is so gross. I had to throw away because the day is disgusting.
Great place! Super tasty food. The pickled veg are evil  they blew our heads off! A very hipster type of place but don't let that put you off.

Wow! This place went down hill fast! Loved this place since they opened. I take out of town friends and family here frequent the place since I live so close and suggest it to people that in from out of town! We even catered our rehearsal dinner from here!  Here comes the but... we just went there today and ordered four tacos from the carry out window and sat and ate them at a table. At first I noticed that our order was wrong but I'm not one to complain and we were in a hurry. Plus I never have disliked anything here. Next we start eating and the tortillas were stale... weird, this never happens unless it's delivery, and that's not their fault. Then gristle in the first taco. I spit it out and moved on, considering it was the first time in since they opened. Then the second taco... inedible is all I can say all chewy tough meat and stale tortilla. If it was any other taco joint I would never go back.  I'll return at least one more time to see if this down shift in quality is permanent. Until then

Great spot if you have realistic expectations. The food is good, cheap and fast - the beers are cheap and the margaritas are strong. Great patio and atmosphere, for the cost - it's a great spot and easy for people with dietary restrictions. I am a regular here and don't see that changing

Great food, but service was unfriendly. We got a table outside and it proceeded to rain, so they told us they have to stop serving outside. They took away our food (we just got it) and brought it inside. They didn't offer to find us a table inside until we complained. We eventually got a table and ordered new food and enjoyed the rest of our time there.

We spent the day around here and did our homework when it came to dinner, which landed us here. The hype told us this was a no brainer but... No one that works here seem to care at all. The long wait was expected, and the host could not have been nicer (she even recommended where to go for a drink while we waited). This was sadly the best part of our experience. A nice host sending us to a nice bar to wait for a table here. I originally typed up a detailed review about our experience but then I remembered- they don't care.  The basics- The music is the kind of loud where they are going out of their way to mess with you. Our server seems fine at first. Another gentlemen brings our drinks, says which beer is which, I tell him that I'm sorry but I can't hear him he just rolls his eyes, puts them down wherever and walks off. That's the gist of this place. The guac, chips, and salsa were great. The tacos are incredibly small. The fish taco was ok. The pork belly tacos were so salty I couldn't finish one, and they were the big selling point when we read about the place. Huge miss.  After we ate we waited forever for our check. In silence no less, since we couldn't hear each other screaming over the music. We were dying to leave. We watched our server eating and chatting with other staff for at least 20 minutes.. finally we got up and flagged her down. I hate doing that and hate when people do it to me (I work in a restaurant) so this was definitely a last resort.  I regret that this was the way we ended a great day in Wicker Park. There are so many great options in this neighborhood that will treat you right and feed you well. If the staff here doesn't care, neither do I.
Every single time I come here the service is terrible. I'm done with this place now. Great food and put door seating but just not worth the aggravation.

um wow!!! traveled from rockford and stopped here for margs and tacos. patio is perfect. music also perfect. I had the tacos with pineapple (like second or third down on the list) and the big star margarita. If you know anything about memes, think of the Fry meme. TAKE MY MONEY.

Been here multiple times.  Tacos have always been consistent, the 3 stars is for the service. Every time we've gone they have been rude or seem as if they don't care.  We prefer delivery from here due to service. Delivery has always been perfect. Everything we order has always come super fast, food is still warm, and tacos look and taste great!

Big Star Tacos, a place I've been wanting to try and a place for the books. Firstly, the location is perfect. It is surrounded by a variety of restaurants and cafés and is in a central location in Wicker Park.  There are two parts to the restaurant. One part leads to the main restaurant area which typically requires waiting in line or there is another section where you can order tacos to go with plenty of outside seating available. If you are coming for a quick bite to eat, I would highly recommend ordering the tacos in the to go area as the menu items available is exactly the same as the restaurant menu. I have been wanting to try the Taco de Zanahorias which has carrots, chipotle date yogurt, and sprinkled seeds, and my family ordered the Walking Taco. The Walking Taco is a classic taco that is famous to big star tacos and is served in a Fritos bag with corn chips, bean dip, and other ingredients. We were able to find seats in the shade to enjoy our tacos. One thing I appreciate about this menu is that there are plenty of vegetarian options which can be rare for taco places. I really enjoyed my tacos as I felt that the ingredients were a unique combination that tasted delicious together. For a quick bite the tacos were very filling, but if you are hungry for a meal I would recommend ordering more than just two tacos. My family was raving about the Walking Tacos and said that it is one to surely try. Next time I return to Wicker Park, I will definitely be coming to Big Star to try the other options
Great drinks.. they make my margaritas and tacos just right! I'm getting excited just thinking about it.

The outdoor atmosphere was really cute and cool - definitely a good date spot. I had the pork taco and it was good - not the best taco I've ever had but I still enjoyed it! Portions are small so you can order multiple different types of tacos.  I would definitely put his place on your list, but not as the highest priority

I always have a good time on the Big Star patio, but this review is specifically for their catering services. My fiancé and I were planning a vegan wedding, so we were a little unsure if we could find a caterer that could make amazing food that both vegans and omnivores would love. Then we found Big Star catering! They assured us from day 1 that doing an all vegan menu wouldn't be an issue and they totally delivered. Jenn Williams and her team are fantastic. Everything ran so smoothly on the big day, and every one that I interacted with from Big Star were great. Jenn coordinated everything from the wait staff, to the bar and even rentals. I thought their pricing was very competitive and offered amazing value for what we got. Our venue, The Lytle House, had a spot for the taco truck to pull in, which just made the event so fun! I cannot recommend Big Star catering enough!!!

Everything about this place is basic. Tacos are meat mush. Yelp won't let me post unless I go on and on about this useless place. So don't be basic. Find yourself a legit taco place, like Pacos Tacos. Or if you wanna keep it in that hood go to Antique Taco.

Came here on a Sunday evening, and it was packed! They have a great outdoor area, and during the summer everyone takes advantage of it! There was a bit of a wait, but we got seated relatively quickly. We ordered chips and salsa with guacamole, and then I got the pollo, al pastor, and papas con Rojas tacos. All were great-full of flavor and just the right seasoning. I would say this is pretty up there on my list of tacos in Chicago, especially with the ambience!

I think there was about a 20-30 min wait. Towards the end of our wait we requested more seats to be added and it didn't change our wait time. While we waited at the bar, we started with a pitcher of the original Margarita. It was strong but tasty. Between 3 girls, we got at least 2 cups each.  I got 5 tacos... they were all delicious. My favorite was the Tostada de Hongos and Taco al Pastor. I highly recommend the Tostada. So good! I'm partial to mushrooms so that might be why, but they stacked that little tostada with a lot. I also tried the Taco de Zanahorias (carrots). The carrots gave it a sweet taste. It was interesting, but I probably wouldn't be ordering it again. You can't go wrong with al Pastor. The server was able to easily split our checks on the little iPad. I wrote down the items each person ordered or was paying for, and he really appreciated it. It made the process go faster.

Do yourself a favor and order some margaritas along with your tacos, guacamole, and queso fundido! Everything is delicious and worth the wait. Yes, it's a long wait but you can leave your name and take a walk around the park or just sit outside. Perfect for a taco night out with friends!

Decent tacos and good drinks for a reasonable price.  The location, ambiance and crowd is what makes this place a regular spot for me.  Just went Saturday with 5 people, and the wait was a little over an hour when we were the "57th table on the list". We just went up the street and had some drinks while we waited.
Great place to have some tacos and margaritas! Highly recommend!

It pains me to write this but as I called and no one answered feel compelled to write this-this is for the To Go Area: I carried out an order and when I got home part of my order was missing. I called a few times but no one answers. So if/when you carry out-have them take everything out and show you as they ripped me off and I gave a really good tip! That's just lazy and shitty karma!

Honestly, this place is mainly popular for the atmosphere and location. Food and drinks are okay but not worth the price AND if you want to sit outside, good luck. I waited over 1.5 hours for a 2 seater  BUT if you're willing to wait...order the queso fundido :) - Food (3.5/5 stars) - Atmosphere (5/5 stars) - Accommodations/wait (3/5 stars)
Liked both pork tacos, fish taco was average, chips with guac was overpriced, served food fast. The waitress who took the order gave us a bit attitude, which came from nowhere.....

If you want to eat here, plan to swing by maybe 30min before you get hungry.  I don't mean that in a bad way, just practical.  The line is always long but they do a nice job to keep it moving and I love any place that will text you with a warning when your table is ready.  So you can walk around or grab a drink somewhere while you wait. We started with the classic marg pitcher.  It was made with fresh juice and no concentrated sugary mixer.  Great flavor and strooong.  We split one between the four of us and it was plenty.  Split the salsa and guac as an app.  One nice verde and another smokey chipotle.  The guac was fresh and fluffy, we all really enjoyed it. I got the fish taco and the beef.  My friends tried the chicken and tostada.  We all agreed the prices were right on point for the size and quality.  For so many diners at a time, the food came out in a really timely rate. The staff was super attentive and nice.  Very laid back vibes.  Dog friendly is also a plus!  My husband would also kill me if I didn't mention that he was super stoked to see Pappy Van Winkle on their bar list.  A rare fine, and priced appropriately (even if I think he's NUTS to consider spending that much on a single pour)

First time trying the steak tacos very tasty but, later on my belly felt a little unhappy I drank 2 glasses of water to ease the unpleasant feeling my belly was having. OK, 2 days, later went again with my sister she ordered the fish and pork tacos she told me to taste a little piece of the pork meat it taste a little hard and chewy later on like 3 hours later my belly felt unpleasant again this time it was mild case of diarrhea. so for that reason I'm out.  I will not be returning to this place again. it could just be my body I don't know but my sister has the same case. FYI if anyone else get a mild case of diarrhea from this place that means something nasty is going on here with their meat. Thought I needed to share thanks for reading.

I never wait in long lines for restaurants but Big Star is worth it. Food is amazing and the drinks are strong and delicious. Nothing tops the Big Star patio on a summer day in Chicago. I also love going there when it's not as busy and just sitting at the bar and enjoying a drink. They play old school rock and everyone is super friendly and attentive. It's a go to spot. They also text you when your table is ready so you can actually do something else while you wait!

This place was a hot pretentious mess.  Let me clear that never does radish belong on top of guacamole.  NEVER!  The service was slow and they use this pointless electronic card swipes that they bring to your table and you sign with your finger.  The drinks were mad expensive.  I don't get why people like this place so much.  Not coming back.  Radish on guacamole!!! Nooooo

This place is just OK...for all the crowds that it gets and the waiting time required to get it, it's def not worth all of that.  Tried most of the tacos as well as the margaritas.  And honestly, the only thing that stood out in my mind was the steak tacos - it was quite tasty and better than most of the other taco places I've been to.  But everything else was just alright - nothing to write home about.  The fried fish taco was very, very mediocre and barely had any flavor.  I feel like most people are more enamored with the nice outdoor seating than the food itself.  And while the atmosphere is nice, it does not justify eating mediocre food.  So in the future, if i'm in the area, I might get a steak taco to go if anything, but that would be it.

The line to if you want a table at Big Star is usually pretty long but it's worth the wait. I'd say, if you have the time, put your name down and just go to the bar area or walk around and check out the rest for the restaurants and bars around the area until your number comes up. The food is great, I liked the fish and potato tacos particularly so make sure to try those. The place is dog friendly too!

Loved the atmosphere of this restaurant. Me and my sister webt there to get a couple of drinks and didn't eat anything so I can't comment on the food.  Some of the drinks we really liked, some others we didn't but I wonder if it was just a matter if taste. I got the Paloma and lived it.  Also, the Margarita pitchers are a really good deal. They are like $36 and are oretty big (definitely fills out more than 5 margarita cups)
Take note: fruit and pickled vegetables have no purpose on tacos Tacos should also not cost more than $2

The first time I tried to go to Big Star on a weekday at dinner and the hostess was so rude I decided to leave. It was obviously packed and I asked her how long the wait was and she wouldn't tell me and said in a rude tone, "it could be 15 minutes or 2 hours". I left and did not come back until a year later. We were seated in about 45 minutes. Be prepared that it is a very loud place and you have to yell to talk to the person across the table from you. I got three tacos and so did the other two people I was with. I have no idea why but they bring out the tacos all on one plate and don't do a great job explaining which tacos are which. I ordered the al pastor fish, and beef tacos. They were on the smaller side and good, but nothing amazing.

Great space, indoors and outdoors, great tacos and awesome margarita's.  been here several times and have had a great experience every time.  The patio space is awesome.  A lot of tables (and people... all of the time) but I don't feel "crowded" when I am enjoying my meal.  It is a bit loud and no matter what time you go, ESPECIALLY on the weekend, you will have to wait.  They have the texting system so it's great, because you can walk around and enjoy the other shops and establishments there in wicker park while you wait, so it doesn't make the wait that bad.

After hopping around different bars in the area our large group of 10+ coworkers came to Big Star for some grub. We had to put ourselves on the waitlist and ducked into a nearby bar to wait the 30-40 minutes until they called us back. Big Star is definitely on the "hipster elevated fusion" side, not the "authentic Mexican food truck or cart with no vegetarian options and deal with it" side, when it comes to tacos. I couldn't help but stick as close to my favorite classics though when ordering, choosing two fish tacos and one al pastor; the fish tacos were the best part of the meal. They serve everything family style, so everyone's tacos are on one big plate. The chips and guacamole I ordered for the table to satisfy my Californian avocado need were decent. I also tasted the spicy michelada cocktail, with which one of my coworkers is obsessed. It disgusted some but did not perturb me, just sort of tasted like beer with a touch of hot sauce. The best part of Big Star is sitting outside at dusk with friends, string lights overheard and happy chatter of crowds surrounding, on a temperate spring-almost-summer day. Come to Big Star for fancy, not down-to-earth, Mexican-esque food, and a comfortable place to chill with a group.

You know it's officially summer in Chicago when you sit outside at Big Star. It can be during the day or it can be at night and the vibe is always great; every guest is always in a great mood. I've never had bad service here regardless of the crowd and in summer it's always packed. The food is great and super affordable Of course the adult beverages are just as great :)

Ambiance: super causal, has outdoor seating and outdoor walk up window!  Service: staff were all friendly and super fast service!  Food: these tacos are the best I've ever had! I came here to try since I saw it on the food network. I like that the menu is small and simple not overwhelming. I had tacos alambres de res and they were bomb!! I had ordered one and a tostada de hongos, wasn't too crazy about the tostada too much mushrooms. My cousin ordered a taco de pollo and she did enjoy it but preferred the res. Overall, I highly recommend this place for tacos! Quality tacos, fresh ingredients!!!

I remember when we first arrived they took us to a table right in front facing a wall. Literally both of us facing a wall and the host stand where people walk back and forth. It felt like they randomly put that table there just to seat two people when we would've much rather waited to get better seating. The tacos were good but not something that sticks to me. I would rather have a regular non-fusion taco in a Mexican restaurant. I did think the decor was warm, festive, and a little dark which made it good for small parties. I thought the waitress was very sweet about us messing up the tip and total on the check. (Long story but she came back with another check) Overall, it's one of those places you would check out for the sake of everyone else checking it out.
Visiting from Florida, stopped at Big Star to grab some lunch. Delicious! Everything came out super fast and service was great.

Why? Why do sooo many people love this place!? This was my second experience. The first was mediocre, at best, and this second time was terrible!! Admittedly, it was a Saturday night so they were packed. We were prepared to go somewhere else if the wait was atrocious. The host said 25 minutes. We could handle that. No big deal. Went in for a drink. Battled for two stools in a corner. A good server came to check on us. We should have just stuck with her all night!!! We waited. And waited and waited. An hour and 15 minutes later! I went back to the host stand. The new host said we were next. Bullshit. I worked in the service industry for years. That's code for, "we lost you or forgot about you."  Ugh!  But sure as shit, they seated us 3 minutes later. Finally at the table and STARVING!  Our server checks on our drinks (full) and brings salsa. No chips. That isn't a thing here. And no one wants spoonfuls of salsa. Let's be real. FINALLY flag her down and order three tacos each. By the time they arrived, it was close to three hours from the time we walked up to the host stand. THREE HOURS FOR THREE TACOS!!! And they're just okay tacos. I had the pastor, papas, and fish. Papas were not good. The pastor was nothing special. The fish was really good. We had planned to go out after but were so exhausted by the taco-waiting that we gave up and went home.  Big Star=Big Disappointment

By far one of the best taco places I've been to! I had to wait around forty five minutes to be seated for two people, but it went by fairly quickly. I mean, I can't really complain. It was 6 PM on a Saturday night... Honestly, it was worth the wait. There were 32 people waiting ahead of me, but we were just walking around and exploring Wicker Park. It is very affordable as well, especially if you're trying to get a quick bite to eat. Around $3-$4 per taco. The tacos were delicious! I had the grilled steak and fish tacos. They were perfectly seasoned. Paid about $33 for two people, including tax and tip. Chips weren't complimentary, but they are well worth it. The salsa is AMAZING! Service was very efficient. Our waiter constantly checked up on us to make sure everything was okay and the food came our quick. Great staff, great food, great service! I'll definitely be back!

Affordable and delicious. Vegetarian options that could possibly be vegan if you asked for no cheese. I tried the papas con Rojas, zanahorias tacos and hongos tostada - they were delicious, especially the carrot taco. This place gets crowded so come early.

I went here a couple days ago with some friends for the first time. The place looks very nice great outdoor seating and we can even bring pets. It was very busy even for a Wednesday night. They do not take reservations. Despite not taking reservations, we only waited about ten minutes. We were not seated outside even though we requested it. Once we were seated we waited about fifteen minutes before the waitress even introduced herself to us. We ordered drinks to start and she came back the order surprisingly fast. However, she brought us a pitcher with no cups. She then didn't come back to check on us for another fifteen minutes. By then she realized that she didn't bring us cups. It was already too late. We improvised and chugged the water we had and used those cups. We all order our tacos (surprisingly pretty decent), and came with it rather quickly. However, there were six people in our party and all of us ordered three tacos each they put ALL THE TACOS ON ONE PLATE instead of giving us our tacos on our own plate. Then she attempted to tell us which taco is which but it was extremely difficult for her to tell as well as us. I think everyone should get their own plate with the tacos they ordered so people in the future can avoid this problem. Some of us are the wrong taco because we just couldn't tell which is which. She then said she had only been there three months and she's sorry. In my opinion if you've been there three months you should have a pretty good handle on what you're doing. All in all the tacos were decent and the service was poor. I don't know if I'd ever go back there again honestly.

The tacos here are delicious! I love the huge patio outside. Its such a cute place in Wicker Park. Its a nice place to have lunch, and hang out on a warm afternoon. The tacos aren't very authentic but they were still very good nonetheless.  The staff provides decent service, not the best since no one is very friendly or welcoming. But I'd come back for the food.

Fantastic tacos and drinks here! The service is quick when you get seated and this place is busy for good reason; definitely worth the wait! The patio is a great spot whether you're in the shade or under the warm sun. We ordered the Al Pastor, Chicken, and Fish Tacos. All of them were awesome! We appreciated that even though the tacos only had one tortilla, the Taco didn't fall apart at all! Usually taco places use two tortillas to hold everything together. Since there was less tortilla, each bite had more flavor from the meat and garnishes/sauces. The Al Pastor was super savory with a hint of sweetness from the pineapple chunks-super good The Chicken was juicy and tender with some sauce and geese to top it off-good The Fish Tacos were perfectly battered with a drizzle of chipotle Mayo that made every bite mouth watering. Would have ordered two more of these if we weren't so full already! The drinks here are also tasty, they aren't the strongest, but they are refreshing and pair very well with the food. This is a place to come hangout, chat, and to enjoy good food and drinks!

Met some friends for drinks on a Saturday night had a blast! The margaritas are amazing and very reasonable. We had chips and guacamole for the table and it was the perfect combo to start the evening. I prefer the outdoor patio but no matter where you sit you will have a great time.

Honestly you're paying primarily for atmosphere, which is just alright. I ordered the fish tacos, a margarita, and a three dollar shot. The fish tacos were nice, fresh, hot and crispy, but overall lacking. Paying per taco, I would expect more flare and flavor, and overall most tacos I've tried here never "Wow'd'" me. The margarita was mainly salt water, it wasn't strong, and wasn't worth nine dollars. I DO NOT recommendation getting a traditional margarita with salt, the salt is obnoxiously too much and ruins the drink. Overall, for the price it is not worth coming here. There ordering/paying system is awkward and the waitresses even seemed confused. This time aroun I ordered a nine dollar margarita, a four dollars fish taco, with a three dollar shot. Somehow my order while paying amount to being over 30$. It's my mistake not noticing it at the time and speaking up, but afterwards when I realized this I felt ripped off. Again this instance was my mistake, but the whole experience left me disappointed. Either the food and drinks need to improve or the pricing does along with their awkward billing. Sorry for the long review, I was just very disappointed and don't plan on returning or referring

lived up to my high expectations based on everything i heard. Margarita was standard but very refreshing on a hot sunny day. The guacamole was in the top 5 guacs I've ever had. But the tacos - wow! Perfected some awesome combinations. Patio is awesome and service was good.

fun atmosphere, sub par tacos. go to big star for the scene and production value, not the food. plenty of better taco joints that dont need to produce the volume that big star now produces, that no doubt contributed to the demise of their quality.

Dropping a star on my previous review. I know to expect waits at Big Star, but last night wasn't acceptable.  I put my name in at 6pm and was told there were 9 tables in front of me. At about 6:30 I checked again, and there were only 3! Things were looking up! At 7 I asked again and they told me there were 6 tables ahead of me. How did the number of tables increase after 30 minutes? At least the waitress in the bar area was attentive and friendly. We were finally seated at around 8. Way too long of a wait considering the info I had been told. The queso, potato tacos, and fish tacos were all very good. The seating process and service once we were seated was not. The waitress was not friendly and seemed visibly annoyed.

The two stars are based solely on the culinary experience that is BIG STAR. However, considering their customer service experience, the restaurant should change it's name to BLACK HOLE aka a DYING STAR. Well, of course there's a reason: Initially I was having a lovely time on my first friend date drinking and eating interestingly composed tacos, there wasn't really a problem. The server could have come around more often because we hadn't seen her in at least 30 min, a few times. We were going to order more food, a loss on money for the restaurant, but she was not around.  Later, we had a new server, and no one told us that the initial one was going home. We got the check, which is done on an iPad, and wanted to split the tab down the middle. NORMAL RIGHT? Wrong, this girl charged me for the entire check, 'went to get a code from [her] manager' to redo the transaction, and she proceeded to charge me for half the bill. She did the same for my friend. The server told me, 'since we used that code, it will only charge you for half the bill, and it won't hit your account till the end of the night.' Okay lady, thanks.  Next morning, I had to pay some bills. To my disappointment, they charged me for the entire bill. ANNOYING. I texted my friend, 'did you get charged, cause they charged for the entire bill.' She told me she was charged. LMAO LIKE IM SORRY DONT CHARGE YOUR CUSTOMERS 150% OF WHAT THEY OWE.  I called them, no one picked up. Classic. I'm getting an idea of how they treat their customers. I leave a voicemail explaining the situation, and tell them to call me back to remedy this issue.  They didn't call me back, and they slyly changed the amount in my bank account. Thanks for the apology. This is what you get.

Very good tacos and a convenient walk-up for those beautiful evenings when it is difficult getting a table outside. There are nice picnic benches and the relaxing spot is a perfect place for a nice family outing. The inside is a bit loud. I prefer the tacos to the salads here.

This place is fun and totally something out of Austin, TX. This place is lively at night and gets packed quick! I love thier drink and beer menu; lots to choose from but I totally recommend their margaritas because their strong and have quality salt rims & tequilas. They're also pretty strong so a couple will go a long way depending. The menu is pretty much Tex-Mex/American so expect good munchies. I prefer to come at night where things are more lively around the town and the lights are all lit up. It's a nice site to see.

Honestly, I don't think you can go wrong with Big Star. The patio is great. It's usually pretty packed, but it's a popular place. The margarita pitcher might seem pricey, but its strong and tastes great. Split it with a couple of friends; you won't be disappointed. The only downside I would say is that the food and drinks come out super fast, so I sometimes finish food and still have a whole pitcher left and feel rushed to finish it. But maybe that's just me.

Got to stop in at this place and enjoy the outdoor patio area. Great for people watching and day drinking! Loved trying a variety of different tacos. Service was good. I definitely recommend this place if you're in the area. Really fun spot.

This place is poppin. Such an awesome vibe, vegan friendly tacos make this place a 5 star! Carrot tacos, mushroom tacos, and potato tacos! Ah! So vegan-friendly and tastyyyyyyy!  I highly recommend this place for weekend drinks! Wooo!

I like this place.. open until 2am   Tacos are good not the best but goid. Al pastor were great! Queso fundido, nopales were a great touch! Margarita are tasty, they are not shy with the tequila.. it was strong. Love the atmosphere and the patio setting.

After eating, drinking, and paying our tab (and tipping 35% on a large bill (because I work in the service industry)) even after sheisty service) the doorman ran us down at our bikes and asked if we paid our tab, demanded we come back to the patio , and we had to wait 5 minutes while they tracked down our bill and made sure we paid. No one apologized or said thank you.or have a good night. Instead accosted us and told us we didn't pay appropriately, because I took my tab to the bar to pay (no one came after dropping our tab, and I wanted change as I was paying cash). I generally don't complain about service, but these guys were genuine jerks, and refused to admit any fault. Not that I was asking, they just stared me down and talked smack as we got on our bikes and left. AWKWARD.

I didn't even know what our servers name was. I had to literally wait for the bill. Tacos weren't that great. FRIJOLES CHARROS WEREN'T authentic. I will not likely be back for food. BUT the Big Star margaritas were good!

Had the chorizo taco and the walking taco. Walking taco is funny but also delicious! Comes in a Fritos bag, which was fun to eat. Also, the melted cheese plate thingy is amazing. Delicious and would definitely recommend. Come for some great, unique tacos!

I had a handful of people recommend Big Star to me, so I stopped here to kill some time for lunch on a rainy Friday afternoon. I could not believe how packed it was! The bartender spotted me immediately and poured me a water, handing me a menu. I chose a beer and asked for advice on the tacos. I asked her what the most popular tacos were and ended up ordering a Taco de Zanahorias and a Taco de Pescado. I also got some chips & salsa, which were standard. The carrot taco was above and beyond one of the best tacos I've ever eaten. The location was cute and eye-catching, but it was PACKED and overwhelming. I would have liked to sit outside if the day was nicer so I had more space for myself.

Is it reasonable that a restaurant that closes at 2am shuts down the kitchen at 1:30? The answer to the question may be unclear, but it is the reason for the one star. Waitress said "yes", bartender and kitchen said "no".

Let me say this, I do t usually like Latin cuisine or tacos, but Big Star is a different story. First off, I'm doing my review on the "walk-in Big Star, not the sit down restaurant." Big Star has bomb tacos---especially the steak, fish, and el pastor tacos! It's open pretty late so it's great for a late night hang out and it's super pretty outside with lights  all I'm saying, don't just take my word for it...try it for yourself! You'll love it too!

For the love of God, why is the food here so crappy now?! 3 yrs ago there was flavor, now it's downright tasteless! Come here for drinks & to sit on the patio, while you yelp somewhere else to eat. The tacos, guacamole & walking taco even (which should be easy) taste like no one cares there. They literally don't know how to decider flavors with the food & are just banking off people with money who don't know any better. If your a fan of food that tastes good, don't bother here.
Everyone talks about how amazing this place is. So of course I had to try it. The taco selection is minimum. The service is subpar. The tacos are forgettable at best.
Almost impossible to get in, not worth a hour and a half wait for tacos.

The tacos at this place are so good and the drinks are even better! The drinks are strong and decently priced. I liked the steak taco way better than the chicken. The little bite of a friend's fish taco that I had seemed good too. The highlight of the show is their homemade hot sauce, that stuff is so good and spicy! Def a must for whenever I am in Chicago.

Big Star is a great break to relax on a summer night. They have a large patio area, which is nice to enjoy to the outdoor weather; at night, they sometimes turn on outdoor heaters if it's a little chilly. The tacos were filling- the taco de panza is really good! For drinks, the margaritas were pretty strong but satisfying. Overall, the tacos aren't out of this world, but the atmosphere makes Big Star enjoyable.
Great for cocktails. Outdoor seating, hipster vibe. Didn't eat here but the food looked delicious
Although the atmosphere is Lively the food isn't that great. It's okay but I expected better.

Amazing tacos but they don't have much variety so I usually come in for al pastor tacos only and a drink. I also don't like how they don't allow people under the age 21 inside that really pushes away business. I would recommend marcadito over this place but I love how quick they are plus they were on the food channel. So they are doing some things right

Visiting family in Chicago, this was the neighborhood spot they were raving about! Walking up this restaurant is an eclectic, funky spot a few convenient steps from the blue line. There's a walkup to order tacos to go if you need a quick bite. They ID you outside before being seated. They have a nice outside patio, but we were seated inside. The inside spot is pretty crowded. Pull a chair out and hit the chair behind you crowded. Weave through the sea of people to the bathroom and try not to hit someone or get in a waitress' way crowded. The service is super quick. We ordered chips and salsa with guacamole ($8) for the table. Guac was good. Salsa is a mild chipotle salsa, and a peppery green chili salsa. The price seemed kind of high, and the chips aren't replenished like other Mexican restaurants. For a big group you probably need two of these baskets. The tacos are sold per taco, and range anywhere between 3 and 5 bucks per taco. If you're looking for a good old fashioned authentic taco, this is probably not your place. If you want an outstanding Walking Taco, this is your place. The chicken taco came with almonds and a sesame sauce, which made it too nutty and gritty for me. Not my favorite. The alambre de res taco was super spicy, even though the menu didn't specify it was going to be burn your mouth off hot. For someone who doesn't eat pork, the menu wasn't super varied. There were a lot of choices if you like pork or chorizo. Hubby said the pork belly taco was pretty good. If I go back, I'd try the potato taco and get the walking taco again. I had one of their whiskey mixed drinks since I'm not a tequila fan. It was ok. Nothing fantastic for $10. Overall, it's a funky, designer taco joint. If you like that scene, I'd recommend checking it out. If you're looking for more authentic cuisine, skip it.

Heat hipster patio scene! Excellent street tacos and Mexican beers. I had the Al Pastor and the Pescado tacos and washed it down with a Victoria. I wasted money on crema. The tacos were very flavorful already. We also ordered the chips and salsa. The green sauce was very good, however the red sauce was very bland. I am from Texas and like my food with a kick!. Pet friendly....yes  and it was great seeing all the cute pups out with the beautiful weekend weather. Please be prepared to wait. When I arrived on a Wednesday around 6ish, there were 20 parties ahead of us. The wait was about 30 minutes. You could show your ID and go too the bar (very busy also) or sit in the to-go area right next door. It was a gorgeous day so we sat outside next door.  Four stars? We ordered chips & salsa, the waitress got it wrong and we advised the person that brought it to us. She took it off our tray handling it in a manner of re-use and my best bet is that she served it to someone else. Yeah, ya lose a star for that move.  Enjoy!

Be prepared to wait as it's alway busy.  But well worth it.  Pork belly tacos are my favorite, but can't go wrong with anything.  Beer is reasonably priced and scenery is fantastic.  Few better places with better food and ambience.  Unsure why rating is so low, the place is great

Went to big star this weekend...I've probably been back 3 times since my previous review. I have to say they are back to their old selves again. Wait staff was nice tacos came out fast and the food was great! They've also added two high tops tables next to the bar where there used to be an ATM, which is awesome and convenient while you're waiting for a patio table.  As long as the patio weather is nice I'll be back.
Liked being outside but the food was just ok for the price. Drinks and ambience were great but wish there was more food and spice for the price. Always a huge wait.

What can't I rave about at Big Star? Tacos are between $3-$5 here depending on what you get. I absolutely recommend the pork belly taco. I wish I ordered 10 more of those! The fish taco had an amazing slaw on top. This place is open late and you can tell locals use it as a spot to relax, hang out and drink. It was fun to see in my first night in Chicago. The chips and guac were good too. The environment was nice - they had fairy lights and heaters outside. Wait staff were quick and super nice.
Great outdoor seating and food. If you need a 'go-to' place in Wicker Park during summertime Chicago, this would be it!
If, right at this moment, I was forced to make the decision between putting my mother in a nursing home or never eating Big Star again the only dilemma would be which nursing home.
This place is fantastic. Loved the tacos and the energy at this place. Be prepared to wait but it's worth it for the atmosphere .
Armani was the best waiter ever!!! The food is incredible!!! Definitely so much fun to get a pitcher of margaritas and some tacos! Go sit and enjoy!!!
Cool environment and good food. Antique Taco has my heart for tacos now though.

I love big star! The environment is great. The people are friendly and quick. They do their best to accommodate the customers. This place is always fun to grab a drink or food with friends. The drinks are reasonably priced like $6+. The tacos range from $3-4.5. The tacos are pretty small so I usually get four. Honestly though, at one point, the tacos tasted the same and I got three different kinds lol. It's just a great place to hang out. I would come back again.

The outdoor section was not open yet when my date and I came here around 530pm on a Thursday or Friday. We got very lucky.  It was very busy, but we only had to wait about 5 minutes before being seated. This place is not authentic, but for the hipster type of place it is, this place does tacos and margaritas so right! We started with chips and salsa and there were 2 salsas, one being green and one being red.  The red one was spicier and I liked it more, although both were great.  The chips taste "fresh" and have that nice semi-thick crunch that completely kicks Tostitos butt. You might as well just get the margarita pitcher if you have 2 or more in your party.  We ordered the big star margarita pitcher which yields 5 cups so you get a $50 for 40$.  First off, the marg tasted very good and second, these are decently strong.  You start to feel something even after downing 1 cup worth. I ended up ordering 6 tacos because I was so hungry.  The al pastor and panza tacos were clear standouts. followed by pescado then pollo, but all of the tacos were so darn good.  There's great flavor especially with the al pastor having pineapple and the slight fattiness of the tacos de panza.  I'm very into authentic tacos, but these were pretty good and the prices were rather fair.  The amount of meat was great. The entire experience was great and the atmosphere is so casual, fun, and inviting. There's no surprise to me why this place is so popular and I've been told it gets better once the outdoor section is open!

I've had at least of the 10 tacos on their menu, and every one has been amazing. Great options for meat eaters and vegetarians alike. Unparalleled guacamole. Solid selection of whiskey.  I've always had great service, even when it's super busy. They were once super chill about us getting a table for four and two of our friends not showing up for another 45 minutes. They seem to really care and understand how life goes sometimes.  Only downside is it's pretty loud, largely due to the hard materials constructing the interior surfaces.

This is a great social spot for dinner. The wait can be pretty long on weekends, even in the winter when the patio isn't open. Great taco options and delicious margaritas (a little expensive, get the pitcher.. it's worth it!) They accept credit cards now after being cash only forever, which makes it easier to split if you're sharing the bill. A great place to grab drinks and eat dinner before exploring the Wicker Park nightlife!

THESE ARE JUST REALLY GOOD TACOS, OKAY? If you're looking for a place with a hipster vibe, then this is the place for you! Surrounded by good ole millennials, great music, great beer, and obviously great tacos, Big Star is a must see when in Chicago! I definitely recommend the pork belly tacos :P

I had the potato and nopal tacos, my hubby had the grilled steak and my daughter had the al pastor. They all came out rather quickly but once I tasted the tacos I became very excited. I tried everyone's tacos and I was pleasantly pleased. Our waitress was attentive and nice. I will defiantly come back for more and to try the cocktails.

Wow.  Been meaning to try this place for the longest and I finally did. Came here on a Friday night and it was hella packed. But luckily we found seats. Didn't take long for someone to come and take our order. We got 3 chicken tacos. 2 fish tacos and 1 steak taco. I guess I really can't complain about the price but it still is a bit price for pretty small tacos. They try to fill you up with chips first so don't fill yourself with the chips if you get it. The tacos were amazing. Okay really good freaking tacos but probably not amazing. The fish taco was great and the chicken taco was seasoned so perfectly. I assume they use chicken thighs and not chicken breast.
We got our food fast. The tacos are yummy. The bussing is phenomenal. Yelp is stupid and won't let me post this as a review bc it's too short. So i am adding this blurb. Blurb.

"The place you should know," if you care about 'Summer Time Chi(cago).' Big Star will have a line anywhere from 15 minutes to 2 hours (Yes! Two (2) hours) However, if you plan your evening right, the wait is well worth the time. Tonight, April 23, 2017, my party of three was served by Manny, what a great guy! The service Manny provided was outstanding. When I say outstanding, I do not mean to imply perfect because Manny had several tables, including ours. With that said, he was outstanding. The Queso Fundido, Tacos, and Pitchers (yes, pitchers) came right on time. Tiffany, was also a great host! This beautiful bride was a breath of fresh air. Tiffany was hospitable and understanding. My party started at the bar, moved to a high top, and then to our reserved table. Even though Tiffany did not get tipped from our time at her table, she remained in good spirits and very hospitable. Big Star is an establishment consistent with the level of service and accountability. I respect the owner because the establishment would not be what it is without the owner's support of its amazing staff members. Great job Big Star, Manny, Tiffany, staff, and owners!

I came for the tacos, but stayed for the drinks on the patio. Vibes are really great when everybody is stuffing their faces with tacos while downing pitchers of margaritas, go figure.  The taco prices are a bit higher than usual, sure, but they're at least stuffed to the brim with tasty fillings, so the value is at least fair.   Three tacos are normally enough to satisfy me.  Four tacos if I'm starving, and five tacos if I hate myself.  Anyway, on to the -- Tacos: AL PASTOR: These are my favorite tacos al pastor in the city so far.  Great balance of salty, sweet, and savory. STEAK:  Surprisingly really good.  They got this super creamy sauce on top of it that really made it for me. PORK BELLY: Salty, dry, and underwhelming. They definitely get it crispy, but it was at the price of losing a ton of moisture.  Steer clear of this one.   THE WALKING TACO:  Also surprisingly tasty.  Get this for the drunken novelty of it.   FISH TACO:  It ain't no fish taco from San Diego, but it holds its own pretty well.  Average, I'd say.  QUESO: Not really a taco, but this is a bomb appetizer to share.  Heavy, but very comforting.   Overall, a great spot in the neighborhood to catch up with friends.
All the tacos here are amazing but the fish tacos are my favorite! 2 fish tacos, chips and guacamole, and a Michelada are my picks every time I come here. Highly recommend this spot
Whiskey and tacos? Yes please. Very well-made tex-mex style street tacos. Daily specials on whisky and beers. Great outdoor seating section for summer nights. Just remember to not touch the hipsters

Honestly, the best service I've ever experienced. My friend and I walked in wanting tacos but the kitchen was closed. Oh no! BUT the waiter was so KIND and let us put in one last order. We ordered two cocktails. They were great! BUT our dumb buttas spilled both of them! We felt so bad and tried to help. But the bartender was so kind, and provided new drinks for both of us for free. We were so surprised of her kind soul. We had AMAZING tacos and a great experience. We chatted about GOT and Mad Men and it was fantastic! Overall, big star tacos service CRUSHED IT 100000000%.

I really enjoy their food. I'm not a huge on pork or lamb but their chorizo tacos are A++. Their chops and salsa are REALLY good as well.  If you go with a group, I'd recommend getting the margarita pitcher. The pitcher was enough for 4 and really strong. I felt it after a drink and a half.  Don't be scared away by the line wrapped around the door. The food comes out extremely fast so the table turn around time is quick. They also have a lot more seats when the patio is set up.

This is the second time I've came here and the second time I get a totally incorrect order and the server gets upset about it. Like seriously? I'm the one paying for it. I will never tell anyone to come here again. Management will be contacted.
Sat outside which was fantastic. Big Star is in a great location and had some flavorful tacos. Fun atmosphere and would definitely come back in the summer.

Yum. Yum yum.  We were by far the oldest but who cares.  Lots of nice people and nice dogs.   Food was fresh.  Bathroom was clean.   Chips were great.  Fast, fresh, friendly.   Pitcher most cost effective and oh my God,  good!!

I had a very negative experience at Big Star today. Don't get me wrong the food was great, as was my server, but I was harassed multiple times by one of the employees. My girlfriend and I brought our dog in today for what we'd been told was a dog friendly patio. We were seated at a table with 3 chairs, in a crowded area on the patio.  Our dog, who is all of 12 pounds, we were told to move because he was blocking a walk path to a side area. We thought this was ridiculous, but complied, and moved him into a chair on the other side of the table.  Fifteen minute later, we were told that chair was blocking another walkway and the same employee aggressively told us to move our dog to the ground while taking the chair away. At this point, the dog was moved to our lap, but he was still thirsty for water. We asked the table behind us if we could use their extra chair to put a bowl of water down on for our dog. Again the employee came up to us, rudely took the chair, and went on a power trip. He told us he was a manger, had half a mind to kick us out, and we'd been a problem since we got there. We brought a lap dog to a supposed dog friendly patio and got harassed for it. He was not bothering anyone or taking up much space, yet due to our seating arrangement this supposed manager "want to be bouncer" decided he wanted to take control. He had us move our dog twice, and then told us the dog couldn't sit in our lap and he was doing us a favor because a dog in lap is not allowed.   I was told the name of the employee was Reese or Royce. If you think this may be just one frustrated customer, the table next to us as well as random bystanders witnessing the situation felt he was out of line. After he was gone, they came up and informed us he treated them unprofessionally as well. The employee should be reprimanded, and I'm someone who usually give wait staff benefit of doubt for minor issues. This was not that and I felt offended.
Waitress we had was dope! Forgot her name but had funky fun hair, potato taco is where it's at and margaritas are just right!

Came here on a Monday afternoon for tacos. The papas taco was DELICIOUS. I also had one of the more popular pork tacos and it was ok. This spot is very hipster and perfect for the whiskey/bourbon connoisseurs.  The tacos were super affordable and the vibe was cool.

Big Star, named after 70s power pop group Big Star (I'm not sure if this is true), is probably one of the most well-known places in Wicker Park, and I had high hopes going into this place. As a California native who has eaten many tacos, I wasn't impressed. The prices for tacos are a bit high to note. It's $4 per taco. You could normally get way more tacos than that elsewhere - and better too. I got four tacos - Panza, Al Pastor, Alambre de Res, and Chorizo Cordero. I found the chorizo (a mix of lamb and pork chorizo) too salty. The panza was ok, but nothing memorable. I found the al pastor good, but not $4 good. I think the only taco I was really impressed with was the alambre de res, so I may find the time to just grab one of those to-go on a late night escapade. I also got the horchata, and wasn't impressed. The ambiance is probably pretty good. If you want to stop by for a drink and some tacos, this would be a great place to do so. However, I'll also note that it's Chicago and windy and that doesn't make for the best taco eating experience. I may be back, but mainly for the steak taco. Some of the dips look pretty decent so I may try those. TIP: Get the alambre de res.

My friends and I decided to stop by here on a hot summer day having heard amazing things about the food and margaritas. If you just need a taco fix, skip the super long wait for a seat inside and settle for a spot outdoors. Order your tacos from the walk-up window to the left and grab a seat, first-come-first-serve, on their patio, or take your tacos to-go as your looking for a quick bite while exploring the Wicker Park area. My recommendation: take your tacos to the nearby public park for a little picnic on a sunny day. Open late, this place is one of my favorite places to get tacos - try The Walking Taco or Taco de Pollo.

Strong margs and delicious tacos. cannot complain! There is plenty of seating, and the vibes are fun and relaxed. It's still a little cold, but I have a feeling their big patio is going to be the poppin' place when summer weather decides to stick around.  I split a pitcher of the classic margaritas with 3 other girlies. It was just enough to give all 4 of us 2 scant glasses. At $36 for 8-ish drinks, we were sitting pretty. With the margaritas we ordered the queso fundido. It came to the table still bubbling, stuffed with peppers and what I assume was chorizo. Not the healthiest route to go, but a necessary one. It was the perfect warm counterpart to the ice cold margarita. We followed the queso with tacos. I ordered the al pastor and the pollo. Both delicious.
