But honestly, I don't think you can go wrong with any! They all look like winners.

Came for a second brunch with a girlfriend on a Sunday at 2pm. We had about a 10 minute wait so we headed to the bar for a quick drink - Classic Margarita for $9 which was very tasty. We were then seated outside for a rare warm April day and ordered 3 tacos and queso fondito and a second round of margaritas. Service was quick and thoughtful. The tacos were amazing! The fish was my favorite all for either $3 or $4. The total once we split the bill was about $25 for a snack and 2 margaritas. I'll definitely be back!

This place is ground zero for hipster tacos. Imagine with me if you can a time when there wasn't taco's at every high, middle, and low-end restaurant in Chicago. A time when if one wanted Mexican food, one must traverse to the ethnic enclaves of the city to order off handwritten poster board menus, mispronouncing things, and guessing at ingredients. Tacos would be served in a plastic basket on top of simple wax paper. You may sit on a rough wood table or stand against a deli counter to eat. Maybe you'd slug down a beer or whiskey with your lunch- there isn't many options so you'll just take what they have to offer. Staff may not be the friendliest, but getting their attention and ordering is half of the experience. Yes, I know millennials- it's hard to understand what this was like because it wasn't documented on Instagram. But guess what- Big Star has re-created that entire experience for you!!!!!!! And for like, triple the price!!!!! You GET to wait in line (a line that often stretches around the block) to sit outside on picnic tables and slightly rickety outdoor furniture, order off a one sheet menu, to eat little tacos made out of things you can't pronounce, served in plastic baskets and off wood serving trays!!!!! (all those exclamation points means it's super fun) They have an extensive whisky and beer menu- most of which you have never heard of unless you are super cool and into craft everything. And unlike those mom and pop cash-only places -what's cash? it's 2017 after all- servers will ring you up at your table with their ipads. But don't even think about trying to split the bill unless you want an exasperated sigh from the staff. Lucky you! And you don't even have to leave your Whicker Park neighborhood...because there is no one more neighborhood-xenophobic then a hipster Chicagoan.

My family enjoyed this lively, hip joint. A true neighborhood taco and bar. It was packed at 4:30pm on a Friday. Our fav was the pork belly tacos. My 7-year-old daughter didn't like the authentic cheese quesadilla, but the Mexican Sprite was a hit. Margarita was decent.

This is my favorite place to go for tacos. Yes the tacos are small and expensive but you're paying for quality here. You can taste the freshness of the ingredients. I've dined here a few times and always say in the patio. The atmosphere is very relaxing and the service is great. I've always had a great experience here. Be warned there can be a bit of a wait depending on the day and time. It's worth it though!

This review is based on several visits of just adequate experience. I get the hype of this place, you go here to be seen. It's got one of the largest outdoor seating in the Wick and good looking people like to say they are here/went here. That said, there are soooo many other al fresco spots to hit up, especially if you can handle a walk down to Division. The tacos range from average to good, the service is the exact same. I simply will not wait in the crazy lines that are usually going on so I'm not going to complain about lines. We go when we can get in easy or we sit at the bar. The marg pictures are really expensive and overly filled with ice, so we stopped getting them. An appropriate phase for this spot seems to be: it is what it is.

Tacos here are decent. I'm from Southern California and Mexican food there has definitely raised my standards so it's hard to say how good it actually is compared to other taco places in the area. Came in and was greeted right away and was given water cups and a water pitcher right away when we got sat. Our server was nice and checked up on us a couple times to make sure we were doing okay. They have a good selection of craft beers and beers on tap. Atmosphere is cool for dinner and late night hangouts. A little bit loud but that adds to the upbeat atmosphere. Tried 5 tacos: Fish 4.5/5 - tilapia was battered and fried, chipotle mayo sauce complimented the fish really well. So good!  Pork belly 2.5/5 - texture was a little hard and over cooked. Wish it was crispy pork belly Al pastor 3.5/5 - good flavor, pineapple cooked into the meat was really good. Wish it had some sauce  Lamb 3/5 - had a gamey taste but the texture was almost like a ground beef or chorizo  Steak 4.5/5 - steak was delicious and sauce on top was good!

Service Subpar. Inattentive, we had to signal for everything: appetizers, food, bill. The servers were either chatting or absent. The girl who brought the food out literally brings your food, makes no eye contact and runs away. Ok? Food We got the pescado tacos, pretty flavorless. Without the sauce , the taco will taste like plain dough. The fish was also heavily breaded. Why? I liked my shake. It was good, dulce de leche  2 stars for the atmosphere and shakes.
One of my favorites in the city! Always clean, quick and reasonably priced. Nice that it's not cash only anymore! Can be very crowded on a beautiful weekday and weekends so get there early!

Great tacos! We tried 4 different ones all all were delicious. The guacamole was so good we finished that bowl. And super tasty margaritas.  We were so lucky to have a warm day in march and sat outside. Got there at 1:30 so I thought we would miss the crowd. I was wrong. The line ran down the sidewalk. Apparently it always does, it's just that good.  They take your cell number when you check in and text when table is ready so we were free to wander the neighborhood. Lots of fun window shopping in the area.  They told us 30-60 minute wait and we were texted in 45 minutes. This is a well run system. And worth the wait!

Whenever we go to Chicago, we always check out happening  spots in Wicker Park. We arrived at 6:30 and there was already a long line up. Loved that they had a texting system in place once we were on the list and pleasantly surprised that we got a table for 2 in 15-20 minutes. Food was all fresh and tasty. We had the Big Star salad, tostada de honchos, and four types of tacos. The al pastor and pescado were good but the pollo and zanahorias were outstanding. The service was friendly and efficient.

Overall I'm a fan of Big Star. The tacos are delicious - the tortillas are soft and there is plenty of filling for each taco. I also love that they have a walk up counter for those of us who don't want to wait forever for a table. My only complaint is that in the few times I've been to Big Star the people taking orders have never been particularly attentive. They always seem to be kind of distracted and not paying attention to when people want to place an order.

Almost an hour and a half wait, but the tacos were fantastic!!! I had the pork belly, potato and chorizo/spicy lamb. They were all amazing and I really couldn't choose a favorite. I want to go back and try all the rest!

I kind of want to give them 2.5 stars.  Right down the middle. Pros: -Food Came quickly (a little too quickly) -The flavors on what my husband and I ordered were good.  My favorite (I am vegetarian) was the taco de papas de rajas (potato), and my husbands favorite was the taco de panza (pork belly)--which he said was possibly the best prepared pork belly that he's ever had. -Overall, good tacos, but not amazing or life changing.   Cons: -None of the food was hot (just above room temperature).  I imagine the potatoes and carrots were probably crispy when they were first cooked, but then sat around at nearly room temperature for an hour, and didn't have that texture. -I did not know that they served up the tacos family style, and was not pleased that my vegetarian tacos were mixed in with my husbands meat tacos.  It might be best if their waiters mentioned that, or had the awareness to understand that someone ordering only veggie tacos may not like the idea of a shared plate. Other: -Probably expect to order three to four tacos to make a meal (about $2.50 to $4 each). -People were complaining about not getting free chips and salsa.  Eh.  If you understood what it takes to make a good salsa, you wouldn't complain.  It's not a cheap taco shop.  $3 for a basket and two salsas. -People were complaining that the tacos were small.  They are normal "street" sized tacos.  I guess they are used to Tex-Mex tacos. -My husband and I (both over 6' tall) were placed at a two-top near a window where we had no leg room, and had to ask to switch tables.  This was not a problem, but seemed odd that the tall host didn't seem to think better of where to place us.

The tacos are delicious but on the pricey side. I really enjoyed the tilapia taco and the pork belly taco. The flavors are impeccable.  On the negative side I seemed to have gotten food poisoning from some of the food here. Don't read on if you're about to go eat. This place gave diarrhea that hasn't stopped yet (it's been 24 hours) and nausea. Just typing this on yelp is making me want to throw up. I would recommend you not to get the tilapia taco cause that seems to be the only taco I had that no one else in my party had. Too bad this place has ruined my impression of tacos forever.

Great place for tacos! Tacos are around $4. The fish taco was delicious! It was perfectly fried and the tortillas were warm and delicious. The drinks were also amazing! Cash only though. This is not just for taco Tuesday! Tacos errday!

I have not done a review in a long time but I feel that this was necessary.  Before I begin I'd like to state that I've been to all of the One Off Hospitality restaurants, and had an absolutely wonderful experience at all of them.  Unfortunately Big Star is the one exception.   Two days ago my buddy and I stopped in for a few midnight snacks and from the moment we walked in it was already off to a rough start.  I saw some open seats at the bar and asked if we could take them.  The host denied us and sat us at a table saying that those seats were reserved but the rest of the night I did not see a single person occupy those seats.  The food looked promising even at $4 a taco, which by most Mexican restaurant standards is overpriced but I assumed it was priced that way because they use high quality ingredients.  But no complimentary chips and salsa? Seriously?  Any place that serves Mexican food that's worth its salt serves you at least one complimentary basket of chips with salsa.  It took way too long for our server to even touch our table once, especially since she passed by us multiple times before actually taking our order.  She had a terrible attitude.  She was clearly not happy to be there and rolled her eyes at us when we had questions about the menu items.  Too be fair it seemed like she was the only server on the floor since she seemed to be making rounds around the restaurant attending to guests in all sections, and occasionally stopping to chat with the bar.  Our food arrived in a timely manner but as soon as we chowed down we found several flaws with the tacos.  First of all the tortillas were cold, second they were single layer tortillas, and third they were the smallest tacos I've ever had (where were the burn marks from the comal?).  The meat was okay, honestly I could get pastor and asada at a better quality for much less at the Mexican place down the street from my house (and they serve pizza).  The panza was unique and tasty but panza tastes better in menudo. Last but not least when we wanted to close out our server gave us attitude because we wanted to split the check based on what we ate.  She just left her tablet on the table and walked away.  For the amount I paid for three tacos ($15 plus 18% tip) I could have had a whole torta and two tacos on top that at any authentic late night Mexican place.  I went to the 7/11 across the street after that and had three tacitos because I just wasn't satisfied with my meal.  Will not be returning to Big Star.
Fantastic tacos. The fish taco and the potato taco are highlights for sure, but the potato taco is veryyyy spicy if you like that. Quick service despite being crowded.

There's definitely an Uptown hipster feel to this place. I went during a weekday and got my food super quick. The guacamole here is AMAZING. The tacos on the menu aren't authentic tacos, but they are definitely flavorful and satisfying. The pineapple in the pork taco threw me off for a second, but I learned to like it. Steak was definitely my favorite. Oh, and they keep a pitcher of water at the table. Since I drink a lot of water when I eat, that was greatly appreciated!

Yummy. I only eat, not drink. Came here on Saturday and forgot that people celebrate St. Patricks's Day. It was kind of crazy, but the service staff seemed to be handling the atmosphere very well. Every time I come back, the food is consistently good over the years. My group mauled a chips and guac at the bar and then we destroyed a bunch of tacos. I'm a fan of their pork belly and fish tacos. They don't skimp out on portions either. Also had a barbacoa taco but it was a little dry. I then ordered a second pork belly to make up for it and it was still delish. Law of Diminishing Returns does not apply here. Service was very friendly and very fast, didn't have to wait long for our food. Bar tenders very also great.

We've all said it before, Big Star has it's ups and downs. The wait time alone is enough to make some people cringe, but it. is. worth. it.  First of all, I live my life in search for an amazing jalapeno margarita. It's never on the menu and most bartenders roll their eyes at me (Hey! I've muddled a few times in my day!). The bartender here gave me a huge smile and immediately hooked me up with one of the most balanced and delicious jalapeno margs I have ever had. Spicy but delightful, and more importantly, the service didn't make me feel like an absolute idiot for asking. It makes a world of difference when your service treats you like a guest rather than an obligation, and in an area where most of my service has been, um, sub-par, it ensures my repeat business! The tacos are good, although I found the Taco De Pollo to be a little bland in flavor, the Taco Al Pastor and Taco de Pescado are ACES Check this place out (on a weeknight if you can swing it) and make sure to notice the lovely staff!

Tacos here come in a family style platter, though mosts of the time you'll make your orders individually. They range from $2.5-4 and are on the smaller side, which in Chicago is still reasonable for gourmet tacos. You'll probably end up buying 3-4 tacos for a meal, though if you really want to stuff yourself the orders will just keep coming. The most popular ones tend to be the Al Pastor and the Pescado, both which I ordered, along with a walking taco. The Al Pastor was well-seasoned, but wasn't particularly tender. Most of my pieces were in fact pretty dry. This hopefully was an outlier as most of my friends enjoyed it. As far as the Pescado...the fish itself was flaky and juicy, but otherwise the taco was unremarkable. To be honest, I think the tacos down the street at antique taco tasted better, though they were also more expensive and required two to an order. The other appeal with Big Star are the drinks, particularly the margs. On their own they're $9-10, though a pitcher which is 6 drinks is $36. The margs here are fairly strong too, and with 1-2 down you can definitely get a good buzz on. This place is packed most every day, and between family style tacos and drinks it has the sort of atmosphere that makes it very appealing for get-togethers small and large. On the merits of its tacos alone, there are better options around.

Finally had the time to drop by this place over the weekend.   There is always a party going on here which instantly puts anyone in a good mood.  It is worth noting that is *very* loud here, so it's not really a place for casual conversation.   The menu is *only* tacos and drinks, which is always good.  The tacos are small but stuffed!  Very good tacos. It is usually a bit of a wait, especially for larger parties; make sure to call ahead!

Coming from Texas, we have a lot of fusion taco restaurants that really kill the game. Big Star does great on their margaritas- really worth the pitcher if you have a group. I've only had a couple tacos that I've really loved, the rest have been okay.

I have gotten a number of recommendations for this place and so I finally decided to stop in this past Sunday.  My ultimate goal was to make it home for the Oscars, so that meant a takeout order. Process: There's a smaller section adjacent to the restaurant that you place your order. Order on one side, receive the electronic device and wait. It was a short line so I waited there. Wait time was about 10 mins  The young ladies there were nice and had great customer service.  Food: I ordered the pork belly and steak tacos, chips and salsa and an Horchata. The tacos are small.  So I could easily see someone who is really hungry ordering 3 unless you have other food to supplement.  I'm not the biggest fan of corn tortillas (I prefer flour) but these work for the choice of meat. Pork Belly, I thought was just ok. The steak however was more magical and left me wishing I had gotten two of them. Chips and Salsa ! Good and good Horchata... I've had better.  Though I only enjoyed the pleasure of the outside cafe this is nice restaurant in the area if you want a good sit down place that serves tacos and some Mexican inspired dishes. Perhaps for the visiting relatives or a business meeting.  But if you want some good down home tacos and Mexican food, I would look to one of the mom and pop places.

Well, my sister took me to Big Star a few weeks back to try it out. Was pretty good, so today, I ordered it on doordash for lunch at work. It just showed up, and man, not good! Steak is way over done, and I got more grease with my tacos than tacos. Couldn't eat it.

I give Big Star 2 stars solely because their food is actually decent. If someone tells you it is the best taco in Chicago, they are full of it. It has a lot of hype around it and is known as the cool spot to be seen and go in Wicker Park, especially during the summer due to the patio. Staff is generally unpleasant and act as though they are doing you a favor by allowing you to spend your money there. Due to the demand for a spot to eat there they have lost any sense of hospitality. Menu is fairly limited, but food is good. A bit over priced for the quality in my opinion. Overall I can't justify waiting over a hour to be served over priced tacos by some rude server. I've never spoken to a Chicago native who truly likes this place. I'll go to a local taqueria and crush 3 pastor tacos for $7 and call it a day.

Big Star was an excellent late night 4th meal option. Fast friendly service by a wonderful waitress with R. Kelly on her shirt. Our food was delicious and it was crowded but not so loud I had to scream across my table. I feel like the potatoes in my potato taco could have been crispier but the tortillas were fresh and had a great texture. Wicker Park has lots of options... If you want tacos don't skip this one.

Food is always good here along with the service! They also have a pretty good beer selection. I got two Taco de Pescados because the chipotle mayo is amazing and the fish is nice and crispy.  The place always have good vibes and it is much easier to get a table during the fall and winter months. This place can get REALLY crowded during Spring/Summer. Definitely try Big Star!
Tacos al pastor top-notch. Alambre de res, de panza, and pescado also solid.

After 5 years of discovering Big Star, we somehow always make it a habit to grab a bite here either after a night in wicker or even as a break while still in wicker park. Tacos I've tried: panza, al pastor, alambre de res (steak), pescado, and pollo I always get a mix of fish tacos and then depending on my mood it's always a toss up between panza (pork belly) and the al pastor (marinated pork and pineapple). Always busy here, food is reliably satisfying, price is slightly $$, but service is quick, I'll see you again next time I'm in town!

I do not get the hype. Went here on a weekend with about 5 other people and the place was so crowded you could barely get in the door let alone a table, which I guess is expected for the weekend here? We were able to find a tiny spot on the wall which had a little counter to eat but no chairs. We were definitely getting pushed and shoved standing here since it was next to the kitchen expo and sort of on the way to the bathroom depending which way you took, but we decided to stick it out. For it being so packed and the fact I was about to stand and eat at a little counter that I needed to defend with my life for the next hour and a half I was expecting amazing authentic tacos. I was disappointed when my al pastor and Carne asada taco came ($3-4.50 each). All in all appearance and taste was decently good, however I much rather would have went to a hole in the wall place that served up cheaper, more authentic tacos at probably an 1/8th of the wait time. They were honestly kind of mediocre. Although tasty, there was nothing special about them, and I think they could have loaded them up more with each ingredient given the prices. Also the tortillas were not a great texture; comparable to the corn tortillas that have been sitting in my fridge for months: not warm and crispy, but floppy and bland it kind of took away from my meal. The cocktails were scrumptious, my friends kept ordering drinks because they were well-crafted and tasty. We had to order from the bar and didn't have an actual sever, but the entire bar staff was very attentive and accommodating especially for such a busy night I give the staff an A+. Prices were reasonable for Wicker Park. I was just not blown away by the food and have no clue what all the hype was about. My boyfriend went to the cantina taco bell instead once he saw the situation here lol and I now know I should've just joined him.

Don't bother with takeout. My eight dollar guacamole was half full and my tacos were sloppily assembled. In order to enjoy Big Star, you basically have to physically go there and sit in the patio section during nice weather. Otherwise it's overpriced, mediocre tacos that aren't better than the rest.

I love big star! They have the best tacos in Chicago! The service may be on the slower side because of the amount of people there but it's worth it. If you're in a real rush just go through the take out window and sit in open seating.  I recommend any of the tacos. Definitely go with one of the tequila drinks and always if they have a drink special get whatever it is.

EXCELLENT AND FANTASTIC! Seriously tasty tacos, people! The wait time sucks, but that goes with amazing eats. They'll text or you can wait at the bar. We ordered a plate of tacos of which the pastor and one just above it on the menu (darn I forget!) were my favorites. I also enjoyed a glass bottle of Coke, which is always refreshing. Our waitress was helpful and friendly. Looking forward to going back soon!

Great tacos, good music, hipsters galore. Place is usually loud and packed and all the bartenders/servers I have encountered have hardcore attitude problems. (However, I have only eaten at the bar.) Worth visiting for the food, but don't be surprised if you server is unfriendly and seems inconvenienced by you.

The food is delicious, but the wait is a little hard to stomach. The only reason you want to go to the actual restaurant over the carry out window next door is for the tequila list. If you're there for the food go to their carry out section and grab a picnic table.

This place is packed even after 1 pm on a Sunday afternoon.  Honestly, im not sure what the draw is. Don't get me wrong, the tacos are not bad but I really had better.  We tried the fish, chorizo/lamb, pork, steak and nothing really wowed me, the cost range from 2.5 to 4 per taco.  The chips and guac is $8, I make better guac.  Im glad I tried this place but not a return customer.  I still enjoy the tacos at Takito much better than here.  If you have some refined taste in taco then this place is not for you, otherwise this place is good enough.

This was my last stop on the taco bar crawl that didn't last very long (surprisingly filling guys). We got here pretty late, maybe 10:00 pm, and it was jam packed. Waited for a table and got margaritas from the bar. Maybe a 6.5/10 on the drinks but we didn't get anything fancy. The tacos were pretty good, I don't think it's really their main focus at the end of the day. Also they played classic rock the entire 2 hours we were there: 1 led zeppelin album and 1 creedence album with some other stuff in there too. Weird for a taco place but I enjoyed it!
Terrible. Bartender forced me to get a pitcher of their disgusting margaritas that come from a tap? I've never been more offended. And the host had no idea what he was doing.

Breakfast tacos are the BOMB! If you haven't tried their breakfast tacos, I suggested getting on it ASAP. They are served 9am-11am Saturday and Sundays at the to go window. As far the restaurant goes, definitely very hipster. Great tacos and micheladas, queso fundido is delicious as well as the salad. Wait can be a long time especially on a nice day.

I'll gladly spend 30 minutes looking for parking for their al pastor and chicken tacos. The horchata is decent, get a cocktail or beer. Good year round spot, outdoor patio during the summer is great. Servers are always friendly and have no problem answering questions.
Tacos were amazing. Atmosphere --ok. Wait staff, pretty good. Pricey tho. It can get a little crowded

I visited Big Star about a year ago on a cold, winter day and it was everything we wanted and more.  The trendy locale had delicious tacos and a huge bar (as an Argentinian, it is hard to find "Fernet Branca" in a bar, but sure enough they had it) and great service. The restaurant is a great hang out spot for a nice casual beer and super aesthetically-pleasing views. I hope to visit in the Summer next time-- their patio looks very promising.

Absolutely a no go for me. Please note this is not traditional Mexican food, which is fine as long as the concept works. In this case it did not. The service was horrible and the drinks were mediocre at best. Our server may have been in training which would of been okay had we not received a bitter face every time they came by and paid attention to the fact I returned my food at first bite. I was surprised that giving my plate back didn't prompt them to question my experience with both meals I ordered. My table and I felt that the service was unwelcoming and the food wasn't at all as described on the menu. After asking for the bill soon after receiving our food the server brought it back and left. No questions were asked about our experience or how our food was. Needless to say I won't come back.

Can't believe yelp has this place as 3.5 stars. It's definitely much better than that. The tacos here are flavorful! The meats were flavorful and the tortillas were pretty good. I guess price is the factor then, you pay by taco so if you wanna try it all, it can get pricy. Also it's outside seating so depending on the time of the year it can get cold. This place is in a location with a lot of other restaurants and bars so I think it's a good pre meal or post bar kind of place.
I was never a fan of fish tacos until I tried this place, Its very busy but the service was great. I will definitely be coming back.
The drinks at this place are awesome.  The wait time can be long but you can always stand or sit by the bar. The tacos are not bad. Service is good.

What a fun place! First time in Wicker Park and this was the perfect place for the most amazing margaritas (EVER) and nachos. The restaurant was packed due to the warm January weather but that didn't stop us. We enjoyed the bar and the music (extra plus for awesome music). I really am looking forward to coming back and trying the tacos soon.

Unfortunately, I'm not feeling it. Yes the tacos are a step above fast food tacos, but this is a minimum expectation. I want something more than minimum. First of all the guacamole is most definitely not recommended. It is grocery store guacamole meaning that some kind of preservative is used which gives it a little bit of a sour taste. The home made tortilla chips are tasty. Also the menu is limited. Where are the burritos, enchiladas, tortas, or soup? It would be nice if a rotating weekly taco special was featured like they have at Velvet taco. They finally take credit cards. I do recommend this establishment because the tacos are good. Just don't expect to be blown away.

As many Chicagoans enjoyed Saturday's great weather, Big Star was the best option to enjoy the weather, food and the company of great friends. We arrived at 2 pm. As usual and as expected, there was a wait. We walked around Wicker Park and came back about 45 minutes later. We got a drink and waited some more (typically, 45 minutes is the average wait time). After an hour, my friend asked if we were close to being called and we were told there was 30 parties ahead of us! Really!! There were many available tables for small parties, we were only a party of 3. I was ready to leave but we did not because my friends ordered a Margarita pitcher. I went to the bar to order something to eat because by this time, almost 2 hours later, I was feeling dizzy...I was not drunk dizzy, I was hungry dizzy. Bartender was practically useless. I asked a female waitress if I could order something to eat and although she hesitated, she took my order. Waited about another 15 minutes for one taco. Seriously after this experience, I am certain I will never eat at Big Star. As much as I like the food and have been a customer since it opened, getting a text message at 5:04 saying my table is ready is completely absurd. I did not want to write this review but I hope someone with power at Big Star reads this review. My biggest issue is that there were several tables available to seat customers. Short staff did not appear to be the problem. It's very unfortunate that I had such a horrible experience but I will not visit again.

Big Star? Should be called Little Star for the one star rating I give this place. The reviews I read about the service being poor at times was 100% accurate. For starters, our server looked like they walked out of a smoke shop after eating a batch of pot brownies. We asked for waters to start and our server brought us 1 water.... this validated my assumption that our server was higher than a giraffes pussy. We then moved on to ask the hostess for a water and he brought us a pitcher.... how generous. Our server could've used the water, not us. Finally it was time to dive into our chips and salsa along with the queso /chorizo dip. The salsa was sub par at best and the chorizo dip was mediocre. The chicken tacos come from the thigh region, who the hell wants a thigh piece of chicken? I think most prefer white chicken but maybe that's my preference. The al pastor tacos did satisfy my hunger but they smelled like a donkeys ass if you ask me. And the fact that it was darker than night inside it was hard to tell what was actually in front of us. Now, the one reason I give the 1 star is b/c of the classic margarita.... this is usually what keeps overrated Mexican spots like this in business. If this place wasn't a unique venue and a great spot to hang when the sun is shining then I do not believe this place would succeed. Oh ya, and all of Wicker Park is stoned off there ass which makes satisfying the hunger of this town much easier.  And now for the icing on the cake, who wants to drink bourbon with tacos?

AMAZING tacos! Nice ambiance too. I had the fish tacos. They were delicious and I liked the presentation as well. The sauce on my tacos was indescribable. I'd drink it straight....I'd bathe in it....you name it, if me and this sauce are involved I'm there. It was amazing. The guac there was definitely some of the best I have ever had too. Crazy reasonable prices as well...about $4 per taco (kind of dangerous because I'd probably buy way more than what's socially acceptable). We got a pitcher of margaritas for the whole table as well and they were delicious. Great for a big group, I came with 6 people. Had such a good experience here and I would absolutely come back next time I'm in Chicago!

The atmosphere on the summer patio is unbeatable. While there are more authentic tacos elsewhere in Chicago, Big Star is a staple of the Wicker Park culture.  My go to order usually includes Big Star margs, carnitas tacos and guacamole. When I'm feeling healthy sometimes I also opt for the salad which is actually pretty decent.  The to go window is great, however delivery can often times be cold.

I love this place. Always have, always will. Fish taco is what what's up and the best veggie tacos I can find! Any time someone visits me this is a must stop. I took my sister and brother in law here 4 years ago and still talks about it.
Love going here with my girlfriends. Such a fun laid back place. I've never had anything I didn't like! The service is hit or miss but when the weathers nice who even cares!
Went on a night where it wasn't crowded and while the stuff in the tacos were good... the tortillas tasted kinda funny and they didn't heat them. Who doesn't heat their tortillas?!

I live nearby so I never really sit down in Big Star.  I just go to the take-out window which is generally pretty quick.  Tacos aren't the cheapest but they are delicious.  Maybe it is just cause I live so close but I would never wait an hour just to eat on the patio.  People seem to love the patio but I think that can be a bit overrated.

Recently stopped in here for a quick bite. I have to say the melted cheese over the chips as a starter was really good. However, I ordered chicken tacos and I have to say that they were not that good. All I had was cheese and sour creme on them but the meat itself was just not good. I do not eat beef or pork and haven't in so many years but I think they might have mixed up my order? Not sure. It just didn't taste like chicken and was bad. The service was good. I didn't drink but a few tables around me ordered a few drinks and seemed to really enjoy them. I would check it out again, just to give it another shot.

Amazing tacos, wish they had platters with rice and beans but still one of the best tacos in all of Chicago. Al Pastor and fish tacos are to die for. They also have Schlitz beer which I love and its pretty cheap. Only downside is how quickly those $4 tacos can add up...
Love big star! The food and drinks are always on point and it's honestly just a great atmosphere to be around! For date night or girls night out, to lunch with a friend-you can't go wrong here!

We came here at around 2:30 on a Saturday and the wait was about a half hour. The weather was chilly, but we still walked around the nearby shops while we waited, so it went by quickly.  Our service was fast, friendly, and got us our food less than 20 minutes after we sat down! The tacos were fantastic; our favorite by far were the fish tacos. The menu is smaller, but they still had options to choose from. We'll be back soon!

What!? I've never written a review for Big Star? Here's what you need to know. If it's nice out, it's busy. You can always go to the to go window and still eat out on the patio if you don't plan on drinking too. The tacos are amazing, I repeat, the tacos are amazing. It used to be cash only, but that's not the case anymore! They also do delivery so you can skip the lines.

it's ok.  a great place to sit on the patio on a summer day with beers and tacos.  it's a little overhyped for me but the food is good.  i think it's the huge crowd that's always waiting outside that turns me off and away.

It's the best guac best salsas best chips best pastor best veg options and there is a freaking walking taco in a Fritos bag. Full bar great whiskey and mezcal and dangerously strong margaritas. Outside seating can't be beat either.

I don't get the hype. The tacos are less-than-great. The wait is insane, usually. The appetizers are also too heavy (no one is focusing on flavors here, it seems - just appearance). I would recommend walking over to Antique Taco or hopping on a train to Pilsen for the real deal. Probably the best example of gentrified Mexican food in Chicago.

Their tacos are really great (favorite was the fish taco..soo good!), so is the guacamole, except the portion is pretty small...you're definitely going to have a surplus of chips so be ready for that disappointment. They have a $10 tres Reyes (shot of tequila, shot of sangrita, and a can of Mexican beer) which we always go for. The reason I give this place 3 stars out of 5 is due to the service. We were there on a Monday night, the place wasn't very busy but our server was preoccupied the entire time, chatting with a table of people she knew. Food came out quick but it was impossible to flag down our server who disappeared all night until it was time for the bill.
Pastor and margaritas are hard to beat.  I just wish they'd bring back that Sonoran dog from a couple years ago...
It was fine, not sure what the hubbub is all about. Would not say no to a friend if it came up again but won't rush back.  I miss the Pontiac.

Big Star catered our wedding in October and we couldn't have been happier! Jenn Williams and her catering team are rock stars and they made the whole event so much fun! Jenn was so communicative and really listened to what we wanted and made it happen. She worked with the venue coordinator to make sure all of our decorations got set up and everything looked just right so we didn't have to worry about anything the day of. The event staff was just awesome. We had the sweetest ladies serving from the taco truck and our bartender was outstanding. Everyone was complimenting him on his cocktails all night long. We really wanted to avoid the traditional "bad catered wedding food" and Big Star's fare was both delicious and fun. It is also much more affordable than most of the more traditional wedding caterers in the city. Our guests couldn't get enough and they loved the reveal of the taco truck. My favorite catering moment of the day was when my husband and I ran up to our little suite after the ceremony to have a few minutes together before entering the reception. We were both shaking and crying because the ceremony had been so emotional, and we got up the stairs and went inside to find that Jenn had left drinks and a plate full of appetizers for us. It was so sweet and made for a perfect private moment. I definitely recommend Big Star to any bride and/or groom looking for great food, service, and fun at your wedding!

We all know and love Big Star! The tacos, the margs, the cool ambiance in and outside. It's a hip spot with delicious grub. But, did you know they cater events too?! And did you know their catering totally rocks in every way possible?!  Big shout out to the catering team, especially Jenn Williams and Laura Toal. Big Star catered my and my husband's wedding celebration (think a big 'ol bash with 115 family and friends after having a private wedding a couple weeks prior). We rented an amazing blank canvas of a venue, Trigger, so we had a ton of flexibility in terms of food, beverages, caterers, etc. We knew we didn't want to serve traditional banquet-style food, so we thought we could serve delicious food from some of our favorite restaurants. Who doesn't love tacos and friend chicken? Big Star and Honey Butter Fried Chicken were served. Oh ... and Bang Bang Pies for dessert! And, Big Star catered all of it. They even brought a couple bartenders along to serve our booze we ordered from Binny's.  Laura did a fabulous job helping me figure out exactly what food I wanted, how I wanted it served, what quantities, etc. And she assured me their staff would be comfortable serving other vendors' food as well. She was super helpful with the coordination with the other main food vendor, Honey Butter Fried Chicken. She got all our ducks in a row and handled the contract. And then Jenn, the event coordinator, stepped in as we got closer to the big day and got down and dirty with the details. She was simply AWESOME! She placed the order for the linens and coolers and helped fine-tune everything. Our venue didn't have a full kitchen or large freezer for ice, so she helped me work through some obstacles and everything went just swimmingly!  Jenn and her catering staff were professional, super sweet during our party and mega hardworking. They set up the food and beverages, bartended and barbacked, served and replenished the food, cleaned up and more. Nothing was left undone and they even helped break down the tables, chairs etc. at the end of the night. They went above and beyond. Thanks Jenn, Laura and the rest of the Big Star catering crew. You guys rocked our socks off!
Not sure how you can give this place less than 5 stars. Awesome margaritas (add mezcal) and tacos.

Big Star is a Wicker Park staple! I've been here a dozen times and it's always awesome. The wait staff are super friendly and the foot always comes fast. The bar has a great selection of cocktails and beers, and there many different types of tacos you can order. It's in a great location, great for groups and dates, and is perfect for any night of the week. 4.0 stars, and I'll keep coming back.

Great casual environment. Fish taco was incredible and filling. Off-brand beers for $3, which taste like Bud Light. The only aspect holding me back from giving a 5-star is the margarita and service. The margarita was definitely not worth $9. It was served in a plastic cup, but I guess that fits with the casual patio furniture you sit on. Our tacos came out 2 minutes after we ordered. We didn't get to enjoy our drinks. It makes you question the freshness of the food.
Fucking amazing tacos. We got the Bakersfield Buck ginger whiskey drink that was a perfect mix with the spicy tacos. Will definitely be back!

Big Star has a great vibe to it and the outdoor seating area is great during the summer. The tacos are tasty (Pastor and fish are great) and the service is pretty quick. I like that I can get in and out in under 30 if I'm not waiting in line or just sit and chill for a few hours and talk with friends. PSA - It is almost always busy here but it's also open super late which makes it nice for a chill drink and snack stop!

Great tacos, would love to come when I don't have to drive great vibe. Bartender super cool, waitresses are great, tons of mezcal perfect hoecata made from scratch. Have to come back. Walk across and have donuts.

Look, this place is pretty good. Nothing they make is bad per se. The problem here is the same problem you run into at a lot of the taqueria's and hot dog / beef joints in Chicago. They take a beautifully simply food and complicate it unnecessarily. The tacos are overstuffed and unruly to eat.  Take my review with a grain of salt though because for me, the perfect taco is some al pastor cut off a spit grilled up with a bit of pineapple and garnished with lime. Nothing better in the world.  If you've never been here, it's worth a try but if you are craving some simple straight forward tacos, you may be disappointed.
Indoor seating that feels like outdoor seating, perfect margaritas, and delicious tacos. What's not to love!
Delicious food especially their al pastor tacos! They were quick with our food and the service was great! I tried their walking taco for the first time and it was very tasty! I love their micheladas!

I had a great experience at Big Star earlier this summer. As Yelp indicates, it truly is a terrific spot for vegetarians. I had the walking taco and it was delicious! Ingredients tasted fresh and I felt the portion was perfect. I didn't love my margarita but the taco was going to be the main show and I knew that. Service was quick. We sat outdoors on the patio and the ambience was meh. It looked cooler inside but I'm sure it's nicer in the evening with it lit up. Parking is a pain of course with it being close to Damen and Milwaukee. I awarded myself with a nice parking ticket post meal, ugh! Regardless of that I look forward to visiting again!

Love. Service is FAST, EFFICIENT and super convenient. They swipe your card right at the table and you can sign, tip and get your receipt right there. Craft tacos, fast yet deliciously prepared. Music is OUTSTANDING. It's a Chicago must!

Good food, good prices. Came here with a group last week and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Got the taco de pollo, which was great. The chicken was moist and flavorful and the taco was topped with sweet onions. Also got the walking taco which was essentially fritos drenched in melted cheese, beans, and spicy salsa. A little too runny and saucy. Not quite as good as the chicken taco, but still decent. The chips and guac were a pleasant surprise. The guacamole was flavorful with a bit of a kick to it, which I appreciated it. Chips were warm and crispy.  Their margarita's were also very good. Sweet and tangy with just the right amount of tequila. Also got one of the ciders, which was also sweet and refreshing. All of that food and my bill came to just over $30. Decent price. Very fun and active atmosphere. They have an awesome outdoor section which stays pretty packed too. Good times. I'd come back again :)

Friend said to go here, wasn't awful but was far from great. Super expensive for what you get, their queso is good but comes with tortillas instead of chips which frankly sucked, also it was $9 for a very small amount. Service was slow and the guy busing the table would not leave us the hell alone, our food would be half eaten and he'd be like "Can I get that out of your way" Several times he picked up our beer cans and shook them to see if anything was in them, what the hell? Won't ever go back.

This place has such a great vibe to it! It was hard getting a seat though we waited quite a bit and we had a little trouble getting seated.  We chose to give up our indoor table and wait a little more for outdoor and somehow our name got taken off the wait list. After waiting for a little bit I called to confirm and the hostess mentioned we were no longer on the list. Even with the discrepancy she sat us at the next outdoor table immediately.  We sat and enjoyed the outdoor weather and the food was great and enjoyable.  I ordered Mexican beer which was a little spicy for me and I was unable to enjoy it and the waiter was nice enough to offer to take it off the check for us.  Great service, environment, and food!

service is fast especially for the tacos and the environment is very hip. we came on a sunday night around 7pm, but since the outside patio is open, we didn't need to wait for a table of 4. the food is typical americanized mexican food, tasty but doens't really stand out

I like to come to big star on social occasions. I'll come with my boys or on dates for some informal banter and social "consumption" (aka drinking). They have decent margaritas, full bar, and Lone Star beer which is cheep and featured on Friday Night Lights. Both Friday Night Lights and Lone Star beer are guilty pleasures of mine.  I like Big Star because of it's vibe. Its a very social and positive vibe. I remember having some dumb conversation about some pop culture shit with the waitress. I appreciate the rapport building and the small talk. She was totally socially aware and wouldn't have made small talk with me if I wasn't in the mood. I'm not crazy about the bouncers here late at night, but they have a weird job dealing with the drunks and the riff raff and etc.  When you actually order your tacos here they come quick. That says two things: 1. The meat isn't being cooked fresh, but is at the ready like it would be at Chipotle.  2. This is a key late night spot for when you been drinkin and need food NOW ha

Food and drinks are amazing here. I love the daily whiskey special and they have a decent rotation of beer on tap. Service can be iffy, whole staff came off as very pretentious and acted as if I was lucky to be their customer. At times took a while to get anybody's attention for a drink.

Overall atmosphere was really cool. We sat outside and were able to get a table pretty quickly for a Saturday night and it was a packed house. We ordered chips and guac, which took about 20 minutes. Not a big deal, but the salsa took another 20 minutes. We ordered a pitcher of margaritas which (to our own fault) we were shocked to find out was $40. Overall, a really good atmosphere, but the service wasn't great and the expensive margaritas didn't live up to the expectation.

Good lord is this place crowded and busy as all hell.  You're definitely coming here more for the atmosphere/vibe than the quality of food and drinks.  Not that they're bad or anything, the tacos were quite flavorful and hit the spot.  Coupled with a well-made margarita, you're in for a good time at Big Star.  There's a hostess up front, but if you're not willing to wait, you can usually get a spot in the large bar out back.  Service was meh, but given the crush of people, temper your expectations.

We visited on a Sunday evening and there was no wait even though the patio looked packed. I ordered the hombre de res and fish tacos. I wasn't a huge fan of the fish tacos but they were ok. I also ordered the queso. That was delish! It's pretty spicey! The tortillas tasted homemade. The restaurant is located in Wicker Park so there's lots of great shops within walking distance.
Terrible service- over 30 mins to order 2 drinks which didn't turn up I would never go here again

The service here was a little disorganized as we dined at the bar.  It took a while to order, while waiting for our drinks, the bartender took the food menu away, then we ordered chips and guac and got two orders of it, just little things were off.  But, the tacos were great, they are small, we each had three and it was fun to try the different varieties.  Loved the mushroom taco!!   This place gets quite busy, and seems a little trendy with the hipster crowd.  All in all, a fun time with pretty decent grub.

This is the place I bring all my friends to experience Wicker Park/Bucktown.   The tacos are incredible, the beer/cocktail selection is epic and the scene is always fresh.  Always fun, there is no better place to hang in a warm evening!!

This place was just straight up cool. We went on a trip to Chicago because trustworthy Frommer's gave it a lot of stars. The atmosphere is cool hipster like. Classic margaritas are delicious but pricey for the pitcher. Salsa and guac were the usual amount of yum as most texmex places. The queso was unusually delicious so I would definitely recommend that. Tacos are good too.

Not sure what the hype was about but the tacos  I had here were disgusting!! I thought I could balance it out with avocado but they gave me cold slices of avocado on a barely warm taco. The only good thing about this place is that it's open late. I'm hoping this was just a bad day for them.

First time in here tonight. I had a Taco Al Pastor and Taco Alarambre de Res with an app of guac. For what you pay the portions are small but the atmosphere is very open and clean. Our server was very good and the food got to us in a pretty timely fashion. I'd say go and try it once but not really a place to make a regular stop.

I finally had the chance to check out this little sweet spot! This is located right in Wicker Park surrounded by other unique shops, treats, and scenery! I think the combo of good food, delish coffee, and books will always keep me coming back to Wicker Park. Environment - I think I am beyond the point of looking like a fool when I go out to eat alone lol but seems like this is a common thing at Big Star. A lot of local people just order food from the carry out window and take a seat in the outdoor sitting area. You are surrounded by the locals, children, and dogs! This was a fun place to people watch! I can not wait to return here with family! Food - I am all about fish tacos! TACOS are life..fish tacos add to it! I had the Taco de Pescado. Which is a tilapia fillet, chipotle mayo, cabbage, red onion, and cilantro! This was delish..the fillet was the perfect size! I also had the Walking Taco (this reminded me of grade school...nostalgia kicked in all the meanwhile!) This has corn chips, spicy pinto beans dip, tamazula salsa, crema, queso chihuahua, onion, cilantro all mixed into a Frito bag! I paired this with mandrain Jarritos! This was a quick meal which was on point!

Being native born Mexican I can tell you, it's not authentic... But for a Chicago joint they do a HELL' OF A GOOD JOB on taste!!! Very delicious and drinks have never been watered down yet (knock on wood)! Love it every time!

Stopped in here on an early Saturday evening around 6. Amazingly, because the place was so packed, we got a table for 2. Our drinks and appetizers (chips and guacamole) came very quickly. So did our food.  The only bad thing is that out waitress wasn't very attentive. She seemed to be paying attention to all her other tables more than ours. And it took forever for her to even come remotely near our table so we could ask for our check.  So, food was good. Service, not so much.
Was a great place for a Sunday Funday. Food good, but not outstanding. Definitely there more for the vibe then the meal. With that being said, great vibe...lively, fun, great DJ. We will be back

I now love this place gave them another chance. I must have been in a bad mood that day and I apologize. First off they now accept credit cards! Awesomeness. The tacos are pretty reasonable price wise and tasty as hell.  It also seems that they turned down the music as well so I can actually have a conversation. I don't want to sound old or anything but turn that shit down a little yo!  Margaritas fucking awesome bartendress made me a custom spicy marg with a smoky mescal floter on top. No shitty beans and rice either just some good tacos guacamole and good times. Thank you!

I love big star for many reasons.  The things I don't like is that it's a bit too hipster driven.  I can get great tacos that are less expensive and just as good at so many other spots.  I still give it a 4 because I like it.  I like the patio.  I do like the tacos.  It's honestly all very good even though I'm inclined to not like it.  Very troubled about this one.
I was there last night and the food was so much better than a month and half ago....maybe they have a new chef. Then 2s now 4s....!

We came here on a friend's recommendation without knowing anything about it besides 'they have good tacos.' Almost passed on them when we got there and saw how insanely crowded it was, and how hesitant the host was to give us any ballpark range for wait times... but we got a table for two less than 2 minutes after we gave them the name - okay, so maybe they're not very organized about that. But who cares - I was enjoying a fantastic cocktail within 5 minutes of being seated, chips and dip a minute later, and 5 minutes later our tacos came. They did forget a side of sauce, but everything was so good, and fast, it more than made up for it. I would absolutely come back even though I really hate crowds - I'll fight through it for that zanahorias taco!

After getting dinner somewhere else in the area, we were still feeling a little hungry, so we decided to stop by Big Star to grab a quick snack. There is a dine-in option, and to-go place. Since we were just grabbing a snack we just got it to-go. Not so smart since it was drizzling, and the outdoor seating has no cover. At least there was no line. Meanwhile, the in-door area looked pretty packed. We got two tacos. They are $4 each, which is quite pricey for how small they were. However, they were of good quality. I really enjoyed the Taco de Pescado, as the flavors were great, and I felt like all the toppings balanced together. The one drawback was that the actual fish was a little soggy, and didn't have that hot crispiness that I so love in a fish taco. But I would get it again. On the other hand, The Taco de Panza was underwhelming. There was just way too much meat, and the meat was pretty dry.  Overall I need to come back and try some of their other options to really make a decision whether I like this place or not.

Unless if you eat pork..... Their options for non-pork items suck. I was so pumped to finally try this place during summer. The only reason I'm even giving them 1 star is because of the decor. The fish taco I had...... I could've had it better at a Long John Silver's...

With how incredibly packed this place gets, I think it is thoroughly overrated. It's crowded and fun (if you like crowded), but there can be long waits on weekend nights. The margaritas are standard margaritas in my opinion... Nothing to write home about.  Food is decent. Not a huge fan of the queso fundido, but many of the taco options are tasty. My favorite experience here was actually a weekday lunch date with my mom. It was chill, not crowded, we easily got seated on the patio. We ordered a variety of their tacos and three tacos (averaging $3-4/taco) filled me up for lunch!

This place is very popular. When I checked the reviews, the average was a 3. However, I was still willing to check out the hype. We ordered chips and salsa, the queso, and one pork belly taco. The queso was delicious, but the pork belly taco was disappointing. If I come back, I will definitely try the other tacos. We also ordered margaritas, which was pretty good. Most margaritas are too sugary, but this one was the perfect mix of good tequila and mix.

It was worth the hype! Had a day out with a friend and we came here. I've been wanting to try Big Star since it opened. It was a great day and we sat on the patio.Service and the food were both great. I wasn't sure what to expect -it wasn't straight up authentic Mexican tacos (like from your local  taqueria). It was gourmet elevated meets authentic tacos. They did some cool combinations of integrating modern twists on the classic tacos. A few tacos and some cold beers and we were in heaven!  Great place -especially on a summer day!

I loved the fish tacos! This place was pretty cool, I'm sad we went after patio season. The patio looks great and it seems like a great place to day drink! I will go back soon! Only reason I gave it 4-stars is because it's pretty loud, hard time having a conversation there but, still worth going.
Good tacos , pork was my fave . Good drinks . Seating can be challenging. Fun atmosphere. Would come back again.

Good place to eat tooo had the hostess / hosts have horrible customer service and won't tell you when you have a place in line. Im all about solid service but they don't deliver good thing the food does.

These tacos are life-changing. Who would've thought carrot tacos could be so amazing? Definitely worth seeking this place out no matter where you are staying (or living) in Chicago. I will be back next time I'm in town!

The menu is small but surprisingly has lot of vegetarian options . Unlike most places where veg dishes on menu are jus to please all audience, Big star tacos are are full of flavor and the service is super quick..  The outdoor seating is super fresh and fun. Will definitely hit the spot when the group has diverse dietary choices.. Yummylious guac, margs and tacos!

This place is so much hype and such a bad experience in actuality. I have been there twice now and after the experience we had the second time will definitely not be back.  The food is decent but certainly not the best tacos in Chicago and certainly not worth waiting an hour for. On top of that the hipster 'too-cool-for-school' attitude of the staff is enough to make me not return.  The last occasion we went there we didn't actually even eat there. We put our names on the list and were told "we can't say how long it will be but I can say you are 9th on the list." Right.... most restaurants will give you an estimate at least but not Big Star. So we go across the street for some drinks as they will text you when your table is ready. An hour later we come back to check the progress and are told we are 10th on the list. Hmmm... Try to explain this to the lady with her clipboard but she was so rude and simply dismissed us. Never again Big Star.

This patio was BUSY and sheesh the tables are close together. I've had far better tacos in Chicago (Velvet Taco, for one, Antique Taco, for two, and Asadero, for three), and guac as well, and margs, also. Yeah, not sure what all the fuss is about this spot. It was my third time here so I've now tried every taco, salad, and margarita pitcher variation. If you are all about buzz, crowds, and the like, you may have a better time here than I. The service was quick, I'll give them that.

Finally built up the courage and appetite to come to Big Star. I had heard so many amazing things about their tacos and considering I have been eating tacos all week (Big and Little's on Monday and Primo Chuki's on Tuesday), I had to come here as well. And I regret nothing about my decision! Contrary to what I had heard, it was not that busy on a Wednesday evening around 6:30pm. I went with a couple of friends and we found a table outside in beautiful weather. We started off with the Big Star Margarita (different from their regular margarita because it has a dash of mezcal which gives the margarita a delicious smoky taste) and also an order of their chips and salsa (the salsa verde was amazing!).  For tacos, I had the Pollo (chicken), Pescado (fish) and Alambre de Res (grilled steak). The grilled steak taco definitely stood out from the others. The steak within the taco was cooked perfectly and the muenster cheese inside went so well with the green peppers. The pollo and pescado tasted pretty good too but in retrospect, I would have been happy with just three Alambre de Res tacos.  The waitstaff was polite and attentive. The atmosphere was casual and friendly. I cannot wait to come back here and try some of the other tacos. My vegetarian friends have praised the Walking Taco (which is a taco inside a bag of Fritos) so that should be next on the list. Do give this place a try. I recommend coming on a weekday so you can get a spot easily.
Never disappoints. Pastor, Panza, Pescado every time. They have above average margs, but they are pretty expensive. Awesome outdoor seating, so go when it's nice!

Cheap tacos, nice freshly made corn chips and fast service. Tacos weren't bad and this is a good spot to drink the afternoon away in the sun! (If sunny) large open space and plenty of room for people.

Love their walking taco. It is so amazing. The wait to sit down does suck especially for a group that is four/five or more. That is why ordering at the window is so convenient. The seating for that is always empty even when it's beautiful out.
Tacos and drinks are really affordable, the staff are great, and the food is worth it; the best tacos I've had this far and the ice cubes are cool lol!

Great authentic tacos! Just like them make then in Mexico City! Very tiny menu but hey all you need is tacos.  The only down side to this good joint are the washrooms. I felt as if I was in a public bathroom( like the ones by the beaches of Chicago.). This of course isn't good at all. With so much business that they have they should really consider upgrading those washrooms.
Always a good time. Outdoor atmosphere is awesome. Drinks and foot are delicious. Great company.

I kept hearing about how great Big Star is so I finally went to see what the hype was all about.  I do have to say service was pretty good, we were seated on the outdoor patio within a few minutes of putting our names down even though the place was packed on a Saturday afternoon.  Our server was very nice as well as all of the other staff.  However when it came down to the food I wasn't very impressed.  I ordered 3 tacos (de panza, al pastor, and alambre de res) and a La Paloma cocktail.  The cocktail was diluted and mainly tasted like watery lemonade with a hint of alcohol.  All three tacos honestly tasted pretty similar and were dry.  I wouldn't say Big Star would be a spot I'd recommend for tacos, come more for the vibrant ambiance and daytime drinking.

Perfect place to be on a gorgeous sunny day when you're craving some quality time with friends, but also want to stuff your face with tacos, chips n salsa, and adult bevvies! I'll be honest, I came in with pretty low expectations on the food considering that this is a Tex mex Wicker Park hot spot, buuuuut they kinda sorta surprised me. While chips n salsa are hard to screw up, this has been a deal breaker for me in the past with other restaurants. Thaaankfully they figured out the perfect balance of crispy and salty, making the chips n salsa a win in my book! Tacos were decent in both taste and size (al pastor is my favorite, they even added the pineapple!). And while the tortillas weren't "El Milagro" quality, they were at least corn, which thrilled me. Margs were top notch, gettin us giggly just a few sips in.  But the Michelada was the big no star disappointment. As for the atmosphere, I LOVE THE VIBE. Lots of energy since it's so popular, and positive energy with drinks flowing and outdoor seating making it feel open and fun.  There are two sides, with the smaller of the two being the non-alcoholic section. Because this is such a popular place to be, you may have to wait a bit to get a seat, especially if you want to be outdoors, but I'd say it's worth it. Go check it out for yourself, and enjoy!

Just landed tonight and decided Wicker Park would be my first venture out into the city. Coming from LA, where tacos are a good staple, I was slightly disappointed at all the Yelp hype.  Let me first start by saying, the atmosphere is lively and fun. The space itself is very spacious and great for big groups. I appreciate the variety that the menu tries to offer. Out of all the tacos we ordered and sampled, my favorite was the potato (a vegetarian item), which actually surprised me too. The warm tortillas are amazing and loved how soft and light they were. Guacamole was smooth in texture but felt it had too much like and overwhelmed the avocado taste itself.  It's not bad but I wouldn't say it's the best either. I think you're there for the area and the hangout location, in my opinion.

Love this place! They are very knowledgable about what is gluten free in terms of food and drinks. The food is delicious and they have great vegetarian tacos which I know sounds unbelievable but as a non veggie I strongly encourage you to try the carrot taco. It will make you consider being vegetarian. Pitcher margarita is a good deal for Chicago. The salsa is stellar and you can get it to go if you want to take some home with you which you probably should do :)

Admittedly, I've been planning to try Big Star "late night" after a fun night out on the town.  It's been on my list for a while - I love everything Paul Kahan touches.  The perfect opportunity presented itself this past weekend after a long day of wine tasting, West Loop restaurant hopping, and a killer performance at Second City.   Big Star offers two options-- a more traditional sit-down environment (with seating both inside and out) and a street window with its own dedicated outdoor seating.  The latter was perfect for our group.  Between the four of us, I think we tried every taco on the menu, plus salsas and gauc.  The tacos were amazing -- the pork belly stood out as my favorite.  The outdoor seating was rustic and perfect on a beautiful summer night.  Can't wait to go back!

I've got to hand it to you, Big Star. You're really good at fooling people. I must admit that I was one of the many people that you fooled. See, image is everything, and when I would stand outside of Violet Hour, waiting for the doors to open, I'd always see a crowd of people dining at Big Star. In addition, I'd always see a crowd of people just waiting to get into Big Star. Witnessing all of this, I figured that your food and spirits had to be excellent. I have never been more wrong in my life. I tried your tacos, and they were average, and that's being kind. Pepe's tacos are way better. Why? Pepe's tacos actually have flavor. Big Star's tacos have to be the most bland creations I've ever had. While eating these waste of time tacos, I began to wonder why people like this place so much. Then, it hit me. People like these tacos because they've had 5 - 15 drinks at Big Star before they've tried them. Drinks have the power to make food taste better than it really is. So, I decided to have a couple of drinks, and then I had one more taco after the drinks. The taco tasted better; not much better, but better. People, don't be fooled by the drinks. If you want poor tacos, then go to Big Star. However, a drink or two will at least make those tacos taste average.

The service was acceptable, I felt that they didn't go above and beyond, however I felt my waiter was approachable and charismatic. If I would go again I would strictly order the fish tacos, they were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, reminiscent of a McDonald's hash brown. The other tacos were standard, nothing awe inspiring. The pork belly could have reached new heights, maybe they were an old batch. For those who are accustomed to a Michelada, I would not get the one here. It's as if they poured half a bottle of tapatio inside a beer glass, and they couldn't finish a whole can of beer so they gave you the rest on the side, may I suggest using a bigger glass so you can fit a whole can in there. I went in the afternoon for lunch, maybe dinner time is where it's at because I saw they had cheap drinks.

After failing to understand the process of how the Violet Hour worked across the street, we headed over to Big Star, which looked quite inviting with the large outdoor space in the front of the establishment. We found out quickly that they were owned by the same people and we took a seat in the outdoor area of big star.    We didn't eat a full meal; however, we had the queso dip with tortilla which by the way was awesome!   We also had drinks, which we thought were also amazing. The servers were efficient and we loved how there never needed to be a check printed.  Everything was done portably on the Ipads which were brought to your table.    I loved everything about this place, and if I lived in the area -- I would be out here quite frequently in good weather.
Overrated and greasy food. Not worth the wait, effort or any of it. So many better places to get tacos in the neighborhood without all the hassle and better flavor. Just not worth it.

Big star is a fun place to grab a quick bite with friends. I've tried most of the meat tacos and the one I like the best is the al pastor ($3). It's got the best balance in terms of flavor. Usually 3 tacos makes a decent meal. Depending on the time you go, it might be faster to just grab tacos from the take out window.  TL;DR Al Pastor Taco

Big Star is a mediocre establishment serving mediocre tacos. One of the busiest establishments in Wicker Park, Big Star has failed to live up to the hype every time I have been here. Unlike Antique Taco, Big Star does not offer any innovative dining options. Sorry, but you cannot offer mainstream tacos and not have them be creative. That is just being boring. And I hate boring. I have tried the chorizo, pescado, pastor, and panza, only to feel as if I should have taken my business elsewhere. When it comes to the food, Big Star is just another disappointing, boring American taco establishment, and God knows we have too many of those floating around. Big Star is so nicely situated and occupies such a large space that the dining environment is wonderful for the summer months. Service is mediocre: it could be improved, but it is not awful.  For good food, take your business next door to Paul Kahan's other restaurant, Dove's Luncheonette. Not tacos, but definitely has Mexican influence. Plus your money will be going into the same pockets, but you will walk away a lot more satisfied.

I have been to Big Star 3 times now, and my opinion is "on the fence".  The first time I dined here with friends we grabbed a booth for margaritas and tacos. The margaritas were strong and the tacos and service were just fine. The second time I went was the food seemed cold and pre prepared while the service was lovely and bubbly. The third time I went at the end of this summer, I had a great food experience but terrible service. Our waitress was extremely rude, rolled her eyes and was not accommodating with our group.  Overall I am indifferent. This is not authentic Mexican food, but it's trendy and a fun place to go with friends. Note that they do not split checks so either bring cash only or agree to have one person pay for it on their card.

The fish tacos are really good and--if you're not too careful--the margarita can sneak up on you; however, I don't really care for the environment. The wait staff are inattentive and entitled. I've been there twice and both times I ate as quickly as my tacos came and left. It isn't a comfortable place to stay, talk, and hang out. Luckily, they have a to-go window.

Big Star is a local's paradise. They offer amazing tacos and drinks atop a fantastic outdoor patio. They are always well staffed and service times are quick. I thought it was neat that they take your phone number down to text you when your table becomes available, allowing you to grab a drink across the street in the mean time (we love the Blue Line Bar!). They hold your table for ten minutes when it becomes available. Our server last time was Kat, and she deserves some serious kudos for being extremely friendly and providing great service. This is really the perfect place to meet during a sunny afternoon or warm summer night in Wicker Park.
Liked it here. Got a beer and a shot for $6 and the wait staff was friendly and on-point. Definitely glad we stopped in.

A great friend took me here, on my second trip to Chicago. We arrived with suitcases in tow at 2pm, and it was hoping! Waited just a few minutes to get a table ready and we were off to explore greatness! They have amazing selection of beers on tap... I got some 3 Floyd's, oh yeah! Ordered chips and salsa and started munching my way to happiness. I got an assortment of tacos but the one that really made me fall in love was the Taco Al Pastor, omg, roasted pork, onions, cilantro and pineapple...  Great staff and service! AMAZ-BALLS! (That's for the Al Pastor) A must stop anytime in Wicker Park.

Amazing tacos! We tried five different kinds and they were all excellent. We shared a margarita pitcher and it was well crafted. Atmosphere was very enjoyable, we sat outside on a beautiful Sunday afternoon and enjoyed the patio for hours. Superb. Highly recommend.
Great flavors, great tacos, super fast and friendly service, lots of people to look at. It seemed a little loud near the bar area but we were outside so it didn't bother us.

I never liked Mexican food until Big Star got me obsessed with tacos! My first experience eating their food was my bfs cousins wedding when they catered and I wasn't impressed, but actually coming into the restaurant was a different story. It was a Saturday night and my friend and I were going to grab dinner and drinks before going out in wicker park. In the middle of eating the weather got horrible but luckily we were inside and didn't even have to wait for a table. We split the big star marg pitcher, wow super strong and ordered the chips and guacamole which was soooo good and big. As for tacos my favorite by far was the steak tacos but I also liked the pork!

Atmosphere is very laid back. We sat outside, some it seemed that was the only place to sit. This place is super popular. We went at 2pm and there are so many people here. It seems like this place is focused a bit on drinking and then they also offer a small selection of tacos.  I had the pork belly taco and the steak taco. Both were absolutely delicious! I also tried the chips and salsa and it was good.  The service seemed  a little slow (probably just bc i was starving!) because they were so busy but def with the wait. The food came out very fast after we ordered and was served family style. They ask about allergies up front so that is really good.

A popular spot near one of the busiest intersections. You will wait a long time for an outdoor table during popular dining times. Not sure that the tacos and drinks are worth a two hour wait, but if you pop in and sit at the bar, you will be served your food less than 5 minutes after placing your order. There's a little outdoor to-go taco bar if you are strictly there for the tacos and don't mind missing out on the best-dressed Wicker Park people watching. Big Star hasn't changed much over the years, and that's a good thing - although they do accept credit cards now!

Big Star is the spot to be during a nice summer day. I live around the corner and have to force myself to not eat there everyday! If you are in the mood for some delicious tacos and margaritas and want to soak up some sun this is your spot. I've been at 2am and 2pm and the tacos are consistently delicious.  If it was more reasonably priced this would be a 5 star for sure!

This place is crazy good. All elements...atmosphere, food, service, etc...They play albums, too not just a Pandora station. Led Zeppelin III while we were there. All the servers and bartenders were super friendly and actually appeared as though they wanted to be at work! Happiness is contagious. Great Job Big Star!

A preface, I've worked in wicker park for years. I've been coming to this spot for a very long time, I've recommended it to many friends, family, clients, etc. Tonight I came in with my boyfriend to celebrate a promotion at my new job. We made the drive up from the south side (Pilsen) because we're craving big star margaritas. We get to the hostess and she tells us there's 9 parties ahead of us, no problem. We put our name down on the list and head to the bar for some drinks and guac. We order, usual pretentious type at big star bartender, no biggie. We go on having a good time. Our check comes and the waitress asks us if we'd like to leave it opened or closed, we're waiting for a table so we're gonna close it. My boyfriend is treating (I didn't bring my card, only about $25 in cash on me) and he goes through his wallet and realizes he forgot his card. Immediately, we approach the bartender to tell her the situation, apologizing profusely and she's just stone cold to us. She says she has to get her manager. Ok. Her manager comes after about five minutes and mind you the moment we realized that he forgot his card and didn't have enough cash to cover the bill, we immediately brought the drinks back to the bar, not one lick of salt or sip gone. My boyfriend knows his card number by heart, he offered to give the waitress his card number and information but she impolitely declines.
