I immediately apologize for the inconvenience and again explain what happened, he looks at me and goes, "this is so unacceptable, not once in all my years of bartending has this ever happened?" Wait, so you're telling me not once in the shit show that is Big Star you've never had a customer be short a few bucks??? He said "I guess just give me what you got." Our bill was 30.49 and we gave him $27. I'm sorry that shit happens, but don't shame us in front of other customers with lies. Sorry we were honest enough to come to you, bring full drinks back, and tel you that we were short instead of leaving y'all with nothing, which I'm sure is the usual classy move of the typical big star client, dine and dash not for me. I end up saying, "you can keep your drinks." Dude says thanks, doesn't even make eye contact, takes our cash and takes the drinks.  I will never return to big star again nor will I ever recommend it to a friend, family member, client, etc. terrible customer service. I would give you guys 0 stars if I could.  "Unacceptable." What, are you grading my grad school term paper? BYE.

I do not get this place.  The tacos are average at best for such a long line.  The bar is nothing special.   I heard this was a place to check out so we put our name in and waited for the call.  It is a cool space, but nothing special.  It is a big outdoor patio with picnic tables.  I ordered a few tacos.  The tacos were kinda one note and nothing special.  It's a taco and if they are trying to be authentic they need to look at their source again. The servers and staff were the only saving grace in this place.  They were extremely nice and patient and based on the number of over served douche bags that were there they should be offered Sainthood.

This is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago. I'm from Southern California and am generally disappointed with Mexican fare here. Big Star is delicious and reasonably priced, with great margs. My biggest issue was with the wait, but they built out a nice area next door where you can order the full menu from a takeout window...sans the margs.
Best part of this experience was sitting on the patio! The food: Fish taco - dry and not amazing Tostada de Hongos-  very good Endsalada de big star with pork shoulder- good

i've only tried one taco here so i can't say definitively, but it was nothing memorable. I've definitely had better (at l'patron!!) I tried the taco de chorizo cordero which has spicy lamb and pork chorizo, spring onion crema, radish, and cilantro. $3. I feel like the tacos are on the smaller side and aren't as flavorful as I would like.  I will say the patio environment is lively and a lot of fun. we ordered pitchers of big star margaritas for the table ($40 each) which I thought were on the pricy side but they were pretty good. as other reviews mentioned, service can be spotty. it took us forever to flag down our waiter for the bill. they do accept credit cards now though! but were only willing to split the bill on 2 credit cards so be ready to venmo/quickpay etc.
What's there to say that hasn't been said? Good tacos... if there's a huge wait to get inside, just to to their "to go" stand. They had plenty of open seating at that side even on a Saturday night.

While the portions are small the food quality is worth it. Had the fish & steak tacos. Both great yet different.  The fish was battered and had a nice crunch, yet had a fish taste, not over fried. The steak taco was full of flavor. Likely marinated and then grilled. It had good heat to it where the fish taco equally flavorful had a crisp crunch to go with its mellow flavor in contrast to the steak.

The tacos: Good. Service: Great! Chips: to Die For. I ordered the Taco al Pastor w/ the Dulce de Leche or whatever. They tasted amazing, but a few minutes after finishing my food I felt an overwhelming sickness. Like, pukey sickness, and it persisted for an hour afterwards. I think it might've been the Dulce de Leche. The taco was amazing. Anyway, yeah, a star off because I got sick but the actual food was awesome. :D

After my friends and I finished the Big 10K we went here to celebrate! We ordered chips, salsa, guac and queso for the table. The chips came out hot and the guac was fresh made and delicious. After having a few margaritas we decided to order some tacos. The tacos were also delicious. The only complaint I have is that they are cash only and this can be inconvenient if you are like me and never carry cash. Luckily they do have an ATM on site to help fix this problem. I would recommend this place as one of the best places to quench your taco and margarita craving in Chicago!

Hailing from SoCal, I can be pretty judgmental about tacos. I stopped by here on the way home from Lollapalooza with some friends and when I saw how many people were seated, I literally spewed out some inappropriate language. Good thing they have a take-out window.  I can't particularly comment on the service, which is what a lot of people seem to be complaining about, considering I went up to a window, ordered, paid, and picked up my food and was on my merry way.  The food - WOW. The taco de panza was a pork belly taco with a tomato guajillo sauce, queso fresco, onion, and cilantro. Hands down, my favorite taco from this place. I'm not entirely sure why I've never had a pork belly taco before. I couldn't resist ordering the taco al pastor because of the grilled pineapple and it definitely did not disappoint. The chicken from the taco de pollo was a wonderful grilled chicken thigh that was not dry whatsoever, thank god. Honestly, I'm kinda drooling thinking about these tacos again. I'd definitely check this place out again the next time I'm in Chicago.

This place has great food and a lively atmosphere! The outdoor seating is cute, and the colors are bright and welcoming. You can smell the delicious Mexican food from about a block away, and it really draws crowds in. I recommend this place for a casual bite to eat.

So over hyped! I've had better tacos from chipotle! Yes it's a patio...but what's so cool about that lol! Tacos were just ok not great or amazing! Chips and gac average. The hipsters seem to love it tho.

Loud, crowded and fun!  Came here with my wife and 2.5 year old son on Friday after work (around 6).  Waited about 15 minutes for a table and then were seated outside.  They do not have high chairs, but the hostess offered to stack one chair on top of the other, which made a big difference.  We were greeted immediately by the server and placed an order for chips and guac.  They were delivered within 5 minutes along with a plastic cup+lid for our son.  We ordered 6 tacos total plus the salad.  The server recommended we do a half salad which was the right call.  Additionally, we mentioned that we are gluten free and the server handled it with ease, letting us know what we should and should not order.  Food came in a timely manner and exceeded expectations.  Was tempted by the margarita pitchers but resisted.  Great meal, fun vibe and well priced, we shall return.

I love big star but I was really disappointed tonight. They only put half my order in the bag which of course I didn't realize until I was already home. I was really looking forward to the full order. Super bummed.

Thus was our first meal while in Chicago for a long weekend. It was highly recommended by a local friend. The service was Super fast and friendly! Had the chips/salsa with guac to start. The chips were fresh, crispy and the guac had a bunch of lime, which I love. We tried 6 different tacos ($4 each). My favorites were the fish (#1) and the shredded steak. My husband's favorite was the chicken. The walking taco was a fun idea but needed some ground meat or something in it to break up all the cheese and sour cream. I had a virgin paloma to drink which was awesome. It was like grapefruit lemonade. I would go back just for the guac and paloma!  Saw they allow dogs out in the patio area and gave them water bowls, which is cool. Missing my pooch.

Ok, I can understand the hype. This place is awesome! It's busy, loud and crowded but as long as you know what your walking into, it's all good.  We came around 10pm on a Friday night. We were seated right away and our server was attentive and helpful.  We started out with the queso  fundido, yum! The cheese was caramelized with a little "bite" to it. Ok, I'm actually craving it right now... The flour tortillas tasted so fresh. I usually prefer corn but those were delicious! We actually ordered a good variety of the tacos, the braised pork belly, beef and fish tacos. We were all very happy. The place really hit the spot. Loved the whole walking taco concept, very cool! I would definitely come back. I've never known my home town to be known for anything but their pizza. But after hearing about this place from my California friends says a lot!

Sigh. I've only ever written good or great reviews of places I've been to, or services I've used, because I feel like great service is something that should be heralded. I had such a bad experience at Big Star today that I have to make a note for anyone thinking about making the trip over. It's a taco place; although it's in Wicker Park which used to be super edgy and awesome, the neighborhood is now kid-filled, so we thought we could grab a quick taco and a beer w/ our kids at 2 on a Wednesday.  Turns out, we were wrong! We were told there weren't any high chairs but we were sat anyway, our waitress was aloof and in no way friendly/welcoming, our order was wrong, she didn't check on us, and we finally had to flag someone down to pay our check bc she was smoking a cigarette on her "break." Listen, we may be a family w/kids which we now know is decidedly not cool for Big Star, but we are in and out in 15 minutes, we drink, and tip well. We also came at an off hour and day. The one star is for the bus person being considerate enough to to bring plastic cups w/lids on them and straws.  We were the folks that were there to support you in the beginning. Too bad you've turned into such dicks.

This was the first place my cousins took me to when I visited from out of state. Great variety of tacos. The margaritas were killer too. Seemed like a pretty hipster place, but I don't mind as some people seem to do. I'd definitely come again the next time I'm in town.

This place has uniques tacos but really amazing quality. The walking taco is just a bag of Fritos mixed with toppings. However, the toppings are good as they include cheese onions sour cream etc and really complemented my other food.

Rode by this place during the summer and it was packed. Each time after that packed inside and out, today finally get my chance to see what this place was about. Well can we say garbage! 17.00 for 4 bite size tacos that weren't that good! For 4.00 a taco I expected much better, won't be going back anytime soon. :-[
Trendy,  fun, hip. Good food..like the take-away window. Smart! WALKING TACO! Sit outside if you can..nott as loud as inside. Near Damen metro stop is super convenient.

Here's to another star for Big Star!!  They take credit card for payment, check.  Added more unique veggie taco options, check.  Expanded their space, check and also have a walking taco, check!! No more needs to be said!  Big star is still a big hit!! :)

Pretty busy Mexican hipster taco place. The guacamole was great, but a bit over priced. The taco de al pastor had more pineapple than actual pork. The tortillas are a bit small and they add a lot of meat on top. It can get a bit messy! Overall a decent place to eat.

So we gave our phone number and put our name in. After about 75 minutes we finally called it quits. If you think we waited that long to eat no chance. We went next-door to the take-out and ate. We ate all 10 tacos. Fish was great. As well as the chicken. There is not a bad taco at Big Star. The fresh guacamole was great. We couldn't ask for a better take-out meal. And since they take credit cards now I can drink and eat a lot more. Wish we had the full full-service but you can't beat the tacos at Big Star. Excellent.  Too many yuppie kids paying with their mom and dad's money. LOL. once the stock market crashes and these kids have no money maybe they'll  go back to eating at McDonald's.  So Until then I'll have to wait.
We waited for a table at the bar for about 10 minutes, on a Saturday. The service was good. Taco Al Pastor- Ok. Steak Taco- OK. Taco De Pollo- best, the sauce is amazing.

Big Star drew me in because of their pretty outdoor patio area. There were also lots of people that were always eating there when I passed by. I got the queso fundido and a few tacos and they were all delicious, especially the cheese dish. However, the tacos were not as flavorful as I expected them to be based on other people's reviews and were quite expensive compared to cheaper places. This is more a good place to go for groups and to enjoy the outdoor seating during summer in Wicker Park.
The tacos are pretty good but you will find tastier ones in less-noisy spaces in Chicago. (Ambience is definitely not hipster, BTW.)
The hostess was super rude and the service was horrible. First and LAST time to go there

Great taco place in the city with unique flavors and a "divey but cool vibe." I had heard great things about this place from it seems like everyone I know, and it didn't disappoint. My table started with an order of salsas and guacamole which was very good, and bottomless chips included. Then we each ordered 3 tacos(girls included) per recommendation of waitress. I got the Taco de Panza (braised pork), Pescado (fish), and Zanahorias (carrot). I liked the fish the best, then carrot, then Panza. The carrot one was just so different than I ever had before, and had really great spicy flavors.  I also really appreciated how the tortillas didn't rip as many tacos do, and they held up very well even with many toppings. One thing is that it seems to always have a wait, so be prepared for that, and check in early if you can. They have a good system with the text when your table is ready, but we waited about an hour on a Tuesday night so just be prepared.

Big Star! It's a staple place to go in Wicker Park. One of the busiest taco  / bar joints in the area. What their known for: Big Star Margarita, and Tacos!! Unfortunately their tacos just aren't that good, and although the Big Star Margarita is strong, the taste just isn't that friendly for the faint of heart. I totally dig it but for people searching for those sweeter margaritas, I would not recommend it.  This place is always popping everytime I'm in the area and I love the place but alas, if you are new or visiting the Chicago area, there are definitely better places to go.

Food and margs are amazing! Got the queso as an appetizer which was a great decision. Food came out fast, which was great considering we had been waiting for about 2 hours for our group to get seated which included about a 30 minute wait after we received a text saying they were ready to seat us. It was a Friday night, so benefit of the doubt was given.

My local friends told me this was an awesome spot for tacos, but I have definitely had better. We waited about an hour and a half to get a table on a Friday night. The space is very loud. The waitress actually missed an order for one our drinks. We started out with some queso fundido, chips, and guacamole. The chips and guacamole were a decently sized portion and the guacamole was very good. The queso fundido came with a few tortillas. It was rich and cheesy, if not a bit salty. But we were here for tacos. I got an alambre, pescado (fish), chorizo, and pastor. It was annoying that all the tacos were served family style. We had to figure out which tacos were which and how to properly distribute them without making a mess. It would have been way easier if they just each of us our orders on separate plates. The tacos were also only single tortilla. This is the only place I've been to with somewhat authentic tacos that don't double up on tortillas. The meats inside were pretty good, but they were messy without that second tortilla. Not a bad spot, but not something I'd wait for.

I really enjoy the food at Big Star, so I'll definitely be stopping by again. However, the wait staff is often not very service oriented. For example, I recently made a purchase from the Take Out window. Cashier C waited on me. She was rude and dismissive. It definitely put a damper on my general enthusiasm for Big  Star. The owners and managers might want to consider some custom service training for the wait staff.
Best pork tacos in the city. They also have gumball head on tap!  Do not leave without trying the de panza taco!

OMG - they catered our meeting.  Nasty.  I have never seen a salad as nasty as the one we got from them.  Brown lettuce throughout.  I don't mean 1 or 2 pieces, but throughout the salad.  The rest of meal was mediocre, but for them to let a salad like this come out, is disgusting.  Avoid this place.  There are much better places!

Tacos are great, and the margaritas are stronggg. Completely outdoor, vibes are fun (especially in the summer) - but it is a little loud so if you plan on going with people keep in mind you might be yelling at each other to have a conversation.  Big Star is my top spot for tacos at the moment, and I will definitely be bringing out-of-towners here.

Have you ever cried at a restaurant because of the poor experience? I couldn't say I had until I went to Big Star. I went with several friends and acquaintances on Saturday evening, June 26. My drink was tasty, but put mezcal in anything and it will be good. I'm vegetarian and I don't like super spicy foods, so I ordered carefully. I asked about removing the peppers from the potato tacos, and the server said they were in the sauce but they didn't taste like much. My carrot taco was spicy, but not so much I couldn't eat it after adding a lot of sour cream. (Little side story here: I ordered a side of sour cream when the server suggested it. A few minutes before our tacos arrived, our chips and guacamole were refreshed and the waiter set down some "crema." I assumed someone in my group had requested it, especially since it was at the other end of the table. When one of our servers - not the main one, but maybe a busser/expediter - asked how our tacos were, I asked if my sour cream was coming. She pointed at it and said, that's it. I said, "Well, that's the crema-" She interrupted and said, "Crema is Spanish for cream." Yes, thank you, even if I hadn't lived in South America, I would have known that. But you guys called it by two different names and it came out with a different course and set it on the other end and there are many types of cream, so I did need some clarification. What is called "crema" at Mexican restaurants is often NOT the same as usual American sour cream. The condescension wasn't necessary.) Anyway, I had ordered two potato tacos. They were beyond my threshold. I told the waitress they were too much. I was embarrassed at first because I get teased and scoffed at a lot for my spice tolerance, so I cushioned it with saying, "I can be a little sensitive to spice, but..." She snorted, "Yeah, that's our spiciest taco. I could have told you that." Ah, but you didn't. Even when I asked about having the peppers removed. She just said that they were part of the sauce. (For everyone who is blaming me, take note... I did my diligence.) So I said, "Okay... well, I can't eat it at all." Pause while I wait for her to suggest an alternative taco. Nothing. So I continue, "Can I have them taken off of my bill?" She pursed her lips. "If you have special needs you should have told us." I don't have "special needs"; I just didn't have any reason to think that taco would be the spiciest on the menu. I asked her again. She made a face and said, "Well, I could ask the manager. But next time, you really ought to tell us." Seriously?!?! Thanks for the lecture. And there will NOT be a next time. I politely said, "Maybe the menu could have a scale of which tacos are hot. A lot of restaurants have that." She glared at me, reiterated what I should do next time, and walked off. I was stunned. I was already having a very bad evening, for unrelated reasons, and that was the straw that broke the camel's back - I started crying. I can't remember ever crying over a server's attitude before. She was also rude to another girl in our group, and generally sarcastic and dismissive to our table. Most of the group lives in Chicago and almost all of us have been servers before, so there wasn't a cultural disconnect. She never took my tacos off the bill, but since it was given to us as an entire-table bill, I let it go. I didn't have it in me to fight anymore or delay my party. All in all: good drinks, okay tacos (but some are super spicy and not labeled as such), deplorable service. Edit: If people don't like my review, fine. Almost all of my reviews are quite positive; I'm not a serial complainer. Move on. Don't bother leaving me a sarcastic note blaming me for the server's terrible attitude. Among other things, it's unoriginal.

So many people have recommended Big Star since the move to Chicago, finally got to try it this past weekend picking up some grub before the Panic/ Weezer concert. I never knew there was a pick up counter to the side, now you know in case you aren't feeling the line. Between my group and I, the only taco we didn't order was the pork belly one! Our favourites were the fish - so tender and flavourful, steak - great balance of flavors and meaty, as well as the mole carrots. We liked the fresh chips with the hint of lime, thought the salsa was a little lackluster. Guac was fairly standard.

Am I missing something, here? Maybe it was the hype of the place, but I was highly disappointed by the tacos here. I did get the taco from the take-out area, so maybe that makes a bit of difference, so apologies in advance if the quality of taco differs for dine-in. I have to say, the ambiance of the place is really lovely. Outdoor seating with really beautiful lights. Very chill, albeit, the line looked gnarly. The take-out line was long as well, but they had an efficient system so it did not take a long time at all.  I got 2 tacos. One fish, one pork. I feel like when the price is above $3-$4, you really have to bring the taco game. Unfortunately, Big Star did not deliver. The tortilla fell apart, the favors were not great, and the protein was just...subpar. I wouldn't consider it a bad taco if the price was lower, but because of the price range, I wouldn't say I would consider coming back, especially with the cheaper, more authentic, and much more delicious options. I'm not even going to say this is California taco snobbery because I've had good tacos in Chicago, so I know it's not because of location. Shrug. This place look hip AF, though, so if you're into that.

short and sweet. I love this place. tacos are legit, margs are good (tecate is cheap to drink along side of said marg), the outdoor seating is amazing and brings a fun crowd, glad they are no longer cash only. will forever be a fan even though the wait time sucks.

Honestly, some of the best tacos I've ever had! This place is so alive, the outdoor patio was packed and service was so quick! I'm generally not the BIGGEST fan of tacos, but this place is great AND reasonably priced. Our waitress messed up on of our taco orders but was super sweet and immediately apologized and brought out the correct order. It tends to get a little loud here and there (depending on how many people are smacking on the margaritas hardcore) but would highly recommend coming here- they also provide a fast to go service right by the restaurant itself which is very handy.

Went on a taco crawl with a group of friends so we had to check out Big Star. Despite a 2 hour wait they were able to seat our party of 8 much faster. Loved the vibe of the place and the margarita pitchers were great! The mushroom tostada had an incredible amount of flavor. The carrot mole taco was lacking a bit of flavor, but still good. Great place to spend time at during a Chicago summer.

Place was packed when we got here. Had a nice chat with Hannah prior to our wait time being up and she got us in super quick! She's very sweet! On top of that, the tacos were FANTASTIC. I definitely would recommend Big Star to anyone looking for a place to get quality tacos at a cheap price. Loved the spin on the "walking taco". Big Star margarita was good! You really can't go wrong here and I will definitely be back. Open one in the south suburbs!
Great food, atmosphere and Margs!!! Long waits at peak times but worth it. Cash only bar but ATM is inside.

BYE FELICIA (Lauren)  Great tacos, guac, margs, music, et cetera et cetera. Our (there were six of us) server (Lauren) was rude, and our tacos were all served on a platter - when generally tacos look the same; so figuring out who's was whose triggered a comment out of my mouth mentioning the decrease of her tip.  Apparently that meant I was wasted and needed to be cut off. Rendering her a 0% tip from the whole table.  Manager was awesome and super understanding and apologetic, I wish I remembered her name.  Did I mention Lauren was the server? She sucks. That is all.

The tacos portions are small, so two tacos is not enough for a small person. I ordered the papas and the zahonias. The second one was terrible, yogurt is not good on tacos.  the first one was ok, but i've had better. It needed some more flavor, but i would probably get the papas again. the hot sauce was spicy and tacos were spicy.  The seating is nice on the patio so I gave it an extra star.

COST: $4 (Taco De Panza) $3.50 (Taco Al Pastor)  $4 (Taco De Pescado) $3 (Beers! Tecate and Lone Star) $3 (Chips and Salsa, $8 For Guacamole) I hope it's not unfair that I'm judging this place against the tacos of Los Angeles and California in general. I'm from there and that's where I grew up so I must. In short, these tacos are a massive disappointment. The meet tasted a little too tender and the flavor was off. The sauces and toppings they put on top of it never really gel well together. For example, De Panza (Pork Belly) had very light toppings I assume because the meet with drive the flavor home, but the flavor was missing.  Of the three tacos I tried, the De Pescado was my favorite. It was full of flavor and was the most presentable option for me. The salsas served with the chips were pretty bomb though however that's not really hard to screw up. My absolute best part has got to be the $3 beers though. You'd think they'd capitalize on their popularity to overcharge for these two beers but they don't. Overall though, I was left unimpressed.  $1 Mexican Food Truck tacos all day every day. Sorry.

Cool place but overrated in my mind. They don't take reservations or give you a time estimate once you put your name on the list but you can go stand in the corner and drink margaritas if you'd like.  Still gets 4 stars for being affordable and delicious and for having a take out window. The tacos are reasonably priced. My favorite is the beer battered fish taco. Also, if you order chips and salsa from the take out window they give you a huge bag of warm chips and salsa for $3!
Went here with some friends for drinks. The food was good and we had some pitcher of margarita. I wish they have flavor margaritas. . But the tacos are little too pricey.

I love coming here. The tacos, drinks, environment, just everything. I've been wanting to take my husband there for a very long time so we decided that on Friday that just passed we were going to go. At the entrance there's always someone there checking I.Ds and so I gave him mine. My husband doesnt have a state I.D yet so he gave him his I.D. from his country. The security was COMPLETELY rude asked me if he had a state i.d. and i told him no which i was confused as his i.d. has his birth date exp date everything mine does. This man literally talked down to my husband in front of everyone there and said "next time you come here you bring me a STATE I.D do you understand me". With a completely rude tone i couldnt believe what i was seeing and hearing. Never have i ever experienced anything like this. Everyone was literally looking at him in complete shock even the staff in the front taking names. I will never go back this was beyond rude I cant believe it. This man spoke to him like if he wasnt even human. This is very unacceptable no one should be talked that way. Im very very disappointed.

Here's a tip to all the people on here crying about "pretentious hipsters" and "ironic mustaches": you're old...either get over it, or embrace it.  You wreak of the "back in my day" vibe and no one gives a sh*t.  Don't go if it makes you feel uncomfortable.  Why would you?
If you can get a seat this place has some good eats. Very cool hipster atmosphere, and patio is awesome when the weather is nice. Get the guacamole, try a margarita and have a few tacos.
Why give us great food that everyone loved then take it away from your loyal fans?!  BRING BACK THE SONORA HOT DOG PLEASE!!  IT WAS GREAT

I love Mexican food and this taco joint does not disappoint. Went here almost a year ago while I was in town for a conference and was absolutely blown away by the food, the margaritas, the ambiance, and the general splendor that is Big Star. Killer place to eat in the spring and summer due to its open air feel and great outdoor patio. I ordered the taco de pescado and the taco al pastor. The fish taco was incredible! Beer-battered fish topped with a chipotle mayo, cilantro, lime, cabbage, and red onion. And their guacamole is a must too! Next time I'm in Chicago, I'm running to Big Star in Wicker Park!

came here while visiting chicago for work. location is super convenient to the L, right off the blue line. the weather was great, so not surprised we had to wait at bit. we attempted to get some drinks at the bar while waiting... the bar was also super slammed and crowded. literally had to fight to get in there. finally got a bar stool, waited a while. the bar back actually wiped the space down and poured us some waters.finally got a bartender to pour us a pitcher of margaritas from the margarita tap. pretty basic margarita for the price, heavy on the citrus mixer. got seated at a table on the patio, nice space. good thing i was with good company, because again we found ourselves waiting a while for the waitress. while we were waiting we noticed my male friends margarita glass had some hot pink lipstick on. guess they need better dish detergent... so far im sort of underwhelmed. but the food, the food here was  awesome. we got an order of guac along with the queso fundido. both were super tasty. for tacos we got a mix of pork belly, fish, steak, and chorizo. my favorites were the pork belly and fish. flavors were excellent with generous protein portions. chorizo was my least favorite, it was overly salty and heavy on the sour cream. so service is so so, drinks are alright, food is great and they made it super easy to pay. this place is no longer cash only, you can quickly swipe your credit card on an ipad the waitress is carrying around. no paper, email receipt. very nice!

Allow me to offer an opinion on my experience. Sat at the bar, no hassle ordered a couple beers, was clear about opening a tab. So far so good... Rather aggressively treated the rest of the night. No problems on my end, I know this for a fact. Staff was eager to close me out. Once they did, I gave a large tip, looked them in the eye (weds night bartenders) and sincerely thanked them. My thanks was met with a blank gaze and silence. This was not an uncommon practice at the bars and restaurants of wicker park.

Food isn't good enough to make up for the shitty service. Get it to go or go straight to the bar. Even if it's 80 degrees and an empty patio. Trust me, you'll thank me later.  I've never encountered such a lazy group of servers in my life. Never had a good experience with the wait staff. The server assistants (Bussers) are quick and will practically do everything while the servers are clearly wandering around, obviously eating (because you see them emerge from a corner with their mouths full) and/or chatting with each other while we wait for someone to notice us so we can order our FIRST DRINK.  I have been attempting this place for years... And after the reconstruction of this place, I loved the set up and vibe. So I continued to give this place many chances. But I've had enough.
TURN THE F****** MUSIC DOWN! The music selection sucks and so does the service. No one gives shit that you're playing music on wax. You could be taking my order instead of changing records.
The hostess seems more interested in chatting and putting lotion on her hands than greeting guests.

I mean seriously???? The only people that give this place 5 stars are non latinos that dont know better and think its cool to pay 3.50 for a miserable taco. For 3 tacos i spent like 13 bucks (real mexican size tiny tacos) to all you white folks.... go to a real place like Guanajuatos on California and spend like 16 bucks and leave exoding full with your girl. I mean the place isnt chik but the food and prices are waaaaay better and they are not stingy with the meat or avocados. Try that place and then thank me. I didnt want to go to Big Star because i knew what i was gonna get myself into. Then when you pay at the cashier thru the carry out window, they will show you the screen and it will ask you for a tip amount... for what?? For you giving my food in a bag to go??? Wow! On top of that... i ordered alpastor tacos and these clowns did not have limes. Alpastor tacos always require limes on the side for the yuppie owner.

The fish and pork belly tacos were as good as advertised. I don't love fish to be bartered but it still hit the spot. The atmosphere is a socialites dream. Outdoor seating to the max, lots of shade from the sun and a buzzing bar scene on the inside. The wait can be long but they take your cell number and text you when a table is ready, allowing for some quick window shopping in the interim.  The staff are very attentive. Margarita spilled on my sister's white shoes and they brought her club soda and a rag to help clean it. They also check on her/us a bunch.

Quirky Tex-Mex with a great Chicago following.  The only real downside of anything in Wicker Park is the parking but as soon as we sat down we had a value of a meal.  The server was very nice.  The Salad was amazing.  We could have stopped there however the tacos we selected empresses.  I wish the had a non battered fish taco or a shrimp taco but every taco was good.  The veggie tostada was great, chicken excellent, steak awesome.  The chips were solid, not special but so much was it didn't need to be.  If you're in the neighborhood you all ready know, if you're visiting the area go, you won't regret it.
Big Star....it's amazing. Definitely go for the tacos and order from the to go line. It's just not worth it to sit there.

I was only in Chicago for a day and a half so I don't have much to compare Big Star to locally; nevertheless I would highly recommend to anyone.  Prior to heading out here, a friend of mine was raving about this place (she is originally from Chicago)-I had to give me the info, but wasn't sure if I would make it. Another local friend of mine took me out my first night and Big Star was apparently the place!   Downside: be prepared for a long wait. However, we put in a name and gave them a phone number, and were free to grab a drink anywhere in the area--located in wicker park there is plenty nearby.  They texted us when the table was ready. The hostess and our waitress were very friendly. The food and Margs were great. The margaritas were a good balance of tequila and lime, but apparently stronger than they taste (which in my opinion is a good thing). We started with chips and guac--the guac was very fresh, homemade, probably the best restaurant guac I've had.  For dinner, I think 3 tacos is a good option, though a bigger guy might want more. I like they they sell each flavor as a single taco so that you can try a variety, and each is reasonably priced to do so (~$3-4 per taco). I had the pastor (pork), panza (steak), and chorizo--I loved the pork (which also comes with pineapple) and the chorizo. The steak was okay though I probably would replace it with a different flavor on a next trip.
Best fancy tacos around and the house Margarita, yes please!

Tacos are pretty good. I would have liked it better if they came with salsas or something, but the taco al pastor and taco de papas con Rajas were tasty with great flavors nonetheless.  The margarita pitcher, on the other hand, was not my favorite. It was very hard to drink, not sure if it was the mixture or not. Other than that, the place was definitely really cool and popping- even at 10pm on a Wednesday! Glad I tried it out.

Worst service in the fair city of Chicago I will not rail off against the food or drink, both of which are exceptional, albeit overpriced. That said, I left Big Star with an outrageously sour taste in my mouth, and it wasn't the margaritas. The service was so bad that it, in fact, negates the superlative quality of the eats and quaffs. For context: I arrived at this restaurant with two of my brothers, both of whom are of drinking age. I am nineteen years old. Everything was going relatively well, until one of my bros offered me a sip of his margarita (yes, a sip. Not a glass-- a sip). I took it without batting an eyelid. In a moment's notice, another lady (not my server), began scolding my party, saying something along the lines of, "My waitress saw you give your drink to him [me]," to which my brother said, "I was just letting him taste it." Then, the overseer responded, "I understand. I'm just coming over to warn you before you get in trouble with the security guard." What?????!!!!!!! There are a number of problems with this interaction. 1. My brother is several years older than me and practically raised me. My brother's gesture was akin to a father giving his son a sip of his wine at dinner. I'm not sure if this restaurant is in trouble with the police for providing minors with alcohol, but that doesn't matter in the slightest. Neither I nor my family have ever been reprimanded for a gesture so innocuous. What was the manager going to do? Call the police because I took a sip of a margarita? Give me a break. At bottom, both the manager and the server demonstrated an astounding lack of judgment and courtesy. A server without judgment and courtesy is like a tennis player without nets or a racket. Which brings me to problem number two (2): Why are the servers hovering over my family while we eat dinner? In spite of my limited experience in the service industry, I know that you are not supposed to scrutinize and skulk over every exchange among your customers. Even if you do not like whom you are serving, you have to give them some measure of privacy. In this way, I got the impression that our servers didn't really like us. Unfortunately, there is nothing in the server's handbook that says anything about getting retribution with your customers. To add insult to injury, our server hovered over our table like a hawk for the remainder of our meal, ostensibly trying to prevent my brothers from "providing me with alcohol." We could not hold a conversation without our taciturn, imperious server staring directly at us. When it was time to pay, she craned over my brother's shoulder as he signed the check. I knew exactly what was happening: In light of the abysmal service we received, the server put my brother under duress so she could get the tip she felt she deserved. This is beyond appalling. I wish my brother had given her a $0.00 tip. She deserves way, way less than that. If I pulled a stunt like this at the restaurant I worked at, I would have been fired on the spot. In sum, this was, by far, the worst service I have ever received in a Chicago restaurant. If this was a hole-in-the wall taco joint, this would have been bearable, but Big Star charges over eighty dollars for tacos and margaritas for a party of three. The service should, at the very least, be tolerable. This place makes me want to vomit. Do not go here!!!!

There was a concert going on right in front of this restaurant, we stopped twice to get some tacos from the to-go line which moved pretty fast. A little pricey at 3-4 dollars for a small taco but you got a good amount of chicken or fish for us with slaw and chipotle sauce. Two thumbs up
Honestly I don't get the hype. The taco filling is tasty but the shells have a weird, rubbery texture to them. For the price, my expectations were of a much higher quality taco.

I live in LA, and am no stranger to sub-par service experiences, oddly I didn't expect to experience this type of service in a Chicago neighborhood.   My pack of 7 ladies (one very pregnant one) and a baby hung out outside this place waiting for it to open at 11:00 am on a Saturday.  We were literally the first people to enter.  When we asked for a table for 7 + a stroller in the shade, the hostess put together 2 small 4-top tables and expected us to turn into munchkins or something.  It quickly became obvious this wouldn't work for our party of 8 fully grown adults and she literally said "Fine, we will add another table for you".  We waited for our server as we sat under one of the larger speakers on the patio and listened to very loud christmas tunes and heavy metal.  Our server finally arrived and she never smiled or said hello.  Her voice was monotone and when we asked for her suggestions she stated statistics like "these are the most ordered tacos" "these are the lightest, heaviest" etc.  We ordered guac, salsa and chips and about 20 tacos, a few salads and a pitcher of margaritas.  Truth be told the tacos were pretty bomb.  The fish and pastor were the standouts.  Guac and chips were very small for the price but good.  The salsas were ok as were the margs.   When the check came we had another ordeal.  6 girls throw in cash and 2 have cards in anticipation of getting the side eye for too many cards...were told we cant tip on the cards since we've paid with partial cash...ugh, really?  we haul ass to an atm & throw money at the problem and GTFO as soon as we can.   As we left we saw a line of about 20 people waiting for tables.  Wow. Based on this experience, I'd skip this place and just order from the window next door.  Enjoy the tacos and skip the "service".

Fish tacos are still good. Salsa is good, but not quite good enough to pay for--it should be complimentary. The carrot mole taco seemed like it had the potential to be really interesting, but wasn't. Nothing too exciting going on here.

I had been here before after a concert at subterranean.  It was busy but tacos were good.  I Decided to take my boyfriend for birthday dinner and service was not good at all.  We were moved because they were closing part of patio.  Waitress said we were getting our food  and the food never arrived.  She was somewhat being defensive when i got up and approached her to ask her.  She stated " but you were eating".  I Said yes,  we were eating appetizers.  I just asked for my check and left.  We tip very good and I just felt I was treated like i was went there for free food.  Very disappointed and somewhat embarrassed I ruined my boyfriends Birthday.  That is too bad because Micheladas are really good but service, not so good.  I will not go here ever again!

UNDERWHELMED EXPERIENCE!!! A good food experience turn into a horrible moment because of the awful service!! The Tacos taste good, unfortunately the server was so rude that we only ate the first round of tacos, pay and left!  Amazing how bad service can ruin a place that I used to consider good!

Everyone is constantly talking about this place for their great outdoor seating and affordable texmex food. I must admit, it does have a great vibe, but don't be expecting 5-star cuisine. However, with that being said, they have great guacamole and the queso fundido is pretty addicting.

Love the tilapia and chicken thigh tacos. The steak one was meh. They have awesome margaritas, which I recommend getting by the pitcher if enough people want to drink!  I always enjoy the walking taco as well, but wasn't in love with the mushroom tostada taco. The crispy pork belly was delicious as well. I usually go early, i.e. Before noon on a weekday or something like a 5pm on a Saturday so the wait is bearable. The service is not the most fabulous, but for the price & food I would definitely go back!

This is one of my best friends favorite taco places in the city (she's from the suburbs) and she insisted we go here for her birthday. Cons:  These tacos were expensive! For how tiny they were and the lack of flavor were not worth the $4-$5 we paid.  Go to Pilsen and you can get a taco for $2 from a lady with a cart that's twice the size and tastes 10x better. The service was terrible, our waitress was great at first but once our food arrived, she was a ghost.  It took forever to track her down to get the bill. And speaking of food arriving? It doesn't come how you'd expect, instead of your tacos on an individual plate, all of the tacos for your entire table come on a single platter (i.e., if two people ordered fish tacos, they would give one plate of fish tacos, not one for each of you). It's annoying and petty to try and sort it out if you have a big group (we had six). Also, I did not care for the hipster/rude attitude of our waitress.  One of the people at the table asked for sour cream and she replied "you mean CREMA?" (heavy fake hispanic accent on crema).  Seeing as this place is 100% hipster and has no hispanic staff, I found this sort of a ridiculous thing to correct.  The person who delivered our tacos also pointed to the sour cream and said "side of CREMA" (again, fake heavy hispanic accent). It wouldn't bother me if say, our waitress was hispanic, or if the food was traditional mexican food and not hipster-fied... but it wasn't.  These tacos are not authentic. You're going to insist that people use the spanish word for sour cream when ordering (but not use spanish in any anything else lol), and then don't even serve limes with the tacos???? (Which is what actual, authentic tacos come with, btw!) The only two pros is that the guac is excellent and they serve one of my fav beers, back to black by 21st ammendment brewery (two pros for two stars).  But not worth coming here ever again.

People on Yelp crack me up.  Who goes to Big Star and doesn't know it's Yuppy Central? It's in the EPICENTER of wicker park aka Yupvillage... It's always packed. So sit at the bar and drink to kill time--you can also order food to the bar.  Once you get your table life is good. The drinks are amazing. Margaritas are on tap and are stupidly fire. A pitcher is expensive ($36) but if you dome an entire one you will be DRUNK. Or split them amongst friends and save money instead of buying an individual marg for $10.  Tacos come out super fast and are really good. I recommend the chicken. By far the best one.  If you know what you're getting into before going to Big Star, there will be zero surprises and you'll love it. You will wait. You will see some lame ass yuppy people. You will over hear comments and conversations  about gentrification and urban renewal by the exact people who are perpetuating the matter lol. But does it matter? You'll get drunk and eat good. Expect less. Live more.

The expanded seating and to go areas help with the overcrowding and wait a bit.  Still, Big Star is popular.  Good weather?  Not 2pm on a weekday?  Expect busy. Tacos al pastor and de panza are my go to taco choices, though veggie and tostadas also get a thumbs up from me. Big Star and Classic margaritas are solid.  Pitchers are the way to go if you have a few people, or maybe two if you're up for a fun filled day or night!  I recently tried the Texas Sparrow and liked the ginger twist in a marg. They're no longer cash only!  Credit card point earners and forgetful friends, rejoice!

I really wanted to like this place since I was in town my friends RAVED ABOUT IT.  We visited this establishment around 3 or 4 on Saturday.  They were rather busy so we put our name down for the table and waited the bar with drinks.  My friend received the text and we walked up to the podium to be seated.  They told us they had gave our table away because we did not come up within 5 minutes of the text.  We checked the time stamp and we arrived at the podium 3 minutes after the text.  Needless to say we had to wait for the next table to be open.   We are finally seated and our server comes up to our table to greet us.  Here is what threw me for a loop! SHE WAS THE SAME LADY SITTING AT THE BAR DRINKING next to us.  WHO ALLOWS THEIR EMPLOYEES TO DO THIS ON A BUSY SATURDAY???? She takes our order and once our food was delivered to our table we alerted her we were missing food.  She then says to us "WHAT DO YOU BELIEVE YOU ARE MISSING?".  The way she said it to us was in a tone you don't speak to customers in.  Once we tell her what we are missing she states "OH...TWO TACOS...THAT IS ALL YOU ARE MISSING? THAT IS EASY?" . She also proceeds to tell us that she is not even our server and someone by the name of Molly is.  Molly comes over and apologizes for the inconvenience. At this point we are over it and just want our check to leave. This was my first and last time eating here at this establishment.  Tacos were decent and the margaritas was awesome.  The entire experience with there staff sucks.  I am not even the type of Yelper to complain or even write 1 star reviews.  I am sorry Big Star but you deserved this 1 star review.

Absolutely awesome tacos! I got a pork belly and pork shoulder taco. Had some Chicago beers here, too. The chips and salsa were not that good in my opinion. This is a lovely place to visit on a hot summer day. I've been here twice and loved it both times. The tacos are tiny but super yummy. The staff is speedy and the drinks are refreshing. A great place to start your day in Wicker Park on a weekend or holiday.

Queso Fundido, porkbelly taco & chips & guac are all stellar and have kept me coming back for the last 5 years though I can count on one hand how many times the staff hasn't been rude as can be! Was a fan of their chicken taco as well, but last time I ordered it they had covered it with a very large amount of some foodstuff resembling a pile of sawdust, crumbled cheese and sesame seeds maybe? What was wrong with the old one? Who knows. They still managed to maintain a rude staff though...  Last time I was there the waitress treated our table like we had assaulted her mother, scowling, jerking items off of and around the table. This is something I've encountered year in and out - Encase this wasn't clear - their staff is rude.

Ok wow!! My friend had a daytime bar crawl for her birthday and this is where we started, we had such a blast! First off, their patio is the  bomb.com . It's HUGE, and DOG friendly! We had a table reserved, so we didn't have to wait, but there was a pretty long line by the host stand, but it was moving pretty quickly. Also the staff was incredibly accommodating when we had about 5 people show up last minute, they moved tables around quickly and made it seem like no issue. Our server was incredibly friendly and made the experience so much fun, we started with pitchers of their margaritas, be careful, they are crazy strong! Then we moved to Tacos, I had the chicken Mole and pork belly. WOW!! The flavors were amazing, so fresh and tasty. Overall the experience was fantastic and I will for sure be back.

Horrible first and last experience. The hostess staff was very rude. We answered the text that alerted us our table was ready 3 mins after we received it and our table was given away. Their rule and text message says you have up to 5 mins before the table should be given away.  The lady who took our order was at the bar drinking before we sat down so maybe she was wasted. She took our order, when it was delivered, we discovered we were missing one taco. The order taker came back and said, " What is it that you believe you're missing. She said it in a way that implied we couldn't possibly be missing anything and was very arrogant and sarcastic.  Molly took over but the experience was already ruined for me by this point. I felt bad because Molly seemed really nice. The tacos were good, but nothing that would make me want to endure the sh*tty service again for.

Really liked this place! I think it's pretty typically packed, especially when it is nice out, so keep that in mind when you go. We walked up and gave our name and asked how long the wait would be for 3 people and the hostess said, "We are a bar so we can not estimate wait times but there are 15 people ahead of you which is very low for us." Pretentious and pretty obnoxious but we waited none the less. I gave my phone number and they told me they would text me when the table was ready. Five minutes later, I got a text and we were seated inside. They do ask you your preference but we were hungry so we took whatever came up first. We were given an enormous booth for 3 people so they do truly just go down the list and give tables in order of when you came. I ordered the Big Star margarita and it was awesome! Loved the smoky flavor from the mezcal. We also split chips and guac and that was also so delicious. Really well made guac. I was impressed with the number of vegetarian options on the menu! I usually don't have more than 1, maybe 2, certainly not 3 or 4! I ordered two tacos, one with pinto beans and one with potatoes. Both were delicious! My friend ordered pork belly and thought it was good but nothing special and my husband ordered beef tacos and said the same thing. Vegetarian for the win again! Really liked this place. It had a really fun atmosphere. I would totally come back.

Went there last night, beautiful night, wonderful atmosphere, this place rocks!!!  They have the crap together, using computers for the wait staff, and the kitchen brings out your drinks and food.  They have a minimum menu, but the quacamole was the best that I have had, and the lamb tacos rocked.  I would go again when I go to Wicker Park again!!!

I don't know how peeps don't give this place more stars! Killer margaritas, good tequila selection, great tacos albeit only like 5 different kinds. Very small menu but everything is great!. You gotta go on a sunny day, mostly the entire place is outside. Get there at 11 with your group of friends and you won't wait inlind. Sit there for a few hours sipping on margs and meander through their taco list for a few hours in the sunshine listening to some good vibes and talking it up with friends!

Big Star is located in a pretty solid and visible spot in Wicker Park. The patio is amazing!! I've heard this place gets packed on the weekends but luckily I had time to come to this side of town on a Tuesday afternoon for lunch. Zero wait and great service. Chips and guac as a starter is a must and I definitely recommend ordering the fish taco and the el pastor taco. No doubt that I will be back!

How have I not reviewed this place yet?  No worries...pretty much all of Chicago has and you are in good company when reading this review.  Yes, the wait times can be incredibly long but they will text you when the table is ready so you are free to wander the neighborhood (or as we did, drink somewhere else until the table was ready.  On a nice summer day, there is no place better to sit out, eat a few tacos (usually a good appetite can handle 3) and get white girl wasted on margaritas (I say this as at least 10 of them bumped into our table trying to walk out).  Of the tacos, the pastor is my favorite.  Great tender pork that is complemented by pineapples, onion and cilantro.  Another thing to look out for is their queso fundido.  The highlight was the fresh corn tortillas you can spoon the cheese onto. Come.  Gorge yourself on some tacos.  Drink some margaritas.  And try not to bump into other people's tables on your way out.

Ordered big star margaritas with no salt and they came with salt. Ordered guacamole no cilantro and it came with cilantro. Asked for milk for my son and she never got back to me. Asked for a glass with my cider which I never got. Gave her a $100 cash to pay the tab and she gave me the wrong change back. She assumed I gave her $80. What server doesn't count the cash handed to them. Service was terrible.  Walking taco was good. I've had better guacamole. And the frijoles charros was disgusting.

It took forever to get seated but we also had a party of eight, so it might be quicker with a smaller party. It was totally packed from the time we got there at 3pm until we left at 6:30. They have a fantastic patio and it was a great atmosphere. Despite it being so crowded, we weren't rushed at all. We ordered chips, queso, and guacamole to start. The guac is $8 for a small-ish bowl but it was so delicious that we were okay with it. The queso was good too but not as good as the guac. For tacos, I had the pescado, the al pastor, and the pork belly. I thought the pork belly taco was by far the best and the pescado was the worst. The batter to fish ratio was off on the taco and the sauce wasn't that great; it tasted a lot like mayo. We also had four or five pitchers of margaritas which were delicious. Definitely order them one at a time because the ice melts quickly if it's warm out. We also had shots of whiskey and there was little judgment from our server, which was much appreciated at 4pm on a Saturday. Definitely check this place out, but get to the neighborhood early and plan to explore or grab a drink while you wait.

As much as I dislike the amount of people that flock to this place, I still like coming by once in a  while. Their tacos are fresh and light and the flavors are strong. I prefer the panza, pescado, and pollo tacos. Their ensalada de big star is ginormous. I order it with chicken and it's pretty hard to finish. I also like that you can order single tacos and you aren't forced to order 2 tacos of each.. ahem.. like a place down the street. If you don't want to deal with the crowds, I would recommend coming by for a weekday lunch or early weekday dinner. Or just get your order to-go at the window and eat it at a communal table outside. Oh yea, they take credit cards now!
I just really like Big Star when the weather is nice.  Good food, good Margaritas, and a great patio.

The cooler-than-thou attitude of the bartenders was tolerable before Big Star blew up (years ago) and it was possible (same) to get a drink in under five minutes. Now, you have people behind the bar who don't realize BS hasn't always had margaritas on tap (mixed drinks on tap, always always a bad sign) and those few who have stuck with it are too enamored with their own faux-celebrity to bother servicing customers. Get some friends together, get food from the pickup window, mix up some margaritas at home and enjoy yourselves on your own patio / front stoop / kitchen away from the insufferable people who work here who are now just kidding themselves.

Both times I have been here I have had a horrible experience with the staff; you can count on them being extremely snobby and rude. Not to mention the food is unoriginal with play on middle school snacks-walking tacos? Give me real food if you're going to charge me up the ass. Do not go here. i would suggest Antique Taco. Way better food and way friendlier staff.

This place is great. Our waitress was absolutely awful though, her name was Alana. Normally I'd drop this to a 2 but the food, atmosphere, and other employees were so great it still gets a 4. The waiter, Alonzo, was Awesome. Margarita pitchers are where it's at.

Ordered delivery. Tacos came covered in hair. Lots of hair. Like from different people: some blond, some brunette. One a little too squiggly. It was like a rainbow party but for tacos and body hair. Or maybe they were grooming short-haired dogs in the kitchen. I don't know. I don't know. Anything's possible. Ate one taco before I noticed the second's condition and spent the next five minutes with my head in a toilet. I asked myself, is this how girls achieve bulimia? Because I've tried sticking my finger down my throat and nothing happened, and I was always like DARN, spring break is coming up! But the thought of what I had just consumed, well... now I know how it's done.  Too bad I'm too old for spring break. Big Star tacos: 5 stars for bulimia trigger, -4 stars for destroying my belief that people are inherently good [at hygiene].

Big Star has great taco's and delicious palomas. The al pastor taco is out of this world. They have great outdoor patio which pretty much is the entire restaurant. They do have about 5 large tables inside as well as seating at the bar. This is a great place to sit in the sun, have a few drinks/tacos and catch up with friends. The service can be spotty but it certainly doesn't mean I do not come back. They  also now take card which is awesome. I don't believe they take reservations. There is usually an hour wait so make sure you get there early to beat the lines.

Um, I don't get it.  Critics love it, people wait in line for it and it continuously makes best of lists.  i ask the question WHY???  The tacos are not very good, they are dry, bland and always served cold. The last time I was there one bite of my veggie taco and the flavor of one day past its lifetime lingered in my mouth.  Never Again, if you want equally bad tacos skip the line and head to Flash down the street.

The food is always good but sometimes the wait for a table sucks and sometimes I wish they had more people working because I usually end up with three different waitresses helping me and communication gets lost at times. But food is good! :)

The only reason I am giving it two stars is for the patio atmosphere. Other than that, the tacos are average at best and he hostesses are clueless when it comes to giving you an approximate wait time. We were waiting on a table for five and we were told that it would be a 45 minute wait. Ok, no big deal. Our group ended up getting a few drinks at the bar. However, 45 minutes later, we still had not received a text message. We went back to the hostess, and she advised that we would not be seated for ANOTHER HOUR and there were still 20 tables in front of our party. I understand it was the first nice day of the summer, but be a little more realistic and respectful of your customer's time.  We ended up getting tacos next door at the walk-up window, and conveniently right after we finished, maybe 15 minutes later, we received a text message saying that our table was ready.  Will most likely not be going back as there are other, and better, alternatives for drinks and food.

I love this place for many reasons. I love the outdoor seating and the general decor. I also love their bar (they have the best margarita's I've had in my entire life). The tacos are good but they aren't the best I've ever had. This is a good place to go and hangout and drink, maybe have a taco or two, but mostly to just drink and hangout. I've been going for years and I absolutely love the place.
Delicious tacos, love the selection! Good drinks, great service, delicious food, and outdoor patio seating!! Couldn't have asked for anything more on the first warm Chicago evening this year.

I was telling a friend the other day that this place is not a Mexican Restaurant that decided to add a bar, it's a bar that seemed to throw in a Mexican theme, seemingly very hipster. The layout is quite obnoxious unless you're sitting on the patio (which of course is always packed, probably due to this). The bar is literally in the MIDDLE of the room, so people are constantly in the way of one another whether it's clientele that's standing around and waiting for a table to open up (because this place is far too "cool" to have a host or hostess to let you know when a spot is open) or servers/busboys running around. The food was really meh too, you could tell the Mexican theme was an afterthought. $9 for 2 small tacos, what a joke. The only thing worth the money was the pitcher of Margarita (even then it's loaded with way too much ice, probably to skimp on the alcohol) and the Queso Fundido which is also a small portion for the price. I won't be back, I can get better food and drinks elsewhere.

Delicious guacamole, flavorful tacos, margaritas that hit the spot! Plus the patio is perfect on a nice night. If you are not in any hurry, as in you can wait 2.5 hours for a table on a Saturday night, then Big Star is great!  They'll text you when your table is ready so you can go to the bar for a drink or head home for a while like we did lol. Great food but crazy wait for tacos amiright?!

My go to for the past two years. My personal favorite Paul Kahan restaurant.  Patio, tacos, and margaritas is the perfect combination. Hell even in the dead of winter I'll be coming here for tacos.  Two tacos that stand above the rest: fish and the al pastor. The fish is crispy delicious while the pork and pineapple combo gives you that magic fatty/acid combo. Both these tacos compliments each other very well. Guacamole has a light and airy texture and one of my favorite guacamoles in the city.  Margaritas are also a must have. Order by the pitcher with salt rimmed glasses and you have the perfect patio setup.  What really sets big star above the rest is the atmosphere. wicker parks thriving neighborhood is the perfect spot to people watch as you devour tacos and sip on micheladas. At night, the Christmas lights go up and makes a perfect place to grab a bite after a show at the Double Doors. Def a must go to in Chicago

Waited for 15 minutes for the server to get my drink order. She was oblivious. So I left without ever being waited on. 15 minute sittin in my seat waiting at 4:00pm on a Tuesday? Amateur hour. 2 stars cause I got free ice water.  Won't be back. The hostess was very apologetic and sweet.

I was here recently with some out of town friends. We sat on the inside in a corner. The tables are cramped! I had 2 drinks and a beer, they were OK. I ordered the Queso Fundido and that however was disgusting!!! I will come back though, this was my second visit and I have yet to get tacos and try their margaritas but it's always so crowded and so dog gone LOUD.

Ate here on Cinco de Mayo and I was impressed by how quickly my friend and I were served considering that the entire venue was packed. Hands down, the best tilapia I've ever had especially in a taco! The margaritas come in a small glass, but they are strong... so if you're a lightweight, I would think twice before ordering a pitcher!

Was sitting there on my phone. Staff descended on my table, grabbed bags and called me a motherfucker. I asked to see a manager. Instead they forced me out. I was doing nothing, security was confrontational. When management finally came, they admitted I did nothing wrong, security was at fault and then refused to actually apologize. Please please please do not go here. They do not care how the staff carries themselves and such a thing feels very dangerous in the service industry.

Solid tacos in the heart of Wicker Park. Wait can get pretty intense even on weeknights but you can give them your number and they will text you when available. We opted for the take out menu and I tried al pastor, alambre de res and el pescado. I loved the alambre de res esp the mangos on top - fave taco of the night. Its not the best tacos in Chicago (that would be El Milagro in Little Village) but its a good option in this part of town with a fun atmosphere
Best fish tacos ever! Get the PESCADO. Outstanding! The atmosphere is pretty cool too. Laid back. Good food and good vibes

This review is on the Queso Fundido since that's the only food we ordered. It was really good! It had fresh herbs and spices and chorizo underneath all that goodness!  The warm corn tortillas were good and it didn't take long to get the dish.  I was a lil disappointed in the horchata it was watered down and may have been one of the worst I have ever had. I asked if they could make a  Rumchata and the server acted like he knew exactly what that was... To my disappointment I got a water down drink that looked like non-fat milk. Every Time I have ordered one they throw cinnamon on top and it taste amazing! This was an epic fail!  I will however return to taste the tacos! :) and definitely recommend stopping in for some cheese!
I went for my first time for 5 de mayo for girls night. The tacos were delicious.  It was long wait but so worth it. I would highly recommend to visit the restaurant.

Unbelievably good tacos. My son the student knows Chicago eateries, and wanted us to try these. Not disappointed!! Fish, pork, and chicken were all amazing!! Fresh and creative twist on a classic fast food
Great spot! Especially during summer. Great tacos, good margaritas and a solid selection of beer. Perfect spot for a good time with a group of friends. Will definitely come back :)

I don't get it - why do people like this place and keep coming back? The salsas had no flavor. I had to douse my fish taco in hot sauce to mask the taste of the fish that clearly wasn't fresh. The pork was way too salty and the steak taco came with a cheese that should never be on mexican food.  I tried to give this place another shot, but I don't think I'll be coming back.  The only reason I'm giving this place 2 stars is because the atmosphere is pretty cool. Other than that, Big Star has no redeeming qualities.

Dear god I was wrong about this place. I had some tacos de Panzo which is the pork belly one. It was salty beyond belief, no other taste. I could barely swallow the pork belly. The cheese on top was flavorless. Additionally the lady working the window was rude and closed the window in my face as I was about to order. Unfortunately the taco scene in Chicago is just sad....

Came for my first Big Star visit of the season, and it did not disappoint. We brought a group of guests from out of town, and everything was spot on.  Food: A Amazing tacos. Not only are the flavors great, but they always come overflowing with filling for a great price. I could eat the al pastor here every day! Wonderful chunky guac as well.  Service: A Despite how much this place is (especially on one of the first warm days of the season), we have always had a great experience with this service. The servers have it down, and food always comes out within 15-20 minutes. Can't beat that! Atmosphere: A+ Great place to people watch on a warm day. Vibrant, fun, lively- just perfect.
Some of my favorite tacos in Chicago. Summers here are awesome as the front patio opens up. Cash only!

I hate this place and its putrid stink of pretentious hipster. I wish it had a face so I could deliver it the proverbial punch that this huge portion of the Chicago population so desperately deserves.

I know this place is busy and I loved going here. Maybe it's because I got takeout , but I noticed it was let that good. The guac has too much lime or cilantro in it and I ended up throwing it out. I hope it was just because I ordered takeout and Big star is not going down hill. antique taco and taco joint are my favorite now
Their Queso Fundido was absolutely perfect. I would definitely go back just for this! I wasn't too found of the tacos and actually found them ok.

More like HIP-star! This place is crawling with hipsters. You know who's not a hipster? Allanah the bartender. Allanah is a in fact a psychic. After a night of heavy drinking I needed relief. She took one look at me pulling up to the bar, and without words gave me what I needed: an ice cold tecate with lime, a shot of hornitos, and a Taco Pescado and a Taco Alambre De Res. Sure made this San Diego boy feel right at home.  All while Dolly Parton's silky vinyl voice filled the Chicago sunny morning air. The tacos? Right int he sweet spot. Although I would, in time like to see rolled tacos make an appearance in the Windy City. Just sayin'. The buzz begins to kick in slow and smooth.  I love this place. I would even give a hipster a hug here. Why? Because Big Star and Chicago is one fine and friendly place. And although I only got to experience her charms for but a few days, she made me feel all warm and gooey like Chaka Khan in a bubble bath. Pro Tip: Bring lumberjack repellant.

We went on a Friday around 6:30 PM and this place was hopping. The bartenders helped us quickly and the drinks were great. We did not get food, but as a Mexican Foodie, I would say that their chips/salsa/guac and tacos looked phenomenal.

I came here on Cinco de Mayo and thought it was going to be totally insane, but the wait ended up being only 25 minutes - not so bad! I think the trick is to go after hours. We got there at 10 pm and got a seat at the bar right away and then got seated shortly afterwards. The tacos we got, al pastor and fish, were pretty good, although I did take a star off because I didn't like the tortilla very much - it seems like it's uncooked or something - and I didn't love the margaritas - too sour for me. I will say though that the margaritas were very strong for something that they keep on tap. Also, if you go, you MUST order the fondido, baked cheese. It is one of the best fondidos I've ever had. I recommend sitting on the patio even if it's a little chilly out. They have space heaters that really work and the patio is pretty amazing.

Food was good. We waited for 3 hours, yes three hours for our table on Cinco de Mayo. Everything came out fast and delicious. Our waiter however was rude at the end when she was telling us that she could only split the check two ways and wasn't about splitting the bill on five different cards. I've worked in the service industry and so have many of my friends that I was with who also agreed that it was unnecessary to say in such a demeaning way.
We love the Pastor and the Fish tacos. The outdoor patio where you can eat (but not drink alcohol) is also a great alternative to waiting in line -- especially on a weekend.

So disappointed. Tacos were so mediocre, margarita was not good, and customer service was bad. For some reason people feel the need to block the hallway to go to the bathroom and don't want to move out of your way. I've been wanted to try this place for 2 years and I finally tried it after a 1.5 wait.They forgot 2 dishes and of course they were on the receipt. Yes um excuse me, please take this off my tab because I never received it. Thanks! Oh and for reason when you go to places like this where it's super popular and it's a "younger" crowd, the host tends to treat everyone as if they are kids and have a sense of arrogance. Don't tell a grown adult "Next time you need to have 75% of your party here to be seat." How about next time I don't ever come back! Way to show your great customer service by talking to me like I'm your child!

The food here is fantastic. And I've been here a few times before but I came in just for a beer and to buy 30 tortillas for a bbq I'm having and even though the bartender was stupid busy she was so extremely nice even though she was running around due to my unusual request. She was pretty much the perfect bartender. Before even giving me the tortillas she sent me out a side of them to make sure it was what I wanted. I didn't catch her name but she was a young blonde bartender Saturday afternoon. Thanks lady! You killed it.
Not really sure what all the hype is about. The place is way too busy and tacos aren't as good as everyone screams about. They're solid, just not the best. Middle of the road on a good day.

You crazy mid-westerners. Yes, Big Star's food--even though it's simply tacos and other like items--is strangely good, above what tacos are supposed to be able to achieve. But I write to point out the "Walking Taco," a Frito-lays snack bag where you pour in taco sauce, cheese, and other items typically had in their soft tacos. I sent a picture of it to my 'rents and they said the same: you crazy mid-westerners.

The tacos here are very good, but a little pricey. The guacamole was fantastic. The inside atmosphere is kind of loud, making conversation a little difficult. The drink menu is extensive is definitely a place to visit if you like whiskey. The outside patio is a very nice touch.

Amazing tacos and drinks! I hear that they are no longer cash only which is amazing, because cash only is complete bullshit and it drives me insane. Good move.  Great atmosphere and it's really good for groups so you can share.

Almost all of the tacos are gluten free (except the beer battered fish), everything we had was amazing, the queso fundido was awesome!  Minus one star for being cash only (which has since been changed), and being crazy busy all the time. Can't wait to go back though!

Been going to area a lot and always wondered what the big deal was with the place so finally my boyfriend and I decided to try it.  Overall. The food is edible- it's good. Just good. We tried the pastor and panza tacos. They were both good but I don't know maybe because IM MEXICAN I didn't find anything special about them. The pastor ones were better though. Also had a Paloma and that was good.  And tried their frijoles charros and meh. Sorry. Don't see myself going there every chance I get.

I went in this previous Sunday around 8pm. My friend and I sat at the bar. Our bartender had a brown long bob. Who gave us the worst service I've ever received. So I'm allergic to onions. The worst allergy ever. It triggers migraines with auras that last about a day. So I clearly ordered my food asking for no onions. My tacos came and there were green onions on them. After a few minutes I'm finally able to grab her attention. I said excuse me but I ordered my food with no onions, I'm sorry but I can't eat these. Very rudely she said I ordered them with no onions. Hello bartender I'm sure you ordered them with no onions. But clearly there were onions all over the food. I just wanted some tacos with out onions. I really don't think that's asking much. She didn't offer to have them remade or anything. Instead she refunded me by practically throwing my money back at me, without even asking. This isn't the first time I've been treated poorly here. They seem to hire the rudest staff I've ever met. So Big Star I'm breaking up with you for good.
Holy Fuck these were the best tacos ever.  I'm glad Mike and Jess took me here.  YEAHHHHHH.

Love the food here! I got the pescado, potato w pepper, and mushroom tacos and they were all delicious and authentic. The guacamole and salsa was also very flavorful and fresh.  There was a wait when I first got there which there usually is when the weather is nice bc of the large patio. The cool thing is the host takes your number and texts you when your table is ready so you can walk around and shop while waiting for your table to be ready.  My only complaint is that they allow people to bring their dogs on the patio. I absolutely love dogs but when a dog is barking for 45 minutes straight when you've waited for awhile to get a table it gets a little irritating.  All in all I really do like this place and will be a returning customer. Just an FYI if you plan on going it's cash only but they do have an ATM.
