I think the 3.5 stars has a lot to do with the wait time but seriously? I mean, places with long waits are actually WORTH THE WAIT. The food here is phenomenal. Regardless of the volume of people at this place, they make sure everything is cooked to perfection. My advice: try everything from the queso fundido to the modern Mexican tacos!!!! :)
This place gets extremely busy however, the food is great. Perfect spot for an outdoor meal.

My friends and I came here late at night after seeing such a huge crowd during the day. Big Star must have been good if there were so many people. We walked in and just decided to get a late night snack. We ordered a cheese dip, which was not good and I'm a huge fan of cheese. We also ordered chips and guac, which was meh. That's when one of my friends saw the sign for $3 whiskey shots daily. We proceeded to order a round of shots. And then, another round and another. We must have ordered at least 5 rounds of whiskey shots. Big Star would have only received 2 stars, but this cheap deal for alcohol definitely gained a star.
These tacos and margaritas are my everything! I recommend going on a nice day... The outdoor area is perfect for Saturday's and Sunday's!  This place definitely gets crowded so be prepared to wait.

Great selections of tacos. I had tried the pescado taco, the walking taco, taco al pAstor, taco de panza, and taco de zanahorias. It was all great and delicious. There is a wait for seating. The wait seating is worth it because everyone enjoys this place. Please check out the place if your in Chicago and or visiting. Eat some tacos while you are there!!!

Overall ok, maybe a little underwhelming given the wait. The vibe of the place was good, really energetic. Cocktail list was interesting and varied. Tacos were good, but you don't get much for the price. Tortillas were a bit thick (you get one per taco, they're not doubled up), and wedges of lime wouldn't be a bad idea for some of the richer ones like pork belly. This would be a great summer spot, when you can sit outdoors.

This place is ridiculous and over priced, service is god awful. I get it, you're an iconic restaurant in this part of the city... but that doesn't mean that every single employee from the hostess to the bartender and waitress treat as if you don't matter. Let's face it, making a good taco isn't rocket science... so having good food isn't that redeeming of a quality.
Great margaritas and food; not from here so I wasn't expecting it to be cash only. We had a pitcher of margaritas; it was huge and very good. The guacamole was also fresh and very tasty.
El pastor the for win!!! The best tacos in the city. Service kinda sucks but that's what I expect in bucktown. Great food though.

Reservation - couldn't get a hold of them on the phone don't even bother to try Food - great!!! love everything Drink - a bit expensive but it's reasonable for the area Service - fabulous, good service Parking - street park soooo hard to find but around that area it pretty normal Seating- we get seated right away so no complain to that Overall experience - will go back and will recommend people to go there.

First visit. 45 min wait at 8pm on a Thursday so this place is popular. Was it worth the wait? Mostly.  We got drinks from the bar while we waited. Bartenders were quite friendly w no pretension. Margarita was a solid B. Strong and bright.  Once we were seated server came by pretty quickly and we ordered the chips and salsa and guacamole along with the queso fundido. It's safe to say that these were the best parts of the meal. The guacamole was fantastic and I'm a guacamole snob. The queso fundido was quite simply the best any of us had ever had. Outstanding! Between all of us we tried pretty much all the varieties of tacos. We all felt like they were good - not awesome - but everything was certainly fresh. The only real flop of the night were the beans. They were watery and tasteless so pass on those.  Oh one more complaint. I've always subscribed to the notion that "if it's too loud you're too old" but I've got to tell you it was too loud!! So it ends up that in a crowded restaurant everyone is yelling just to be heard at their own tables. I sort of felt like I was on sensory overload by the time we left. So overall pretty good place. Fix the beans and turn down the music and I'm at five-stars.
My hairdresser recommended this place. We showed up and had to wait. We ended up just sitting outside. We ordered tacos and a pitcher of margaritas. Nothing was good!

We were in Chi for the weekend and had some friends recommend this place.  We showed up and had a little bit of a wait but no big deal.  We ended up just sitting outside.  The guac was spectacular.   We ended up getting 4 or 5 tacos and a pitcher of margaritas.  The tacos were OK...  Nothing too special.  The margarita was equally ok.   The problem is when we got the check.  The margarita pitcher was 40 bucks.  The total bill was close to 80 bucks.  Outrageous for what we had.  A warning from the waiter would've been appreciated.  Maybe we're just used to smaller-city prices but $15-20 for pitcher is pretty standard.

Come for the tacos and margaritas. Ridiculously good.  Guacamole and queso fondido was perfection as well.  My kid stole my tacos and ate them, he doesn't normally eat tacos.  He and I both wanted more.   The wait is just long, both times we have been here.  Our servers were spectacular and once we got seated, the wait for food wasn't long.   I would like to return maybe on a weekday or random time to see if the wait isn't at least an hour.  Keep up the work on the tacos and food, no complaints there at all.

My expectations for this place were very high. I've heard so many positive things and a lot of my friends love it. We had to wait 45+ minutes for a table because they do not take reservations. Once we sat down, we ordered queso and a margarita pitcher. The margarita's were great and pretty strong but the queso came with no chips, crackers, or anything so your basically eating just cheese. It also is not the traditional queso dip. My friend and I asked for a side of chips to eat the dip and the waitress said she'd get them right away.  15+ minutes later the waitress had still not returned and our food was served. I asked the man who delivered the food for the chips and he very rudely told me there was nothing he could do. We had not even touched the queso but started eating the tacos. I FINALLY flagged the waitress down and she apologized and said she'd send out chips asap. When the chips came out, the same man who refused to help earlier delivered them to our table which I thought was ironic. The food was SO average. We barely ate the dip because it was cold by the time the chips arrived. Would have rather just not ordered it at all. This place is definitely not worth all the hype.  I will return but only because my friends like it. Overall, the staff is rude, its cash only, service is slow, and the food is not that great.

Great tacos in a fun spot.  Margaritas are tasty and strong, which is nice since they're a little pricey.  Fish tacos are my go-to, the spicy chipotle mayo delivers an awesome kick.  The pork shoulder taco was good too, as was the potato one.  My only complaint is that they can get pretty busy--I once went on a Saturday night and could barely breathe it was so crowded
5 stars for the atmosphere and amazing pitchers of margaritas! But 2 stars for the food. Best to sit outside on a warm summer day to enjoy some drinks if that's your mission

People rave about the tacos but my guess is they have never had tacos anywhere in LA or San Diego which set the bar. There is always a wait here and service is rude. Not sure what the draw is here besides a large outdoor patio.

Amazing food! Hostess was great and super friendly. It took 10 minutes for anyone to come over and check on my table to order drinks. We ended up ordering food and drinks all at once, and the food came out first. Waitress did not came by to check on us while eating, and was hard to locate when trying to ask for the bill. She was then MIA when I wanted to give my payment. No one warned me ahead of time that the place was cash only. Thank goodness one of the bus boys had on a Big Star shirt that read cash only. (And We had cash!) They also were super quick to clean up the table, which was great. Would come back for the food, but will be leery of he service.

Had a great dinner here. Amazing flavors in these tacos that I've never tasted before. I bragged to everyone about how I got to taste their amazing food over the weekend.  I order the taco al pastor and the taco de carne con chile verde.  Best tacos I've ever had. And I don't say that lightly. I also got the classic margarita which was tasty. Unlike the whiskey cocktail called the "two step tussle" which was hard to drink. The taste was just strange.  I grew up eating Mexican and American food since I'm 50/50. And I've never tasted tacos that had such amazing flavors. Specifically speaking about the taco al pastor. The pineapple was amazing and the pork was perfect. They went together so well I was mad that I haven't been eating these tacos my whole life.  The taco de carne had black beans spread on the tortilla under the meat which made every bite so delicate and savory. I'm making myself hungry.  The down sides to dining at Big Star consist of -cash only -can be extremely busy -not every drink is a winner. But when it is, it's delicious.
Tacos are phenomenal.  5 star tacos indeed but they lack in sides.  You think tacos you think rice and beans and that's the only reason I give a 4 star

Amazing tacos. Been here only once before a few summers ago. Fresh ingredients with amazing flavor. A true modern day eat. I'm not a big fish guy, but their fish taco blew my mind. (Pescado). The Al Pastor with delicious Tasting pork shoulder and grilled pineapple is still my favoortie. So glad we came here. I had to write a review

Horrible. Showed up stone sober to meet my parents for dinner and was turned away for being "drunk." Used to frequent this establishment and had nothing but good things to say but now highly unrecommended.

I had heard many, MANY wonderful things about Big Star and was waiting for the day I finally got to go and check it out. It wasn't as impressive as everyone made it seem. It was pretty average in my opinion. Don't get me wrong, the walking taco I had was insanely flavorful and delicious. The margaritas were strong. However, my friends and I weren't as impressed by the service and the actual tacos. Maybe it was an off night, but the chicken was dry, the service was slow and inaccurate, and our server had excuses for why items we ordered weren't coming out (such as: we were just talking about the queso fundido instead of actually ordering it). We were six people and we all remember asking how good it was and then saying we wanted one order.  Will I be back? Probably, since my other friends love it. And, I did really enjoy the walking taco! But, I'll probably be trying the other taco places in the city first. PS - Don't forget, it's cash only!

I've been here a bunch of times and the drinks and food are always quick and very yummy.  However, it is always crowded and the cash only part stinks... Otherwise it is a great place to eat at in the summer time!

Big Star was recommended by a few guides and unfortunately disappointed. We stopped by for lunch middle of the afternoon. Sadly, the combination of less than stellar tacos (at a higher than average price point) and lack of service made for a lame experience. At any other taco joint, I might have done a second round of tacos, but I just had to leave after the first here. Taco de Panza (3/5): This may have been the tastiest of the three tacos I had. The pork belly could have been fattier, but the crispiness was also nice in this particular taco. -- $4 Taco al Pastor (2/5): This was the most disappoint one, since it is normally one of my favorites. Unfortunately, the pork shoulder was too dry, and just overall felt underwhelmed, especially since you're paying $4 for it.  -- $4  Taco de Pescado (2/5): This was actually quite a bit of tilapia, almost too much in my opinion because the fish itself was not that flavored and this relied on the chipotle mayo. Added quite a bit of red and green sauce to flavor this up. -- $4 Service (1/5): We got seated immediately and food came up relatively quickly. However, it seemed we were completely forgotten soon as we got our food. After our plates finally got taken away, we waited for a good 15 min before we were able to flag someone to ask for the check. Unfortunately, despite the request, we still waited another 10 min before we just walked up to the hostess, paid her in cash, and bounced.  ------------------------------------------------------------------------ How food scoring works (very subjective, and relative to price) 1 - Given the price, no 3 - Worth, taste is on par with price 5 - An absolute steal, amazing taste and great value

This is the go to taco spot in the WP ! Pretty much ALWAYS packed although I love that they added the new order out window next door with additional outdoor seating . This saved my girl and I from most likely a hour wait when all we wanted was some quick food before a art event .Only downside is the order out window doesn't serve liquor but that was ok with us (THIS day at least );) Their Guac is amazeballs !As are the tacos (fish taco being my favorite ) And of course cant forget the signature Margaritas and Micheladas !! SI porfavor !!

It is what it is: a Hipster bar serving amazing tacos and Mexican-style food for reasonable prices. Food: $3 tacos that are simply fantastic. Fish, pork belly, al pastor all delicious. The chicken tostada is spicy enough to satisfy any heat craving you have. Don't forget their really good guac! Sonora Dogs will fill you up for $7 and have a good amount of heat too.  Drink: Good selection of cheap or tasty beers, but even the better beers don't hit the pocket too hard. Margarita's chilled and strong, the way they should be. Whiskey, bourbon, and tequila selection is great. Try some, and get the bartenders to suggest some for you. After trying the $3 whiskey shot and loving it I got some ideas for delving deeper, along with some samples.  Ambiance: White walls. Plain tables. Big bar. Flannel. Long wait times. Elbow your way to the bar or a side rail and order or you'll never get a meal. Probably the biggest downside, but I've never found the staff rude, just occasionally inefficient or busy.  Bottom Line: It's a must try. Bring cash, flannel, and patience. Or go for takeout.

The servers and the busboys need to calm down.  From the minute you sit down they're trying to rush you out the door... I had to literally hold onto my drink and plates so some swooping busboy wouldn't come and clear it in an instant if I happened to blink.  Food was great though but can't eat and be rushed... bad tact ... not deserving of a good tip... left one anyway.

We stopped in Big Star on a Wednesday afternoon. I have seen how crowded this place can get, so I really enjoyed how mellow the atmosphere was during lunch time.  The tacos were great, each espousing great flavor combinations. I recommend the Panza (pork belly) and the Al Pastor tacos. The Pollo taco was the most disappointing in terms of flavor. All meat was cooked very well. We also ordered chips and salsa, which tasted fresh and made in-house.  It's cash only (tax included in the price of the taco).  We did not drink, but there are some tempting specials and cheap shots offered. It's worth giving it a try for a flavorful taco.
Great tacos, great service and great drinks. We went there for a little lunch and stayed till dinner. Can't wait for the summer time!
It is sad to give Big Star a downgrade... But I went about a month ago and the food was SO bad! The tortillas were crispy/old/weird, the pastor was too sweet... Totally disappointed

I wish I can give this place a good review but this is not the case, I have been planning to go there with my friends for while and have a good time but unfortunately our experience was very unpleasant. The host was lost when we ask for our table (busy Friday night I understand). She told us we can wait at the bar for our table 30 minutes later still no table. One of my friend was running late and when he got here he could not get in the security guy (very rude and with a horrible attitude seriously this guy had no manners) told us that he will not get in until we have our table, well if our table was ready when we got here we would not have this problem. We could left our friend waiting outside so we decided to go somewhere else.
Ordered  a steak taco and received a (walking taco) ground beef. Place is a sham food sucks don't go!!!!!!!

Who needs a boyfriend when you have Big Star? I don't have enough good things to say about the tacos and margaritas! My roommate and I go in on a semi weekly basis, 1 pitcher of margs, 2 Al Pastor, 2 Pescado please.  A couple warnings, if it is above 50 degrees outside, it will be busy, VERY busy. Don't fret, I have rarely waited as long as they have predicted and often can find a spot at the bar. Also...CASH ONLY. Always a problem for me, but they do have an ATM by the bar, I prefer the Walgreens at 6 corners with a Chase ATM.  Vibe is great, food is even better, grab some good company and GO!

Amazing food, delicious drinks, great ambiance! Only drawback - cash only.  But if one can remember to carry cash (or are willing to shell out a bit extra at the atm machines) you're in for a treat. Firstly, I was lucky because even though I went in around 6pm on a Friday, what could've been an hour long wait, ended up being minutes because of the heavy snow fall we received that day. No one really had to wait, wait but the place was pretty packed nonetheless. I was there with my roomie and we sat at a table on the heated patio. A waiter promptly greeted us and took our orders. I had their house margarita and 3 tacos - fish, al pastor, and the potatoes one. Each one was the bomb-diggity in its own right! The meat was succulent, the flavors were bold, and the ingredients were fresh. The margarita was very good too. Since my friend was the designated driver, I couldn't order multiple pitchers for just myself but would love to try a few more in the near future. Street in front has paid parking so no hassle there and across the street is the Violet Hour which makes a great post-dinner stop. One more thing, their salsas were pretty good, although not the chunky, fresh ones I typically prefer but I did like that they had a good selection of the salsas and are pretty attentive about refilling the plates as and when you're done.

This place is crazy. Crazy busy! Its bar area is huge and inside and outside sit-in area is also huge, and everywhere is just packed with people.  I went their on a Saturday around 3pm and had 94 parties ahead of me. We just went straight to the bar and ordered a jug of margarita and about 40 minutes later, found some seats at the bar. I think it's much better this way than waiting for a table. Despite the long wait and craziness, I really like this place. The place is so lively and fun. A great place to go for early afternoon drinks with friends. Big Star Margarita is gooooood. Not too sweet, not too sour and quite strong. A pitcher lasted a long time. I think it made about 8-9 glasses. The Guac here is packed with flavor. Well seasoned with a lot of spices. Taco Al Pastor was okay. I will need to try more of their tacos to comment on it.  If you just want to try their taco, there is a separate window outside that you can order and pickup tacos. There's also a line for this, but much shorter than waiting for a table.

Great place to get tacos and beers with your friends, though the wait for a table can be kind of long on the weekends. If you can put your name down on the list earlier in the night, it really helps cut down on the wait time. I will say this place is better in the summer when you can sit outdoors. Tacos are fantastic. I always get the al pastor and the pescado. Both so flavorful and delicious. Paired with the North Coast Belgium Ale is perfection. Love it!
D I even have to? Amazing!  High end whiskey bar masquerading as a "Taco place" that happens to  do amazing food!
Not too interested in the queso fundido but the margaritas and tacos are great! Will def be back!

I came here on a Friday night. Against my better judgment, I allowed my friends to make the reservation. As many of you know, when working with people in their late twenties, "I'll make the reservation" often becomes "Oh, we'll be able to get a table," within a matter of seconds.  That being said, our experience was good. I had a chicken taco and a margarita at the bar. We ultimately didn't sit at a table to eat because, as you may have guessed, they were crazy busy. As far as the food goes, I had a chicken taco and a margarita. The chicken taco was pretty average as far as tacos go. Nothing truly special, but definitely a solid and well-seasoned few bites. The margarita was about the same - pretty standard fare. I imagine this to be the kind of food drunk people rave about but a sober person would likely pass on by. What really brought this place down for me were two things: First, the volume level. It's just way too loud in there. Conversations are not a great idea if you're anywhere near the bar. Second, the design of the place makes the bar a terrible place to sit or stand - serving staff, god bless them, were extremely courteous when they needed to get through, but the tight space in between the bar and the wall does them no favors. Perhaps I'll get dragged here some night when I've had a few drinks and my friends insist, and I'll think better of the place, but I think I won't go back again while sober.

The tacos are pretty good. They are also kind of expensive and tiny.  I went here for the first time recently and wasn't very impressed.  It was incredibly crowded and had a very long wait.  They only accept cash and of course it isn't clearly posted anywhere.  That's a very strange thing these days and I feel like there should be signs everywhere that let you know.  The service was pretty bad.  I didn't even get my drink refilled once.  It's also incredibly loud in the restaurant and very frustrating.  I honestly didn't even have a good time and will probably never go back.  This place is way overrated.  I suggesting just going to the take-out window and getting out of there as fast as possible.  The guacamole is amazing though!

Big star would receive 5 stars if the wait time wasn't an hour minimum and the wait time for my food wasn't so long. But I love the tacos I've tried all of them and they are all great! The booze is on point and I love the feel of the place!
Everything was fine. Service was decent; no huge issues. It's just that I can get a better taco elsewhere. The atmosphere is very specific and hipster. Overpriced for what you get.

I've been twice. Both times I wasn't blown away... Although they do have a bartender who looks like young Paul Rudd. Food: Panza is by far the best taco here.. And for me the only one worth waiting forever for. Chicken taco has a strange sweetness to it. Idk. Not for me. The new beef taco - meh.  The Guac here is on another level. So good.  The thing that I really don't like about big star is the way they serve the tacos... They just bring a big dish of all of your tacos - like the whole table's tacos on one platter - and you have to remember what taco is what and divvy it up yourselves like some kind of animal.  It's weird. I ordered my thing so I want it placed in front of me like I'm a human at a normal restaurant.  Why? Why big star? Why do we have to be served like a bunch of pirates??? Whatever. I'll just go to Taikito Kitchen. Don't worry.

I used to LOVE big star.  I still like big star, but I definitely don't love it.  I wish they rotated the items on the menu more like they used to.  They used to have a summer squash taco in the summer, a winter squash taco in the winter, etc.  Now, they have had the disgusting carrot taco on the menu for waaaaaay too long.  And, the mushroom taco is nowhere near as good as it should be.  The veggie options are definitely slipping.  Still, I stop by occasionally for chips/salsa and drinks (but I hate that they got rid of the squirt bottles of hot sauce and instead bring out the salsa in tiny bowls).  The drinks are still AMAZING.   Bring back the better veggie options and more seasonal rotations and I will fall back in love with big star.

If you don't like Big Star you don't like tacos. And everyone likes tacos. A friend suggested we go to Big Star for dinner one weekend, but warned me about the wait. We put our name in and found a bar nearby to relax at in the meantine. What's nice is that despite the crazy wait, they'll text you when your table is ready. What's not so nice is that you only get a certain number of minutes to get back before they give your table up. So we had just gotten a new round of drinks when the text came. We chugged, and arrived at Big Star feeling good. It was a small price to pay for a massive platter of tacos. I had the al pastor and the taco de pescado. The pork was flavorful and tender, and the fish was wonderfully battered and crispy. We also had the queso fundido which was a great cheesy start to the meal. We were able to snag a table outside. It has a fun party vibe and is a great place to hang outside with friends in the nice weather.

Pretty cool place and the tacos are amazing!  The fish taco was my favorite! I was only disappointed that I didn't order more food....The place was packed.  There's a hipster vibe going on here.  The security guard at the entrance was a bit awkward and weird but whatever, I guess that's necessary.  This is a cash only spot so make sure you've got that covered.  Overall, loved this place and definitely planning on going back.

Ok then went to dis joint big star wid anton an jerry for da tacos and some cold beers. really good joint. Anton got us magritas an after tree of them I went outside and got lost. Jerry finds me in alley so we goes back to meet polski girls but arent any aorund. Not a good joint for finding girls or dates. Just good  tacos hot carrots an beers. no pierogis or kelbasa. One fancy girl call me names I dont no. we had good time but I didnt talk to anton after dat place. yep.

"Designer" Americanized Tacos that are pretty tasty, have had them all. Solid selection of whisky and beer too. A little pricey and wouldn't be my go to for Mexican by a long shot.  Probably the worst wait staff I've ever seen, they are more focused on looking cool and almost act like you're inconveniencing them when making your order (even if you know what you want right away, I would never ask for a recommendation as they'd probably be confused and offended). Think hipster millennial entitlement, that's exactly what you're getting. Also the crowd is kind of the same, bunch of people more concerned about starring at others (or their phones) and trying to look hip being at such a happening wicker park spot than actually being with their own company or eating their food. Meh.

Calling places overrated is overrated, but Big Star so seriously failed to live up to the hype that it can't in good conscience get away with its hype.  The food is terrific, but the tacos are no better than what you can get next door at the Dove, and without the hour-long wait.  The service was terrible even after we got seated, and the whole process reminded me why, when you live in a big city with millions of options, there's simply no reason to wait around forever.  There's no denying that this place has their taco game on point, but does that excuse the hassle?  I don't think so.

I was sitting in my living room last week when distant thunder brought forth an ancestral memory. I was in a Nordic longship sailing upon a glacial sea. My only companions were a young boy and a magical goat that sustained us with milk from its teats and songs from its breath. The boy was pretty cool, too. We would drink to life's confines and gnash our teeth at the frequent squalls, our shouts alive with laughter and the smell of goat milk. We were content that if an errant wave should smash us against the rocks, then they would at least be the rocks of glory! But our euphoria would not last, for we soon found ourselves becalmed. There we existed in those doldrums, and after a week and a half without wind we knew that the sea's bounty could not hope to sustain the three of us. And so, with tears in our eyes, we ate the boy.  My friend's older brother Tyler told me about this place. With tasty appetizers and fun drinks, it's the perfect spot for a summer date night.
YUM! Great Pork Pastor taco. Friendly service. Will definitely be going back.

Yum! Came over here for a lower-key dinner after having dinner in the near west side a bunch of times in a row during my business trip. I wasn't disappointed. The place is set up with a large central bar and some tables/booths in the periphery. There's a patio area for the summer but alas, it's super cold. Here's what I got: Tacos: Al pastor, shredded beef, and chicken. Everything was so tasty and comes with house salsas. Meats were moist and delicious too! Drinks: I had the Big Star Margarita. Kind of like a normal margarita but with some mezcal added in there with the tequila. It was strong and a nice smoky twist on the classic. There's plenty of whiskeys to be had too, if that's your thing. Bartenders were friendly and efficient. I'll make an effort to come back if I'm in the area. Wish chips were free.
Very fun place to go for lunch or for a night out. Food is good, music is fun. A good environment. Hard to get a seat at times, place is usually packed to an extreme, very little wiggle room
They have good tacos but I have had better.  The service was good, they do pay attention to food restrictions which is very nice.  The atmosphere is great!

We've gotten this delivered for the office a few times already. They have some great tacos, however, I think I've had better. I'm not 100% sure why people think these are "the best" tacos in Chicago, but to each their own.  They are tasty and delicious, I've just had better. Not much else to say.

Came here for lunch on a rainy Tuesday so the place was fairly empty. I tried out four different tacos that the bartender had recommended we're his favorite. Overall I thought the tacos we're good some were definitely better than others but overall the tacos were great! I would recommend this to anyone in the area to try this place out.

Great tacos! It is a bar so at night it gets pretty crowded and the wait gets long. Basically you have to see the host to be seated but since it's a bar you can be seated for as long as you like and they will not ask you to leave, so estimated wait times are probably not very accurate or hard to gage.  We actually were seated right away as a group of 2 on a Thursday night at like 830 pm, but I am going to say that was all luck, since all other groups where 3 or larger and the wait was at least estimated to be 45 min or longer.  The food: Tacos Al Pastor (amazing) I love sweet and savory so the meat with the pineapple is such a great combo. Tacos De Panza (while still amazing my least favorite of the three) this was a very good taco I would just prob order another pastor next time I go bc that was sooo good. Last the Taco De Carne Con Chile Verde (amazing) perfectly marinated and just amazing. As well as Chips and Guac which you really can't go wrong there.  Service is good and the atmosphere is pretty cool. Def worth the wait, just know on "going out nights" and the larger the group the longer the wait. They also deliver in the area, and have a taco window outside so you can order tacos to go! I am sure this place is going to be great in the summer.

Went to Big Star for the first time today. We had a party of 6 and waited about 10 minutes before being seated (not bad!) Staff was very friendly (even better!) I had the tostada, pork taco & beans. Also had the house margarita. Everything was fabulous!! Will definitely be going back!

Horrible service. It took 30 minutes to even get a waiter to take our order. Ok food, horrible service. If you're looking to have a good time, don't come here because you'll only get irritated with the mediocre service and snobby waiters.

I've been coming for many years now and I feel I can properly give a review.   I know it always seems like it is forever crowded in that place and although most of the time it is now with the new expansion you can definitely be sure to you're going to wait a little bit less.   I've  tried almost everything they have except the salad, their food is very fresh and tasteful.  It's definitely a small bites menu but at the same time you're able to try more than one thing and explore the food.  The chips and gucamole never disappoint, its a good size portion.  My favorite taco has become the pork belly taco  I was not a pork belly eater until I came here and had their taco.   To sum up this place really is just a very chill honky-tonk music whiskey drinking or have a cold beer cash only place, I would come to hang  and of course in the summertime is the best time because you can  sit out have drinks just chill.  Love big star hope you have a good experience too.
I love this place--especially their guacamole:)...FYI: it's cash only and there's usually a long line--but worth it.

Not sure if they were having an extremely off day. But we came here today with a party of 4. The service was outrageously slow. It took an hour for four people to receive 8 tacos. We didn't get plates, our chips and salsa never arrived although we were charged for it and a member of our party tried to order 2 more tacos, but after 25 minutes we gave up, paid the bill and left. 80 dollars for tacos and a few beers with terrible service. What a joke.

I will always remember this place as the place where I had the best guacamole I've ever had, and in live in the Avocado State!! Great music and fantastic servers. I can't wait to come back in the summertime!

Big Star Big Star Big Star... Everything from the outdoor decor to the interior design is on point here. Right in the heart of downtown Wicker Park, this joint is a "must enjoy" spot. Delicious cocktails, great food and excellent vibes. I haven't had everything on the menu but the dozens of dishes and cocktails that I have had there have always been spot on. Big Star for the win in Wicker Park.

Great tacos, lousy service. I love their tacos. Especially the chicken and fish. Service can be insanely slow sometimes. Margaritas are good but can be pricey. Antique taco is a competitor I believe and these tacos win. The patio is great during the warm months.

Good summer spot for some pretty decent tacos. Love the outdoor eating area! Try to stop here at least once a month as it is always a nice spot with friends. Only problem I've run into is sometimes terrible service.

This is my favorite taco place. I just love their food! My top 3 tacos are: Panza, Al Pastor, and Pescado. 3 tacos is enough to fill you and they're cheap! My favorite is their fish tacos and Al Pastor as second. I've tried the other tacos, but these three are the best in my opinion. They also have some drinks if you choose to. I've never tried their cocktails so I can't comment on that. I usually get beer so I got Fist City. It's one of their beers on tap. It's light if you like that kind of flavor. Don't come during peak hours because then you'll be waiting awhile for a table. Either way, it is worth the wait. It is cash only! They do have an ATM machine if you do forget to bring cash.

Great tacos, lovely patio, good service. You either have to come on a weeknight, or be prepared to wait for at least 2 hours. Even on weeknights the wait is that long sometimes, which often deters me from even attempting to eat here. I just can't give Big Star more than 3 stars, because it's overpriced (particularly the drinks) and every experience I've had has been stressful due to the long waits.

Big Star is my FAVORITE taco place in Chicago. And Chicago has a lot of taco places!!! It's perfectly located off the blue line so even when it's cold you don't have to walk a long time to get there. They get very busy all the time, but last time I went, they asked for my cell number to text me when our reservation was ready so that I could actually walk around the beautiful Wicker Park instead of having to hang within a ten foot radius of the place. Very innovative! Their tacos are cheap and I like that they are served singly so you can mix and match as much as you want. I definitely like the al pastor tacos, because those are always my favorite, and Big Star does them so well that it almost makes me not want to get anything else when I go there! However, I have tried a lot of their tacos and they are all fantastic. Not a single one was a let down. Their horchata is good as well, and their bar looks really cool although I've never drunk here. If you are looking for great tacos, a great atmosphere, a hip location, and plenty of activities to spend a day doing, go to Big Star and enjoy Wicker Park.
Worst michelada I ever had.   Tacos are meh..... Too many other good places to get mexican in the city to ever return here.

The #1 patio place that highlights all that chicago summer in Wicker Park. HIPSTER- yes, the #1 word that describes this restaurant in Yelp reviews and it sure is. You will have to wait if you come in the summer- and who knows how long those lines will be BUT it may be worth your wait.  If you come on an uncrowded winter night around 6ish like I did with one person- you can score a spot at a bar and drink from their wonderful beer and cocktail list being served by people that are in flannel, short shorts, and friendly but - one girl had an attitude with me the WHOLE time. But whatever- I was paying 3-4 dollars per taco and DON'T FORGET IT'S CASH ONLY. Drinks are strong- and let me tell you the margarita- you'll feel that half way into drinking it.  Great spot for vegetarians- my friend is a fan of the potato taco but I loved the queso one. Also - you gotta get the pescado. They came fast even though the waiter said the service is slow. It's no luxury taco place, and it's a step up from taco joint- and it's a staple in the area if you are gonna do tacos.  All i all, can't go wrong with Big Star.

Really cool atmosphere. Definitely a place you have to go to at least once. It was good and different but I wasn't totally in love with the food. If friends want to go I will certainly go back for a light lunch again.

Tried this place for the second time.  First time I sat at the bar and they straight up forgot my order.  After asking for it twice and not getting it, I said cancel it.  The bar tender did comp my drinks and apologized.  Second visit we placed an order, it came, then our waitress NEVER returned.  After over 45 min and finishing our pitcher I asked someone else for help.  She then came back with a major chip on her shoulder.  As if leaving us stranded wasn't enough.  Gee thanks.
My favorite taco spot!  I crave these margaritas!  Be forewarned- the wait is often long.

Oh big star HIII thank you for the queso fundido. It was very fun if you substitute the chips for the tortillas. Everyone do this. Also, the smoky margarita is very smokey and I know you know what that means it's like barbeque but in glasses. Try it. Also we are sitting directly next to the door so it's cold but everyone is so nice we feel warm. The potato tacos are amaze balls and everyone's wearing a flannel so you hipsters are fine. Come here eat the snacks and bring cash.

Came here after a night out in Wicker. The chicken and fish tacos were both good, but not great. The chicken was flavorful but too salty, and the fish was light and flakey but not too flavorful. I like that the place is cash only actually, it makes paying so much easier. Hope Big Star continues to do well.

Good drinks (classic marg), awesome guac, ok service. We ordered the tacos de panza (pork belly) and I thought it was kind of tough. The tacos de pescado (fish taco) was great with the slaw and spicy mayo on it! A lot of yelpers complained about the price and size... I thought they were a decent size for $4! I would go back again!

If you are looking for a good atmosphere with decent food on a nice day...big star is almost worth checking out; however, the food is overrated and you will probably have to wait...definitely not worth waiting when there are plenty of other options in the area. Go there if you want...at least you can defer your friends to other better options after that.

Went today again for the 5th time or so since it opened. Every time I go, it gets progressively more underwhelming. It's a cool spot for the summer if you wanna grab drinks with friends and enjoy a trendy patio. However, beyond that, the food is subpar. Places in Pilsen and Logan Square have far better tacos at much better prices. You are paying for the name here. Not he quality. My tacos today were cold. The pineapple was slightly hard. The chips were soggy as we got to the bottom of the stack. Service is decent. What bothered us most was that our food came out about 3 minutes after we ordered which could o ly mean that it's not made to order. The cold food and quick turn around left us to believe that the food was already made and had been sitting there. They probably just heated it a bit and sent it out. I will not be going back for the 60 bill for two people for some tacos.
Worst taco place I've ever been. Got a fish taco that had no fish in it. Just fried I don't know what but it was horrible. Very rude service. I don't plan on going back there again

I think big star is a good spot if you're looking for a place for drinks with friends. Went with my girl and we drank the margaritas. Dude! You talking about about some octane! That damn margarita was the truth! With that being said I have some.....misgivings about this place.  1) I didn't like the atmosphere. Kinda felt like I was chilling in a concrete box. I'm not saying it's gotta be swanky but maybe paint the walls not cell block C blue?  2) it's cash only. That bothers me for obvious reasons. It's 2015 about to be 2016. Get a square and a cell phone.  3) the tacos were yummy but not worth the price. I mean they were good gourmet tacos but they were so small. Probably the reason the margaritas were so strong. Usually I can eat 3 tacos and 2 margaritas and be fine. But not here.  The balance is alllll off.  Otherwise it's a decent choice but I probably won't be back for awhile.

This place is a really cool taco joint. It's always busy, so don't expect to be seated quickly, but once in, definitely try the pork belly tacos, the tacos al pastor, and the fish tacos.  Maybe just get all three in one sitting.  I often liked to come here and eat/pre-drink before we headed across the street to Violet Hour.  The funny thing is that Violet Hour and Big Star have two completely different personalities.   Definitely try the queso fundido, kick back, relax, and stuff your face!

Best atmosphere for tacos in Chicago - great outdoor seating, great margaritas, good selection of non-standard tacos. Sure, the tacos could be bigger for the price, or the price lower, sure one or two patrons could be a little less overtly "better at hipster than though" but who cares if you can sip a great margarita outdoors on a warm November Tuesday at 11am.

I've been here numerous times since. Outstanding arrive an food. Great atmosphere. I don't know what the hell happened with that time I was there and it was horrendous but all that has now been replaced by goodwill. So I highly recommend Big Star. Not they need my help they're hugely successful.

This place is loud, packed, yet consistently very good.  I can understand why they have been designated best taqueria in Chicago.  This place understands very good Mexican food. The fish tacos are as good as I have had on Baja peninsula.   Drinks (margaritas) are also very good and deliciously reasonable. This is one of the only places that knows how to make a very good michelada (spicey) beer.  Which I enjoy every once in a while on my vacation trips to Mexico. I really do miss the Sonoran dog not being on their menu anymore.  This truly was a work of art.  I have sent many over there just to try this hot dog that rivals our Chicago style hot dog. This place can be jammed packed and the food always comes out of the kitchen in a timely manner, which is great! This place is very easy to miss because their signage is just a neon shaped star. This place is definitely worth seeking out if you are not familiar with the area. Although you should avoid driving in this hipster neighborhood on a Friday or Saturday night because the roads become clogged.

Stopping back into Big Star was like running into an old flame. All you remember are the good times you shared... like $40 premium margarita pitchers, the excellent beer list, the boundless whiskey list (Pappy Van Winkel year-round), and oh... the gourmet tacos. But the romance here is long gone. Where there was once fundito, el pastor and too much papas con rajas... now there is lukewarm tacos and a fundito that took nearly 20 minutes to show up (and showed up with a hair in it). The wait staff and manager went above and beyond to take care of us and invite us back on the house (hence, three stars and not two). I'll be back to give it another go round, but this certainly wasn't the experience I expected coming back here.

THEIR PORK BELLY TACOS ARE AMAZING.  Sorry, just really needed to shout that out in typing.  Great place to go to when you want to just enjoy some good tacos, appetizers, and beers. The taco in a Doritos bag really surprised me, but it was really good, kinda shocked I didn't eat the bag as well... The cheese dish is great, the fish tacos are some of the best that I've actually had, and the pork belly tacos need to go in my mouth...right...NOW. Cheap beers too! What are you waiting for? Get it, get it!

Big Star? More like 0 stars if I could. Tacos were mediocre at best, drinks were watered down and service was meh. The only reason this place is still in business is because it's on a busy intersection.  AVOID AT ALL COST!!!

This place a bit overrated in my opinion. The tacos were small and over priced. Taste wise, they were good, but nothing real special. Their Big Star margarita was pretty good and strong. We went on a Thursday night around 8 pm, and waited about 35 mins for a table. Our server was nice, but due to the way too loud atmosphere, she got our order wrong. Overall, it was okay, but I'll try somewhere else before coming back for sure.

Big Star is an indoor/outdoor taco joint with a decent drink list and a good variety of tacos. My favorite taco has to be the taco de pesado, but the al pastor is equally savory.  I have been here a handful of times, and have always had to wait, but it if you have some time grab a drink at the bar and some chips and guac and wait it out -- it won't disappoint!  Make sure you experience it in the summer if you find yourself meandering in during Chicago's dreary winter months, the patio is part of the Big Star experience. YUM!
The tacos are great but they need to have better chips & also nice crowd of people eat their!!!!
if the wait time and system weren't so terrible I would have rated them a 5 the food is great the tacos are amazing

I refused to get tacos when coming to Chicago since I lived in San Diego for so long, but multiple people recommended this place for our trip and I was curious to try it. This place seemed really popular, but luckily we got a seat right away. We got the Queso Fundido to start and was pretty good except you can't taste any of the chorizo and the tortillas were not good. I ended up just eating forkfuls of cheese. For my meal, I just got two tacos since I wasn't very hungry. I got the Al Pastor which was marinated pork shoulder with grilled pineapple - an interesting combination, and I also got the fish taco. The Al Pastor was okay. The meat was just okay and the flavors were interesting. The fish taco was just alright as well. The tilapia was pretty flavorless and there was too much batter and I didn't like the chipotle mayo on top. Overall, call me bias, but I'll stick to my SoCal tacos and Mexican food.

THE TACOS ARE SO SALTY Beers are cheap Overall I don't see why everyone loves this place. I guess in the summer it could be nice to sit out in the patio with a big group. I came on a rainy day so the outside was closed. Still, my issue is not with the location/layout but the food itself. People, these are NOT good tacos. And they are overpriced too. Head over to Pilsen for better options!

We like the idea but execution was mediocre. The innovational idea of the taco specialties were really notable but maybe it was because closing time was less than an hour but a few of our tacos didn't come out hot. The horchata was also diluted. The one thing that really stood out was the fish taco:))) That was delish it was crispy  and great. Other than that the bouncers were nice.
The tacos were good by non -California style, but Big Star gets 4 stars based on the atmosphere and margaritas. This is an ideal spot for a fun weekend dinner /drinks with friends.
Fish tacos were good, as well as the guacamole and chips. The atmosphere is nice, particularly with the outdoor seating in the summer. Nice place to stop by for lunch if you're in Wicker Park!

I wrote a 1 star review three years ago after not receiving a taco I paid for in a to-go order. I've since come back here several times in the past three years since I worked in the neighborhood and every time the food has been delicious and affordable, the service has been great, and the beers cold. There is really no better place to sit outside and have lunch in the area during the summer.
I'm not lying when I say these  tacos are the future! Tasty and very well dressed. Enjoyable to eat there.

cash only and need to check id before enter. The taco are great. Also chips. I remember a kind of taco named 'taco to go' or 'taco streets ' so good. New taco in bag. Should try that one. Avg 4 tacos each person. Pick your flavors.

I would recommend this place as long as you do not have Alana as a server.  2 of us waited for a while for her to come to our table (and it was not busy there).  She came to our table and said "are you doing ok?"  We were confused because we hadn't had someone come by yet.  She was aggressively rude throughout the service.  Very disappointing.  The food was excellent, though.  Alana came to our table with our check and asked us to pay ASAP because she was switching shifts.  Not a good experience because of her sass.

Really Big Star?  I am truly a regular customer and have always been a happy customer but tonight was ridiculous.   One bartender was making margaritas that were HALF full!   I get they are a premium product and definitely thought it was weird when I saw her bringing them to others at the bar... My friend and I thought to ourselves... Why are so many people splitting margaritas?   Until we ordered one.  We Even Thought the first one had to be in error so ordered the second with "less ice".  It was comical the product we received.   Trying to post a picture as we laughed for half hour!    Great margaritas.   Spent $50 to get 2 full ones : ).  Hope you enjoyed your "savings" big star!!!

Came here for dinner on a Friday night and it was packed. We went to the hostess (with red hair) and she put our name down. Fifteen minutes later, after realizing that people that came after us were being seated, we went up to her and she responded "oh, we didn't know you were still waiting, so we took you off the list." Annoyed, but hungry, I asked her to put me and my two friends on the list again. We waited 20 minutes for indoor seating as it was cold. After 20 minutes, we went up to her and asked if there any seats opened inside. She responded to "well, you can see as well as I can.." I ignored that and asked her if we can sit anywhere outside, since there were plenty of open seats. She gave us outdoor seats and the heater lamps weren't even working and there was propane leaking from the tank.  As for the food, we ordered the queso fundido without the chorizo (as we were all vegetarian) and that was okay. Also, the potato taco was mediocre. The best thing there was the walking taco. Overall experience, it sucked. The hostess was very rude and that alone would refrain me from ever going there again. And they are cash only with an ATM inside.

Tacos were Delish!! I had the De taco Pastor, Pescado, Hongos... All three were on point. Margarita was good. Service wasn't the greatest, and it was very loud... Very difficult to talk to each other. I highly recommend the Guacamole!! We left full! Went on a Friday Night

Decent tacos.  Margarita was not very good.   Only had to wait 20 min on a table. I would never wait over an hour for this place like people do in the summer.  Our check was $60 and they are cash only.  I do not get this trend with cash only.

Wicker Park visitors love this place. Tacos are delicious, obviously. Joint gets a little loud for my taste, I like it better in the wintertime when it's less crowded and we can actually sit inside. The walking tacos are my favorite.

I would rate this place a 3.75 if we could get detailed with these reviews. I went with my boyfriend for some tacos for lunch. Love the outside area, the decorations are great, really sets the ambience. The tacos aren't authentic but still pretty tasty. I didn't like the chicken tacos - they had a strange flavor to them but I really liked the Picadillo ground beef taco. I also had the Al Pastor taco. It was good but the ground beef was better. They didn't have any steak tacos, which is always a disappointment. The place only takes cash (they have an ATM). I'd go again, but more for the vibes than the food.a

We had the worst server I have ever experienced. She was outright rude to us. She ignored us and walked by our table several times. She got pissed off when we asked for something to be explained on the menu. I don't think she has the right job.  I'm usually very understanding of food service workers, some times too much so (I'll won't ask them to take my food back even if I got the wrong thing). But this woman made our experience horrible.  The food is unauthentic.. although it's supposed to be. Small portions. Overpriced. Just go to the myriad authentic Mexican restaurants in Chicago that are run by Mexicans.
Had big star cater my rehearsal dinner and our guests went nuts! Delicious and affordable!! The tacos and the salad are insane! Love this place.

We stopped in for lunch at Big Star and had an enjoyable meal. Décor: It's a pretty "basic" spot and it's meant to be that way - no frills, good food. And it works. They have a decent indoor space, with a HUGE 4-sided bar, and a large outdoor space that can accommodate nearly any size group you show up with (given proper notification, of course). There are very large windows that provide plenty of natural light and it just has a relaxed, and semi-hipster, atmosphere (reinforced by the older gent "DJing" with his collection of immaculately kept LPs stored in protective plastic). Bathroom: it's small but it gets the job done, and it's clean (and decently lit) Staff: Our waitress left MUCH to be desired... she was not personable, not friendly, made zero small talk, and honestly acted like she couldn't wait for us to leave. It was odd. Now, everyone is allowed to have a bad day and that's probably all that was going on here. Food: We started with chips and guacamole (very tasty) and moved on to the tacos. We had: panza (delicious!!), pastor (tasty), pescado (outstanding! HUGE piece of fish and phenomenal chipotle mayo), picadillo (meh... not that great, pretty dry), and the Walking Taco (YUM!!!). Everything came out hot and fresh and we were definitely pleased. Value: The tacos are a bit pricey, but overall the prices are not outrageous. We enjoyed our meal very much and will return in the future more some more pescado and walking tacos! YUM!!
The food I ate here was pretty standard. Reasonably priced. Seems like a nice place to hang out at, but I wouldn't seek it out for its food.

I had the papas tacos as the queso was no longer being served. I thought that the tacos were fresh and tasty considering that it was 2am. However they weren't the best tacos I've ever had however it was nice to have somewhat of a no fried late night meal option. The service was good and the waiter we had was patient given that hour and how indecisive my friends were being. I also appreciated the menus having a few vegetarian option for those that had limited diet options. I'm not sure if this is a place I would return personally. However my friends enjoyed their el pastors tacos enough to return.
Friendly service and the pitcher margaritas were not too bad!

If this place was inspired by the tacos of LA. Something got lost in translation.  Pastor. Tough, dry and tasteless. It was so tough my jaw hurt from chewing so much.  Fish taco. Yuk. Tilapia is just gross. So it makes a gross taco.  Pork belly. Very plain.  Someone needs to go back and do their homework.

It is a bit odd why this place doesn't get enough accolades, but I really liked the experience here.  It was a weekday night (a rather hotter day).  There were a lot of people, jampacked, and the place was extremely vibrant, but at the same time very very loud. We ordered different kinds of tacos and chips with some drinks.  They were pretty good, but we loved the al pastor especially.  Even though it was a bit too loud, it will make you feel alive.
Stopped by for margaritas...great outdoor space and cool atmosphere...wish they had more than 2 choices for margs

Can we take a moment to talk about how overrated this place is? I was bamboozled by yelp reviews and decided to try this hipster trap. After spending damn near $40, I left the place still hungry and remotely annoyed. First, the security guard/bouncer. Sweet baby Jesus, the security guard. Lemme just say, dude took his guarding of the taco shop VERY SERIOUSLY. He was honestly pretty rude, despite the fact that all he had to do was make sure we were of age. Maybe he was having a bad day, who knows? Either way, no excuse to act rude to customers. Once you got past broke Ving Rhames, the place was so packed that we had to get a text by the hostess to even get in. 20 minutes later, we're seated at a tiny table. Get chips. OK. Margaritas here are OK. 3/5. Nothing special. Tacos were pretty good - if only they didn't cost as much and came with more. In the end? I ended up going to Flash Taco. Just don't bother.

Big Star, a member of the One Off Hospitality Group, sets itself apart from other taco bars by offering some of the most unique variations in the city.   The menu includes one or two options that resemble traditional Mexican fare, such as the Taco De Panza - crispy pork belly with salsa, cheese, onion, and cilantro.  But more exciting are the tacos that feature atypical ingredients, such as the vegetarian Taco de Zanahorias. I am very much a meat-eater, but mole-spiced carrots, chipotle date yogurt, and roasted pumpkin seeds make for one of the most interesting flavor/texture combinations I've ever eaten.  And what's a good taco without an accompanying drink?  Big Star offers a great selection of specialty cocktails, craft beer, and whiskey.  The Big Star Margarita, made with both tequila and smoky mezcal, is a must-try.  The only downside to Big Star is that it is generally very crowded.  While this makes for a fun, energetic atmosphere, it also occasionally results in service that is not up to par with One Off's other restaurants.   But if you're looking for some delicious tacos and drinks in a relaxed environment, make the trip to Wicker Park and check out Big Star.

This place has definitely become overrated and the food is not how it used to be. I was surprised that we were able to get in so fast and shocked that our food came out even quicker. Then realized it had probably been sitting there for a while because it wasn't even warm. Food is decent but nothing to rave about, Very disappointed.

I went there for dinner with my boyfriend and I almost choked over a piece of plastic that I found in my taco. The manager came over and said she was going to buy our meal. We ended up paying for everything besides a couple of tacos. Really? I am glad I didn't end up at the hospital after all. Very poor management.

Fun place to hang out during warm sunny days. Its got a great patio, but be warned, the wait can exceed 2 hours and they do not take reservations. It's also cash only, but they have an ATM inside. Tacos are alright, margaritas and beer selection in great!

Every item on the menu is amazing. Literally everything. The place is always packed because the food is so insanely good. I'm writing this as I just finished a few tacos. Cash only, which makes it easy to pay, and prices are cheap too for a Chicago restaurant. If I could live in the restaurant I would.
Go for the ambiance, not the tacos. The food is good but not better than other similar restaurants. It's fun to go to when you want to sit outside and get drinks with friends.

Amazing place for tacos. Every time I'm in Chicago I continue to go back to Big Star. I'm a huge fan of their take out window and grab a seat at their outdoor seating. Saves a lot of time as the wait for sit down is usually always long. The to go chips and guacamole are a huge portion, definitely worth the 8 dollars. Being a vegetarian the fish tacos are delicious with a tiny bit of heat.

The only Mexican food place where you pay for chips and salsa. I consider myself a Mexican foodie, if that exists, and I think this place has great red salsa and margaritas, but the tacos and service are awful. This place is good for people watching and expensive tasteless food and the worse service in Bucktown. Take it from a Bucktown resident and Mexican food snob.

This review is for Big Star catering. Big Star provided a taco buffet for our wedding this past September. We chose the delivery option and got enough tacos, salad, beans, and chips and guacamole for 115 people. There was plenty of food, and it was all delicious. We chose to use our own event staff, and everything went smoothly. The food arrives in disposable containers that are fine to put out as is if you don't care about fancy serving bowls (we didn't, and it looked great!) We received tons of compliments, and had happy guests. Margaret was extremely helpful the entire time, and made the process pretty much stress free. The pricing is also incredibly reasonable, especially considering how much traditional wedding catering costs, for food with much less character. Big Star catering is an excellent choice to cater a large event!

Yum for a taco place. They have both outdoor and indoor seating and a big selection of tacos, served on corn tortillas which is how I like them.  We started off with the queso fundido and Guacamole and chips. Both were well portioned starters. They give more than enough chips for the chips and guac. The queso fundido cheese was perfectly melted with peppers and chorizo, served with hot corn tortillas for spooning.  I then got the Taco de Pescado and Taco de Panzo. Both really delicious. That fried fish was the length of the taco and was well fried. It had plenty of slaw for balance. The Taco de Panzo, pork belly, was nice and fatty but not overwhelming. I also tried the Taco Al Pastor with pork shoulder and pineapple. Great balance of sweet and savory. The tacos here are definitely not tiny so you are getting your money's worth. The amount of meat/toppings they give definitely deserves a thumbs up.

The food is amazing, the service is spectacular, the vibe is eclectic and unpretentious hipster, the prices are reasonable, the drinks are great, and it's always crowded in an exciting sort of way. The cons: the cash only part is off-putting (everyone always speculates if there are illegal workers in the kitchens), they were out of their pumpkin flavored beer when I asked, the big star margarita was decent but I've had better. Overall, it did live up to the hype and was a great experience, but it could have been better.

I loved Big Star!!! Our neighbors hyped it up so we DEFINITELY had to go.  I was very excited to see that they had things on the menu that appeared to be vegan or could be made vegan.  To my delight, our awesome server helped me pick out the mushroom tacos and the walking taco.   They were totally cool in letting us chill out for a few hours, reordering the awesome food! :) Definitely recommend Big Star and will bring my friends and family here, for sure!

Seriously love Big Star. The casual and hipster environment is super chill. Day drinking on the patio outside is one of my favorite things to do. The guac is out of control good and their fish tacos are to die for.

Big Star offers the greatest taco experience. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because it typically has a long wait. I also wish they had a bigger beer selection and included some imported brands. They currently only serve local stuff. Tacos are spectacular. I also love their mini to go window which is brilliant!

Wow! This place has amazing tacos! This place does get crowded but they have plenty of seating outside and some inside. When I came here I sat outside luckily it was breezy.  You must try the taco de panza, which Is pork belly! It was just simply amazing! Other great tacos I tried were the ground beef and pastor. Another great thing to try is the fonduta which is like a cheese dip.  As for drinks we ordered a pitcher of margarita which was $32. Sharing it with my boyfriend we had 3 glasses each which does leave you on a good buzz. Keep in mind it's CASH ONLY! Taxes are already included except on alcohol. The area is beautiful and full of shops such as Nike and lulu lemon.
Their tacos with the pineapple are the best! A little over priced, but worth it for the great outdoor seating area. Staff could be a little friendlier too, but it does get super slammed.

Ugh, I feel so bad giving Big Star only 3 stars. It reminds me of talking badly about your friend that everyone likes. As much as I want to like this place, every time I go the waiter is just so painful to interact with. On the other hand, the hostess staff has always been wonderful. The food is good, but it's not the kind of place you want to go with an allergy because if you ask for minus mayo or nuts or whatever, chances are they'll forget.  What I really do like is the overall vibe. It's fantastic. I highly suggest just going to the place next door to the right that is more like a grab and go type place. There's usually not sneaky and the food is identical.

Came here tonight with my best friend for a late dinner and some drinks. We ordered the pork belly tacos el pastor and the pescado tacos all were fantastic! Cash only which I thought to be odd being as large as it was with a pick up window as well... Oh well great outdoor patio and music. Very cool crowd and awesome neighborhood
Great tacos, amazing bourbon and tequila selection and some good microbrews on draft. What more could you possibly want?

I had been excited to try this place ever since I saw it featured on the food network. And it definitely did not disappoint. My friend and I were on our way to a concert nearby and stopped for a bite to eat quick before hand. And for a Wednesday night this place was the happening place to be.  We were to there would be a short wait. They don't quote table times because they are more bar they claim than restaurant. We waited for a little bit but we're getting antsy as our concert was getting close. we then realized that there is a take out window and eating area of you don't want to drink. So we went without their margaritas and gorged on tacos and chips instead.  We had the walking taco, panza (pork belly), chicken, and al pastor (pulled pork). We also got a side of chips and guacamole. Wow. Everything was phenomenal. My only personal preference would be to take the pineapple off the al pastor taco. But I just have a thing about warm fruit.  I can't wait to come back when we have more time and pair our tacos with a pitcher of margaritas!

It's a scene alright but the food is just ok and they only accept cash.  Seriously?   Who caries enough cash these days to cover a few hours of food & drink??  If it wasnt for the location and massive outdoor area during the warmer months this place wouldn't get any recognition.

I almost hate the tacos for being as scrumptious as they are. If Big Star made taco lotion, I'd rub that ish all over my face. The drinks are pretty darn delicious as well. Hm, this review just made me hungry for tacos.

The guacamole was delicious. I could not stop eating it despite my usually commitment to not fill up on chips (oops). It (the guac) was a little pricey but I didn't mind once we had it.  I had a pork belly taco... It was ok. I have had amazing pork belly and thus was not it. But it was good.  The fish taco on the other hand... Wow.  Order this. It was one of the best I have ever had.  I ordered the Horchada and I thought it was pretty bland I would have liked it to have more cinnamon.  My friend had the milkshake that is on the menu and omg it was tasty.  I'm glad it wasn't mine because it was downright indulgent.  If you are into gourmet tacos come here! If you are looking for authentic keep scrolling. It was yummy and I was glad I took my local friends advice and stopped here for dinner.  One tip: it's pretty loud inside maybe grab a table outside or be aware that the noise is not date friendly ;)

One of the favorite things this Texan likes to do when visiting Chicago from New York is to hit up the taco scene here. Seriously! Chicago's tacos blow New York's out of the water and Big Star was the restaurant that made me realize that.  People talk about the long lines and wait, but when I went on Sunday at 12:30, I was seated right away (even before the rest of my party had arrived!). There was plenty of outdoor seating on this perfect September day.  The tacos themselves were great. I had the Taco de Pollo Pibil and Taco de Picadillo, both were excellent. The chips and salsa are also just $3 and there was so much of them! I'm the type who has a HUGE appetite, but just 2 tacos and splitting a chips and salsa with my friend was enough to fill me up.

My review has been long overdue... I'm giving a solid 4. Big Star is the major Mexican go-to, when you've had a drunken night out in Wicker Park. You'll get solid good food, although it's cash only. Womp womp. You've got two options. you can dine in: indoor and outdoor seating. Or, you can walkup to the window, and even seat at benches just outside of the restaurant. in other words, sit your drunk butt and pay tip, or keep-a-steppin, and take yo tacos elsewhere! They do have really good food, and they aren't shy about adding a kick to their salsa. It's not your standard run-of-the-mill tacos, either. They've got some flavor. I think this spot is great for a two or 4-some kind of dinner, but it can get pretty loud. Come here if you want the happenin' kind of vibe, or to follow-up a night of drinks with friends. It's got that hipster/metro kinda feel. They've got beer, they've got spiked horchatas... they've got tacos. tacos tacos tacos.  You'll salivate every time you drive by once you've experienced the phenomenon that is BIG STAR. I'm only giving 4 stars though, because after one try, I don't find myself dying to go out of my way to come back for more. Only if i'm in the area, and craving some tacos.

I've been here 6 times and it's unfortunate I have to write this review. But after my most recent visit, I'd give negative stars if it was possible. I've mainly come on Fridays and Saturdays, yes the wait is long and their margs are not favorite but their food is great. Most recently, I came in with my fiancé on a Tuesday evening around 9:30. We were seated promptly, which is unusual at Big Star because of its popularity, so we were excited. We ordered apps and they came out promptly (queso fundido is on point). When our waitress came back we ordered tacos, I got 2 and my fiancé ordered 3. My first taco came out, and apparently that was all we were granted that evening. No other tacos came out, and our waitress fussed when we complained one hour later and asked that these be removed from our bill because they never came after multiple check ins with service.  Not only was Big Star not busy, but they were not courteous or respectful when we, rightfully, complained. Thoroughly disappointed, which is a shame because in general this place is alright.

Fun ambiance, great drinks and good tacos.  This place is a big outdoor party in the summer and a somewhat smaller, indoor party in the winter.  Drinks are great and the tacos are yum, but let's be real, you don't come to this place for food or drinks, you come because you look cute and want to see and be seen while taking a break from your stroll in Wicker Park or after a night of partying.  Service is sometimes slow because it gets crowded, and they pack people in, and they only take cash but overall, this place is a great, chill party spot with food and drinks.  Oh, and they take dogs in the outdoor seating area, so bring along your bestie!

One of the highlights of summer time in Chicago is the return of amazing patio dining options all over the city. Big Star has one of the greatest patios period! There is always a crowd, the music is such a fun mix of old favorites. The food is great, quick, and the menu has options to please everyone. I tried the carrot taco today and it was insanely good. The mole was such a great counterbalance to the sweet tender carrots. The fish taco is always delicious.  If I have one complaint, the waitress was so soft spoken! It was difficult to hear her and I felt like I shouted in responding to her to overcompensate for her quietness! Overall, Big Star is a must. Take advantage of these lingering days of warm weather. If you haven't been...go! It is so conveniently located right off the Dame. Blue line stop. If you're an old pro, go back!!! Those margaritas won't drink themselves!!!!

Oh boy, i can give only one tiny star... My friends have been talking about this place a lot so I decided to stop by tonight with my Mexican friends.  What a mistake! Ordered taco al pastor and taco de pollo pibil.  First one was with pork: dry, tasteless, pineapple was not fresh. Awful!!!  Second one was overpowered with some sauce.  I'm so surprised how they can afford to sell such poor executed tacos??? And the place was packed! But than I looked at the crowd and realized that most of these people don't even know what a real Mexican taco must be like.  Also tortias itself was bad.  Those chefs must travel to Mexico to learn how to cook.  And last but not least: salsas - 3 cheapest 50 cent/per bottle salsas!!! Ugh... Will not recommend, will not come back.  All you get - is one SMALL star mr.Big Star
Awesome patio. Fast service. Fantastic atmosphere. Best fish tacos on the planet!

I really enjoy Big Star. Every time I go there to meet friends for a fun Friday night I get a walking taco to go with my cocktail. It comes in a Fritos bag and is just a little bit of awesomeness! If you are going with a group of friends I highly recommend the pitcher of margaritas. Yummmm

My friend and I came here for some late afternoon beers and tacos. We ordered some food after a short wait. Someone delivered the food to our table and put all the food in front of my place, and none in front of my friend. This included a bag of fritos which I assumed was a weird side dish. 10 minutes later the woman who had taken our order let us know that my friend's taco was inside the frito bag. It was weird. I mean, no where on the menu did it say that her taco was coming in a frito bag, and then the server seemed confused as to why we didn't know that the taco came in a frito bag, as if it's common place to receive your taco in bag of fritos. We just didn't know. And then it took a long time to get our check. I don't know I guess I'm too old to appreciate the nuances of eating tacos poured into a bag.

When my friends wanted to meet here for a late night snack I was a bit underwhelmed by the 3.5 star rating, but I came anyway and I'm happy I did! First thing to know is this place is busy. Every time I've seen it all the tables are taken. Fortunately, I showed up late and my friends got to deal with finding a table. For food I had the taco al pastor (pork shoulder) and de pescado (battered and fried tilapia). Both were excellent. If I had to guess the tortilla was about 6" in diameter and well filled. A fair amount of food for each taco, but not to an extreme. My friends ordered the queso fundido and it was also very good. It's made of real cheese which is awesome, but eat it quick. It will cool and solidify into a solid mass if you wait too long! They have a decent beer menu and lots of whiskeys and such to choose from. They make a good effort on the drink menu, but this seems like quick food stop more than anything. Most of the seating was outdoors, I can't imagine how crowded it is in the winter when they only have the indoor area to use.

Big Star Margarita is a MUST! $45 a pitcher but completely worth it. Panza taco is my all time fav! Picadillo could lose the raisins, and guac get the guac! lunch is always best... the food comes out fast, if you go during dinner or the weekend expect a wait!

I really do like the food here.  I've never had anything I didn't like.  The only reason this isn't a 5 star review is that all of their portions are really small.  Either I have to spend $50 a person to get full (with drinks) or eat some place else afterwards.  But otherwise, great food, decent service, cool design.  It gets extremely packed to try coming here before 6pm any day to get a seat if you don't want to wait.

Tacos were fine-to-good.  No complaints about the food. HOWEVER, this place is so hip that it's literally become stupid.  The perfect example is that they're CASH ONLY, and send you to a fee-laden ATM, if you're one of those crazy people who would rather not walk around Chicago with pocketfuls of cash. "But Nicolo, it's a little startup!  They can't afford the machines!  My jeans are cutting off circulation to my feet and I love it! They want to keep it intimate and kitschy!!" But look at the little iPod Touch the waiter is using to enter your orders.  On the back of it, there?  That's a credit card reader, built into the very expensive devices they're using to track orders.  Which they clearly already bought.   Cash only, just like the rest of the hip facade, is just image and "hip", and shows that rather than accommodating their customers using the equipment they've already purchased, they'd rather make money on ATM fees *and* on tacos.   If you need tacos, this is a decent place for tacos, but you're also going to get a huge helping of hipster, with a side of crowded and pricy.

We came here just as the sun was coming out after a rainstorm. There was no seating available inside.
