The poblano was grilled in such a fashion that it almost took on a meaty quality. -Tostadas al pescado: Creamy and crunchy and refreshing, this tostada comes with a generous hunk of smooth avocado atop the fish, sliced radishes, crispy lettuce, and poblano cream; I was worried that the tostada shell would be soggy, but it remained perfectly crispy and delicious. Can't wait for the patio to open in the summer because this tostada will be perfect for warm weather refreshment. -Tostadas al pollo: During round 2 of taco consumption, I decided to give the chicken a chance. Normally, I steer away from ordering chicken in restaurants because I don't feel it is special enough, but something told me I wouldn't be disappointed. Perhaps it was the description: braised chicken thighs, b

I think this place is overrated. The patio is nice and the location is convenient, along with the to-go window but that's about all it has going for it. There are way better tacos at other places nearby. Every time I've dined in the service was lack luster.

Fantastic patio and chill vibes. The tacos are good, but they didn't blow me away. I wouldn't wait in the ridiculously long lines that typically form outside on a nice day. But we arrived when they opened and had a nice brunch. The chorizo and fish tacos were the highlights.

A group of my friends and I met up here today and were treated extremely poorly by one of the hostesses. (Red hair)   She was very unfriendly and reminded me once again why wicker park is meant for the younger hipster type.  Too bad... Because the margaritas and patio were a great place to meet up on a sunny Friday afternoon.  I hope future customers don't get stuck dealing with her..

Real Mexican food!  The flavor is on spot!  The crowd is young and the alcohol is flowing.  Make sure you bring and ID, even if you just come for food.  The outdoor patio was closed when I came because of the cold, but it looks like it would be a great place to hang with friends.

This place was packed when we arrived and as we didn't have much time to wait for a table, we darted straight for the bar. Menus were all around so it was easy to browse before deciding on what we wanted.  This is probably the first place I've been to where they don't offer Asada tacos. So much for being a 'Mexican' spot. But again, what can you expect in Chicago... I ordered the fish tacos anyhow, and they were surprisingly decent. It would have been even better if they offered salsa to go along with it but the hot sauces sufficed.  Lost stars for being cash only and messing up my beer order--place wasn't spectacular. I saw loads of tables order margaritas too, probably should have tried one!

If I could I would give one big star to Big Star! My hubby and I have been trying to get our stars to align to dine here for quite some time (pun intended). It's been a couple years but it was definitely worth the wait. To start we ordered quac and the classic & Big Star margaritas. Guac and Classic Marg were on point. Citrusy just how I like it but to hit more flavor profiles go with Big Star Marg. Now for tacos we ordered the chicken pibil, papas, chorizo and pork. All were great with our fave being the chicken pibil. It is ground chicken with a ton of flavor similar to picadillo w/ potatoes on bottom. Yum!! Chorizo is Spanish style nice big chunks. Pork in red sauce...I mean what more do you need to know. We didn't try the fish taco since we had just went to Big n Littles day before but we will be back!

Food is top notch, margaritas tasty, guac one of the best I've had other than homemade.  Service could be a bit more attentive and I don't get the cash only.  That said I'll be back and I would recommend Big Star to others.

The tacos here are sooo good. Been here a few times late at night and never really had much of a wait. I always get the al pastor, de panza and de pescado. I always want to go back but Wicker Park is a little far from where I am now but I'll probably make a trip sometime soon.

Great atmosphere especially in the warmer months.  They have addressed the long wait times by expanding so we will see what that does this summer.  Their tacos are very good but they need to step up their game there as they have formidable competition in the neighborhood now.  It is a cash only place and when a pitcher of margaritas cost $40 you need a lot of it.  At times the servers can be rude and slow.

I've been to Big Star countless times since my last review in 2011. While I still agree with the inconsistency of the margaritas, I think they are quite good most of the time. The wait does get very frustrating, so I've learned to go with a small group (2-3 people) and try for a bar seat. The best time to go is on a weeknight early in the evening. The tacos are so good, but I agree with my 2011 opinion at they are a bit pricey for what they are.

I think all of Wicker Park was at Big Star last Saturday.  The patio area takes up almost an entire street corner!  The wait for a table inside looked long, so we decided to order at the window and then eat at one of the tables outside.  The order window is a genius idea for take-out orders, or for anyone that doesn't want to wait for a proper table. I asked my friend Aimee M. what was good here, because I couldn't decide, and if there are maybe six varities of tacos, well...I know I couldn't eat six tacos.  At her recommendation, I ordered one fish taco, and at my own accord, one pork taco. THE FISH TACOS ARE SO GOOD.  I should have ordered a second one!  The fish was perfectly battered and fried.  It was crispy all the way through, it wasn't greasy or soggy at all.  This is the best fish taco I've ever had!  Tacos at Big Star cost a bit more than your neighborhood tacqueria, but this fish taco was absolutely worth $3-4.  The pork was good, but I honestly don't remember anything else about it because I'm thinking about that fish taco. The chips and guacamole are also a must-have.  The chips were fresh, but again not greasy, and the guacamole blew Chipotle's out of the water.  The guacamole was fresh, creamy, but also had nice chunks of avocado.  I thought $8 was a bit steep for guac, until I saw the portion that is really meant for sharing. Grab a horchata or limeaid to wash it all down and sit on the patio.  The number of people standing or just meandering about is great for people watching. Parking in the area stinks.  I tried to come here once before, probably turned the wrong way at a red light at a 5-way intersection, couldn't find parking, so I gave up and went elsewhere.  I ended up parking down the street this time, but there was a lot of effort put into finding that spot. Cash only!

Flip through the book and check out the drink menu section of Reserves... there's a few items that are over $100 and guess what... Big Star is CASH ONLY. I wanna see that guy who orders a round of 25yr old bourbon. Big Star used to be the spot to get upscale tacos, but I'm terribly spoiled by the plethora of tacos in Chicago that not only supercedes in service, wait and food options, but if you're playing the cash only route, it's not really cheap either. Big Star's biggest draw is the outdoor patio. They expanded to the side with really nice wooden benches and one of the few places I know that has heat lamps. Unfortunately, it was still too cold to be outside even with the lamps. Bummer.  Al Pastor, the pork belly and carrot taco was what I ordered. I'm pretty underwhelmed, nothing memorable, and at $4/piece I only that I know there are way better options a few blocks away. I'm surprised there's still a long wait, granted we were a party larger than 2.

LOVE LOVE LOVE Big Star. Been coming for years, and will continue to. The wait can be long on any given day, but worth it. You can hang out at the bar until your table is ready! A great place to go with a group of friends, enjoy a pitcher of margaritas, a few tacos, and enjoy the outdoor seating. And the margaritas are dangerously tasty. If you're a lightweight, one will do. My favorite taco is the Pescado, crunchy on the outside and the slaw on top adds nice texture. Add the red hot salsa at the table! I wish they would introduce a shrimp taco- I feel like they could do this well. My second and third faves are the El Pastor and De Panza: tender delicious meat and the grilled pineapple on top of the Pastor adds nice flavor.  I enjoy that the menu is simple, and the cash only doesn't bother me. You can stay well within $20 for a meal if you aren't ordering drinks.

Man oh man, I love the tacos at Big Star. You'd be hard pressed to find a better fish taco in the city. The food is always awesome here, the thing that stops me from giving it that last star is the attitude of the place.  First of all, just plan on there being a massive wait when you go and then you won't be disappointed when you only wait 45 minutes for a table. Like I said, the tacos are worth it. And that's not the staffs fault. Their food is really freaking good and their patio and bar just can't quite keep up. Once you are seated, the food and drinks are reasonably quick!  The thing that gets me, and this has been the case on multiple visits, is the way some of the servers act like they are way too cool to be serving you. It's like they're annoyed that you think you can hang. I'm very easy going, I've worked in the service industry for years, I'm well aware of the high volume of this joint and I'm positive there are nights when they don't want to be there, but please don't talk to me like I'm an idiot. I'm just tryna up my Taco de Pescado game. I will definitely be back for the pork belly tacos, the fish tacos and a mezcal margarita or three. Don't forget to bring cash!

This review is for a trip to Big Star in late March. We rolled up at 7:00 on a Friday and were told there was a wait. How long? The hostess couldn't say. Ok, fine. We crammed into the bar and ordered a margarita and a michelada. Both were decent - not the best ever - but reasonably priced for Chicago. After we finished our drinks, it had been about an hour and our table was ready. On the patio. It was 30 degrees. Not ideal, but again, fine. We were hungry, and we were promised patio heaters. We ordered the al pastor, walking taco, tostada de hongos, and the frijoles. The tacos and tostada were average but small for the price point. The frijoles, however, were terrible - soupy, bland, and they came with two palm-sized corn tortillas. Two! Our waitress rushed us through the meal and had the check on the table before we had even finished eating. If it hadn't been freezing out and if the patio heater covered more than 1/4 of our table, this would have been more of an issue. All in all, we paid about $40 for a sub-par meal and left hungry and cold. Big Star was extremely over-hyped and underwhelming. Add the fact that its cash only, and I wouldn't recommend or go back.

Fish tacos were delicious! One of my favorite fish tacos I've had-- they manage to fry and batter the tilapia and sauce it up with chipotle mayo, without it tasting greasy or soggy at all. Chips and guac were good as well. I was not a fan of the al pastor (something about the sauce on the pork just didn't taste good to me, like sweet and sour sauce from a bad takeout place) but the pineapple added a nice touch. Constructive criticism: I ordered from the side window and got my meal "for here" to sit at the tables they have there, but they wrapped it to go.  I sat down at the bench to eat there anyway, and my tacos had gotten kind of squashed in the tin foil they use to wrap it for takeout. Not visually appealing. But still tasted good!

You will feel weirdly old just interacting with the staff. My advice? Just don't. Big Star has $1 delivery on grub hub! I'm never going to the restaurant again! Their walking taco is my love language. If you brought one to me as a gift, it would constitute a betrothal.  All of their other tacos are just as heavenly. I have no complaints about their food, and now for $1, it is at my disposal without the hassle of that hipsterhell.

I realize the only other time I've given this place raving reviews it's been after a long night of drinking. The food here is very basic and lacks flavor.  Thrown together and really tastes terrible. A good place to go get crazy in the neighborhood with friends but eat elsewhere. Wait was over 2 hours on Friday night for sub par food on a garage patio.

Got here with a friend to try their incredibly 'famous' tacos and much to my dismay was extremely disappointed with the food. First of all, we waited for almost 1 hour on a random weekday, which actually got me super excited because that meant the food was that good. We were seated after our much anticipated wait and ordered a whole plate of chicken, beef, fish, and potato tacos. None of the tacos were impressive in terms of flavor. Absolute disappointment! We were so hungry but could not even finish the tacos because they just did not taste like anything. The only notable one was the potato taco with a bit of flavor and a kick to it. Other than that the beef taco (taco de papas con rajas) had a bit of a weird taste to it and couldn't get past one bite, taco de pescado was alright, nothing too special. Also, none of the sauces there were hot or flavorful enough, and even when we tried loading our tacos with the sauce hoping for SOME flavor, it just did not work out. Anyways, the place was very hipster, loud, busy and pretty nice actually but not worth the food. Highly unlikely will return there.

Hipster, busy, and cash only. No, I'm not always in the mood to deal with this hipster infested madhouse but let me tell you why Big Star deserves 5 stars. Three years later and I still crave these tacos. If you don't want to deal with the chaos just go on a weekday, I personally avoid this place like the plague on the weekend. The food though really is amazing, highly recommended.
One of the best tacos I've had in my life. Al pastor and fish tacos were my favorites.
Daily whiskey deals, Lone Star, and some of the greatest tacos al pastor I've ever tasted...yes, please. Will be back often.

My boyfriend said you gotta try these tacos. So I was in town and we tried the tacos. Had the chorizo one, pork belly one and the walking dead. They were quite tasty and flavorful. If you do take remember cash. I didn't give it 5 stars only because I've traveled enough and I prefer more authentic tacos or street tacos. Would come here again.
I'd write a review if I could remember!  Basically, the margaritas are deliciously dangerous.  Bring cash/Order pitchers/Eat tacos/Stumble home
This is my favorite restaurant I've ever been to. Fish tacos, walking tacos and margaritas are 100%.

There is no truth.  There are truths;  many many truths.  And each truth discovered reveals a pathway to yet another.  And so on.  All the mounting truths laid out before mankind like a dotted highway trailing off into the distance.  Where does it lead?   How can I string it all together, and is my string any more purposeful and pointed as Kierkegaard's?  Or Fred Flintstones?    Uncovering more truth is increasingly painful, blinding really.  Each is yet a further departure from the mother question, which if you are like me, can't even be recalled.   There must have been a starting truth, or quest for one, perhaps drilled into our first human animal moments of self doubt.  Or maybe it was after our first disciplining from the parents; or further back, into the tribal fire circle when someone just blurted out "what the f@&£ is going on here."  We can't know.  Anthropologists can presuppose and theorize, but the mother question is too many truths removed from now.   And tomorrow, I think, will be too removed from this question to be able to cognitively compute yet another heaping spoonful of new truths.  There are too many and too many more to come.   So stop already.   Forget truth.  Forget looking.  Your moment is in the next taco.  The only truth worth reviewing is the type of beer to serve as base within a perfect michelada.   Sure, yes, even the Pacifico of that answer could ignite another snake dream into discovery and realization.  But please, please stop.  Just be right here for a minute and enjoy. . . Actually, do more than enjoy:  savor.

DO NOT GO HERE. DO NOT BELIEVE THE HYPE. Message me for recommendation for tacos in this city, the list is long and almost anywhere is better than this pretentious place. I've been here three times. The food is mediocre and not authentic. But worse than that, the service is miserable. I have never been waited on by such rude, arrogant people in my life. The last time I went, I overheard a server rudely asking the hostess not to seat anybody in her section even though the entire patio was open. We had two very pregnant women with us and when we asked if we could just sit down the hostess looked a little embarrassed about it but allowed us to. As we were sitting down we all we again overheard the waitress chewing out the hostess for allowing us to sit down. The waitress then proceeded to be extremely rude to us the entire time, would not even look at us and made us feel like we were ruining her day. For real, I mean it, this is not anywhere near as great a place as it is made out to be. You deserve better, trust me.

OMG THE BEST PLACE EVER! I love big star! They have the best tacos (so original and every taco is great. So not get discouraged by the mixture of ingredients) the atmosphere is so much fun! There is always a pretty long wait for dinner but make sure you put your name in and hop over to the bar. You could get lucky and get a seat there to eat.  The waitstaff and bartenders are awesome! They know what they are talking about. The margaritas are amazing. I love everything about this place. A MUST GO IF YOUR VISITING CHICAGO!!!

Good tacos, drinks, large outdoor space, buzzin' atmosphere. Everyone from Chicago had told me about this place and I finally got to enjoy it on a nice day in April. It's packed at all hours if it's warm out. You can get tacos with no alcoholic drinks from the stand on the side. We ate: Guacamole and chips - good as I tend to dislike guac when they smoothie the avocado and add too many ingredients; they don't do that here  Al pastor - good but I'm starting to think I will never find an al pastor taco like the one I had at a hole-in-the-wall in CA Pescado - very, very good! Rivals the Dos Piñas one in SF I used to love Chorizo - different and tasty; same flavor palate as an indian dish we make at home called keema Pork belly - also good! I would've given this place 4 stars but it's a super popular spot so I knocked it for a couple annoying things given how easily they could make it a better customer experience: No reservations and cash only. It's 2015. Get open table and square!

Big Star is definitely in my Top 5 Chicago restaurants so I cannot believe that 1. I haven't already reviewed it and 2. that so many people give it such low ratings! My only real gripe with the place is the long wait times for a table, but I can't really blame them for that (instead I blame all of the seemingly jobless but money having hipsters that pack this place at all hours of the day).  The tacos (my favorites being the pastor, chorizo, pescado, and papas....so pretty much all of them, ha) are delicious and, in my opinion, sizable. I also think the price point is very fair. The margaritas are perfect for a sunny day on their patio.  Can you get equally good tacos elsewhere in Chicago? Sure. Will they be cheaper? Maybe. But you won't get the same patio atmosphere. It's really comparing apples to oranges. If I'm just looking for a quick taco meal, I head to one of the taquerias found inside local Hispanic grocery stores. But that's not what I'm looking for when I go to Big Star. At Big Star, I want delicious tacos, margaritas, patio seating, and waiter service...and that's what I get.  I've probably never had a server go out of their way to be bubbly nice, but I've also never encountered a rude host or server. The cash only thing can be annoying, but it is what it is. And even though the long waits do exist, I like that they take your number and call you when the table is ready. I'm glad they opened the outdoor seating space next door for the take out window...shorter wait times if you're just looking for food and plenty of space to dine outside. Plus, I appreciate how dog friendly they are.

I mean, what can I say that hasn't been said?! Yes, I get that the wait on the patio can be long but it's worth it! The tacos are delicious, the service is awesome, the ambiance is amazing, the neighborhood is cool, the prices are pretty cheap..what more could you want?! Big Star is doing everything right and I will be a customer for as long as they are around!
Dear lord why havent I seen heard or been here before.  3 $ whiskey shots ....great tacos and hrrat ambience.  I can see why this place is crowded on a sunday night.  Xoxo

The place is really decent looking place in the middle of the or so trendy the Bucktown / North and Damen area. The food itself is firmly between three and three and a half stars. Well prepared and tastes good. So why is it that I am giving it two stars? Because the FOOD IS SO DAMN EXPENSIVE !!! Four buck for a taco! Three bucks for chips. That's right, they charge for the chips that every other Mexican restaurant ON EARTH gives your for free before they even take your order. One simple word......ridiculous. So if I ever hit the lottery, I will go back for dinner.

I've been going there every Monday from 2-5pm for 3 years. That crew has to be the nicest, most fun bar there is. Martin and Alana and Eric, and the bar back with all the tats. They play great music too, except that one time Sheryl Crow was playing. Man was that some B. S.

I wish I lived in WP so that I could munch their Al Pastors every day. In reality, living in a far neighborhood from them, it's my indulgence to stop by Big Star for take-outs when I have a business in WP every few months.  That's why I got so disappointed when I finally got home and opened brown bags to find that some items were missing. Soon I called to the restaurant. But what I learned was that because they ran the business completely on cash, they did not have any means to refund me directly. The girl said that they usually kept that amount as a credit for the customer to claim at his next visit. I was not very comfortable with that, for it basically required me to travel all the way to WP again to claim 10 bucks or so.  So she forwarded my concern to the restaurant manager, and I am telling you, his response to this matter was the most sincere, compassionate, and generous one I have ever known in my life. Apologizing that they would not be able to cash refund to me, he instead offered me to deliver a free dinner of my choice. I was already impressed by his making such an offer, although I suspected it would be impossible because I live far out of their delivery area. Still he and his team worked it out miraculously and made it happen for me! Thanks to them, I could enjoy wonderful tacos dinner again!  I know that not all employees here are necessarily nice, but this absolutely awesome manager makes me feel very positive about Big Star more than before. Thank you very much for yummy foods and incredible service. I can't wait to visit you again, already!

Not worth it. We arrived Sunday 1pm (bad time) with party of three, told there were 6 parties ahead of us, and gave the check in staff our phone number to text. We waited thirty minutes then we were told there were four ahead of us. Then we went for a walk outside, came back waited another 20 minutes, then told there were four ahead of us. After being repeatedly lied to we decided to leave. Still no text arrived. I think they let people in ahead of us. Plus while the ambience is good (but noisy) the food did not look great. Maybe in summer when the outside seating is available this works. But i dont trust the wait staff there so i will not return and do not recommend. Very disappointed given all the hype and good reviews.

Tacos are overrated but the cheap PBRs makes up for it. I don't really care for the overpriced guacamole but I guess it's the price you pay for the premium people watching venue. Go with friends and have a few beers with the tacos; otherwise you might be disappointed if you just go for food.
Amazing. Loved this "Austin eske"taco joint. Great tacos, wonderful and comprehensive bourbon list. Sat outside, such a fun scene.
You can feel the energy of satisfied customers wishing they had the personality of the most basic taco. Recommend the fish.
Cheap Mexican food, nice in the warm weather for sitting outside. Can be loud and crowdy.

I've heard about these tacos for years, but never trusted the hype; most of their customers would fail a random breathalyzer test, so how good can their taste buds be? But they deliver on Grub Hub now so I figured I'd give it a try. The order came super fast (I live about a mile away) - in just about 30 minutes.  I ordered 5 tacos so I could try most of them.  I was disappointed that there wasn't a steak option, but they may have been out of it for the day. Much to my dismay, the tacos arrived with no condiments - NO SALSA!  Ach!  Not a drop!  I would have dropped dead if I didn't have some of my own in the fridge!  I would have liked to try their salsa, but perhaps you have to buy it separately?  Odd. I have to agree with the other reviewers and say the tacos are pretty pricey for their small size, between $3-$4 bucks each.  They are served on the smaller more traditional Mexican style tortillas, and the tortillas were pretty good.  The spice level of each of the tacos was pretty good as well. Where the food fell short was flavor.   Overall, the only taco I really liked was the al pastor.  Here is the breakdown: Chorizo Taco - made with what I assume is house chorizo, the meat had a ground beef flavor, and was pretty bland, with a strange after taste and none of the spicy succulent sauciness of chorizo.   It was also an odd color, very grey. Chicken taco - the sauce and toppings were good on this one, but the chicken was quite dry. Veggie Taco (potato & rajas) -  this taco was just all potato, also dry and bland, with no rajas to be seen.   I was looking forward to the peppers as the description said "chipotle rajas" which sounds delicious and certainly would have added more flavor to the taco, but they were MIA. Al Pastor - al pastor is one of my favorite Mexican dishes.  I found this taco to be delicious, though it wasn't very authentic.  It didn't have the traditional red sauce and spicy rub, but it was smoky, grilled, and seasoned properly, and the pineapple chunks were great. Overall, I was disappointed in these tacos and the only one I would order again is the al pastor.... unless I was drunk, then I might try some others ; )

I'm giving this place 4stars. It's a favorite of mine for late night taco run when I'm in city. The belly tacos are to die for, they are so good! Every time I've gone they are quick to sit us down and quick on food and drinks. They have awesome chips too. Only down side is that their food has been getting to the table kind of cool not warm at all. They need to warm up tortillas and serve the food warmer. I almost feel like they just put meat on without warning tortilla up. And if they do it's obviously not long enough. But food is great though, I go pretty often and I plan to. I just hope food starts to get served warmer.

One star for this crappy overrated joint, we had to wait for almost hour which is fine & expected since this is a popular place, the food was decent, it was the waitress that really annoyed me and defined the service to deserve a one star, didn't ask us what we wanted to drink, totally flat, not engaging, after 15 mins asks "staying or going" After waiting for an hour an still not getting a table inside please be kind enough to extend the minimal waitress courtesy please, so, not coming back, nothing special here

By far my favorite taco place! Out of this world!! Everything on their menu is delicious, I don't think you could pick a single bad thing. Margaritas are great! This is a great place to meet up with a few friends. Fun and inviting environment. I love that they have heaters on their patio so that you can still sit outside on cooler nights. Great place, it's always hard to choose between trying a new restaurant in chicago or just going to big star. I could eat here everyday!!!

Love the food!!!! Usually a wait out the door so choose a time that is not so busy such as between lunch and dinner, cash only place but worth it!!!!! The fish taco is great and their margaritas are pretty delicious and pretty strong :)
Such awesome tacos!   Great variety.  Super friendly and efficient wait staff.  Worth the wait. Yummy adult beverages. Cannot wait to go back!

Another spot that was really close by to where I was staying in Chicago was big star taco. Recently I have been in a huge taco crunch. I can't get enough. Walking in I was eating alone so I decided to sit at the bar. I was the only one. Thus I got a lot of attention from the servers and they were really nice to me. One was joking with me about taking pictures and it not being allowed. She must've noticed that I was in from Chicago. But hey a bloggers got to do what a bloggers got to do.  To eat I had three tacos. I had the taco de pescado, taco de pollo pibil and the taco de chorizo verde.  The fish taco had a beer battered tilapia fillet, chipotle mayo, cabbage, red onion, lime and cilantro. It was very good; I added a little bit of one of the sauces to add additional flavor. The chicken taco was quite good too; it had chicken thighs steamed in banana leaves with citrus marinade, pickled red onions and cilantro. My favorite, however, was the chorizo taco. It had pork sausage, poblano, serrano, pumpkin and sesame seeds, potato, onion and cilantro and had quite the kick.  I absolutely loved it.  I love satisfied having had only three tacos and having spent 10 bucks on tacos. That was a win in my book. For anyone who's looking to come in please know that it's cash only.
Tasty but the tacos are too small for the price and they don't take credit cards. Perhaps every table should get chips and salsa for free, I didn't find value going there and won't return.

I love this place!!!!! The wait is long, yes, but it's absolutely worth it. And the host staff is very friendly. We waited over an hour and a half, BUT you have to come here knowing you have to wait!!! Don't walk up at 7 and get pissed that you have to wait till 8:30 to get a table. It's just how it goes. Their margaritas - AMAZING. Their tacos - AMAZING. Al pastor is my favorite. You will not be disappointed if you come here. Just come with cash! They have an ATM but it's better to come with cash. When you come here, just effing relax and roll with the punches. The people who don't belong here are the people who get angry about a long wait.  Chill, be patient, enjoy. Chicago.

long line for underwhelming tacos. do you know what kinds of amazing tacos exist within walking distance of Big Star?? Authentaco? La Pasadita? Antique Taco?? Don't buy the hipster hype and go have a good taco somewhere else. This isn't an issue of "authentic" tacos vs. gentrified tacos. Big Star's tacos suck compared to authentic tacos and compared to other gentrification tacos. Antique Taco, Takito are both better. Do better.

I was a fan of the place... until today. Yeah, I may come back but not soon.  I take bad service to the heart! It was apparently a busy day for them which I get.  I learned today that this is the place you need to know people if you want to get in fast.  Literally we waited about an hour an a half, which I get, it was "busy". People cool with the security man and the girl at the door were being seated left and right. The girl at the door had the bitchiest attitude.  Her only answer was "we'll text you when your table is ready".... Some more people showed talked to the door man, and wait for it wait for it... They get a table.... We finally get our table.... Took forever before any one greeted us.... The waitress finally came and we ordered everything we wanted including drinks.... It takes forever before someone comes back to check on us... We needed more food, because you gotta give it to the... The food it's pretty good..... It took the longest time to get a couple more tacos.... Before our last order of tacos comes out... They come and clean up our table! Ugh....! I wouldn't have done a bad review if the waitress had been a little more attentive... And the girl at the door didn't have that bitchy attitude....  It's just a bummer you gotta know people here if you want to get fast cordial service.... Unfortunately, this is the case at this place... I'll come back but not anytime soon....

The tacos are pretty amazing, but when the hostess told me it would be a 45 minute wait, that turned into 2 hours. They text you when your table is ready, so a simple text after 45 minutes to tell me it would be longer would have been really helpful. After 1.5 hours, we decided to just go to the taco take out counter and wait 20 minutes to take tacos home. I was also disappointed as it was a Monday night and I was not expecting a 2 hour wait.

Worst service by far in Chicago. Worst food- how can one mess up a bean taco- more like bean soup. I was served a dirty plate and the bus boy acted like it was my fault. Dirty cups nasty food. Dear god- how do people give this crappy hole more than a star?

The pork belly taco and pastor taco were delicious!! my friend had the fish taco and that was really good too! The service could have been a bit better though, I guess when its a really busy place, they don't care too much about the service but at least the food was good.

We walked up, and they turned us away. We requested a manager and he told us we didn't need one because we were too intoxicated. Bouncer Kevin said we had been drinking, when my stone cold sober sister, who had driven there and can't even take medication, was the birthday girl. Needless to say, my friends who were about to spend $200 at this restaurant, not including us, left on the spot. Good for business? Probably not.  We went down the street and had a grand time for another hour or so before deciding we were taking up space. If you think you have to be part of an elite club, go to Star Grill, if not, go to any of the one hundred places around it, including the Violet Hour, which is a premium speak easy across the street, that I would spend $10 per drink minimum on each. I will leave you with this, the tacos are really good at star grill, but you can go to a bajillion other places that are reasonably priced and way more authentic than this place. Last, the Star Grill is not worth the hype, time of day, or inflated prices.

Ordered all 6 tacos and shared with a friend. I thought that this place was great. I think I prefer Antique Taco over Big Star but I'll have to try them both again.  I didn't feel gross after eating here, thought they were flavored really well, nothing too heavy.  The chips were a bit stale =[ Favorite Tacos: Taco De Panza - you really cannot go wrong with Pork Belly.  Taco De Chorizo Verde - YESS  Not Bad: Both vegetarian tacos. The potato one was refreshing, mild, and the potatoes were crispy on the outside, chewy on the inside.  Eh: I thought that I would enjoy the Taco De Pescado more than I did. The fish was good, but could of used a hell of a lot more flavor, thank god for the chipotle mayo or I would have been pretty disappointed.  CASH ONLY.
I'm going to assume you could find a better chicken taco in the garbage. Not to mention the bartender being a total bitch to my girlfriend and I. Ripping the menus out of our hands before ordering.

I've only been here during weekdays for lunch and the food/service has always been great. The guacamole is so awesome that I have to get it every time I go. Big Star is a bit on the pricey side, but I do think the quality of the food justifies the price. It seems like people's experience at Big Star varies depending on the time and day that they visit, so I'll have to give this place a shot on a weekend or evening!

Great menu, atmosphere, and location. Yes, there is often a wait and the place can get packed, but when you do get a seat, it is so worth it. You can drink while you wait to take the edge off. And it's cash only, but now that you know that, it shouldn't be a problem. I've tried most of the menu and my favorite taco is definitely the fish (taco de pescado). Last time I had this taco I thought about it for weeks. All other fish tacos will be compared to this one. It's fresh and light but super flavorful. I also like the taco de papas con rajas, which is a pretty cool veg option, with potatoes inside. The guacamole is also amazing and super fresh. I love the horchata and think the dulce de leche milkshake is worth it if you're feeling indulgent. The absolute best time to be at Big Star is when you can sit outside on the patio for lunch, dinner, or late night when the weather permits, but it's great to sit inside in the winter too when the patio becomes a Christmas tree farm.
Great veggie tacos, great guac, great dips, great drinks! I love this place and now live in Edgewater but would find ways to go back! It is so good and such a fun environment!

I effing hate this place. The food is overrated, but that's not really the bad part of the Big Star experience. The hosts, bouncers, servers, and bartenders are such A-holes who could care less how long you are there waiting for just a bare minimum acknowledgement. The only people worth talking to are the cooks through the takeout window who most likely get the short end of the stick when it comes to Big Star profits anyways.
2 hours and 22 minutes later.......ridiculous! Food and drinks are great, but not worth waiting 2.5 hours for a taco.  Also, how about adding a steak or ground beef taco?

I had an idlewild south to drink, which was delicious. The queso was also really amazing but I was unimpressed with the small taco plates, especially the taco al pastor. The walking taco is a fun concept tho since they serve it in a Fritos bag. The service was good overall tho! I think I need to go back to try more on the menu.

A lot of popular Wicker Park restaurants are overated. Big Star always has a lot of people, especially their outdoor space in the summertime. However, Big Star doesn't disappoint with their food. The fish tacos are one of the best I've tried in Chicago. While fish tacos are typically overcooked or too small, this one is light and crispy. It'salso a big strip of fish too. I really liked the mushroom tostada. It first started picking at it, only eating the mushrooms on the top, but when I managed to take a bite of the whole tostada, somehow, the flavors changed, and it was even more delicious. Next time, I would skip the potato tacos, and order the fish tacos and mushroom tostadas.

So it is close to 12:30am. I haven't eaten dinner because the hostess at Big Star took my number at 8:30. She told me the wait would be about 1.5 hours and it's been 4 hours. One might ask, did he speak clearly when he said his phone number so he could get a text when his table was ready, yes I said my number twice for clarity purposes and she even repeated my number right back to me. I'm so disappointed. Big Star needs to get over itself. Also their "bouncer" was a jerk, very unwelcoming, and condescending. I don't know if I feel comfortable coming back to this place again.

The tacos are good, they have a lot of different meats/options that are seasoned/prepared in different ways. Although I do enjoy the food, I do not enjoy, however, the ridiculous line/wait time. I have been there three times, once we waiting so long we decided to eat elsewhere. It definitely is a fun experience as they have outdoor seating and a bar as well as pick up window, but be prepared for a long line.

This is one of my favorite places in Chicago! The tacos are hands down the best. You can't go wrong with ordering off the menu. My favorite drink is the Paloma. Big Star is a great Sunday funday place in the summer. There is also a take out window for quick service.

Not a huge fan of their food but they have really good margaritas. It typically gets busy on the weekends around 6 pm and sometimes the wait for a table can be up to 2 hours. Though there is usually a wait, I always have a fun time there and they play really awesome music!
I enjoyed their tacos everytime. It has great atmosphere, especially in summer. The waiters are a bit snobbish though.

Is it worth the often long waits to get a table? That's tough to answer. The tacos and guacamole are fresh and tasty, and the price is absurdly reasonable for the lines they command. The atmosphere is always lively and bumping, and a lot of fun if you can secure a table during a summer weekend day.  Big Star is a great one, two punch combo with Violet Hour across the street. I love getting drunk on good cocktails at Violet Hour, and then coming here for some late night food.
These tacos are slammin'!  I loved it back in the day when I could actually get in and enjoy some inside dining, but whatever.  Walk up is the way to go now.  SOOO GOOOD!!!

Best place in Chicago for a good margarita! The atmosphere is great the service is very accommodating and the bartenders are excellent. Great for day drinking on the patio in Chicago's beautiful summer and the inside is inviting even on the coldest wintery days. One of my favorite local spots by far! The tacos and guac are a must have!

As far as the atmosphere and food are concerned, Big Star is one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago and certainly the one I patronize the most outside of the neighborhood where I reside.  It's just off the Damen Blue Line station in Wicker Park, and I often pick up dinner from there before heading south to the LaSalle Blue Line station and transferring to the Rock Island Metra for a 35 minute ride to Beverly/Morgan Park on the city's far South Side. That said, I'm giving it one out of five stars to put it on notice for occasional egregiously bad acts of customer service.  The key instance: When I sat inside to eat earlier this week, one of the bartenders took my driver's license (as the bartenders normally do as insurance for payment) and never returned it.  When I inquired about it over the phone later, I was asked to "call back in a few hours when we have time to check."  I ended up returning to Big Star a few hours later, after 10 PM, to pick up the license.  The bartender was unable to find it.  When I suggested that Big Star accept cash deposits in lieu of driver's licenses (with numbers associated with each patron's deposit), she rolled her eyes like they were in a hoola hoop competition.   Worst still, when I left the restaurant to order food from the take-out window, it had closed prematurely without advanced notice (it wasn't the first time this has happened).  Because too little time was left before the Metra train departed for me to investigate other restaurant options, I went home hungry and without a driver's license.  This morning, I filed a police report in order to have the license replacement fee waived, but 69 W. Washington wouldn't have it.  I had to pay $5 for a replacement driver's license - which means that Big Star owes me a free cup of its out of this world $5 guacamole!
Great service and delicious food! Greeter/hostess was a little awkward, but what're you going to do?

Always a go to when looking for great food in Wicker Park. It can be a slight wait if you go in high traffic times (Weekdays/Weekends after 5) but it is well worth the wait. Great selection of tacos that come out in a matter of minutes regardless of how busy the restaurant is. Servers are very accommodating and can put your order in table side which greatly reduces the chances of your order getting mixed up. Beer and mixed drink selection is great and are always rotating craft beers from around the area.

Love this place, SO fun to while away a Sunday Funday afternoon at the lively bar. Micheladas with Tecate, yes, please! Tacos. I was the least excited about the Chicken Thigh tacos, but they turned out to be the ones I liked the best. Juicy and savory and topped with pickled onion. My favorite! Also, Al Pastor, Chorizo and Pork Belly. It was a bit difficult to identify which was which, but when tacos are this delicious, who cares? Good amount of options for vegs, and it says on the menu, they will substitute or omit on request. So, you're covered here. Friendly bartender, and a great space. This is a good one, no wonder it's crowded all the time.

My favorite restaurant in Chicago. From favorite to least 1. Pork belly 2. Walking taco 3. Potatoes 4. Fish 5. Chorizo 6. Chicken 7. Steak. Love this place in the summer but will put with it in the winter cause I love it so much.

Awesome food, great atmosphere, but small portions for the price. The two of us who went got six tacos (three each) and I got horchata. With tax and tip, we paid almost $30. The tacos and tostadas are small, so just keep that in mind.  Each taco/tostada was about the size of a coaster.  If you do go, my recommendations are the spicy potato tacos and the mushroom tostadas. Glad I tried this place once!

Another restaurant in Wicker Park propped up by the Hype Machine.  I really can't fathom why people rave about this place or why they even to endure the 1+ hour to get in.  I've gotten take-out twice (both times waited over 15 mins for the food!) and the tacos were average at best and a bit on the smaller & over-priced side to boot.   The first time I ate here; I got the fish, al pastor & chorizo tacos.  The al pastor taco is perfect for vegetarians as you taste nothing but cooked pineapple and no meat taste at all.  The fish was decent but was a small portion that could've been classified as a Fish McNugget and had a $4 price-tag.  The chorizo was the best of the sad lot and had decent flavor but it's really hard to mess up a chorizo taco.   Like other reviewers have mentioned, there a hordes of taco joints in the vicinity that have much better tacos and are cheaper.  I think  Big Star appeals to xenophobic people too scared to check out a real Taqueria run by real Mexicans.

A bit pretentious in the whole thing.  Prices are relative to the Wicker Park area but I have found better and cheaper tacos elsewhere.   It's a great people watching venue.  The drinks are great, even if they are pricey.  They have great flavor and are often unique in taste.  Trying getting seated - you'll wait a long time if you don't make it before happy hour.

Good tacos and super cheap! I've been on multiple occasions, and even had tacos to go! It's best to go during the summer months when their outdoor patio is open. It's a fun atmosphere with reasonably priced drinks too. Downside: after midnight on a Saturday, it seemed like more of a frat party inside with a bunch of creepy guys. Not the establishment's fault, just an observation. Would recommend for groups or a fun afternoon or night out during the summer!

I just wanted to mention that this place has recently increased their prices from $3 to $4 on some of their more popular tacos. Definitely still worth the money as I would easily pay $5 / taco and walk out happy. This is one of my favorite food spots in Chicago.

Yes, super yes! Will be going back for tacos and whiskey. The menu is concise and perfect. The staff is enthusiastic and very helpful. I will be back for tacos and drinks. The ambiance is exactly what out of towers would enjoy. My wife and had a great time the other day. We'll def be back.
Love Big Star, it's my girlfriend's favorite place and don't think I can find a better fish taco. All others are great as well but it's my favorite of all of them.

I wanted to really like Big Star. When I told people I was moving to Wicker Park, they would tell me, "Oh, yeah. That's where Big Star is. You have to try it!" After an evening of drinking, we decided it was time to head on over. We were seated right away even though it seemed pretty crowded. For reference, it was after midnight on a Saturday night. It wasn't until we were seated that we realized this place was cash only. Oops. Luckily, my girlfriend had $20 on her, so we decided to ration the money among the two of us for sustenance. I already had a bad taste in my mouth about Big Star for being cash only. I mean, come on. You get that much business and you can't afford to get with the times and buy a credit card machine? We enjoyed complimentary chips and salsa as we perused the menu. I ended up getting something called a "walking taco" and a potato taco. Imagine my surprise when our food comes out and my "taco" is actually some taco fillings thrown into a small bag of Fritos. What!? Typical hobo-chic Wicker Park, I thought. It tasted fine, but it was just odd, ESPECIALLY because there's nothing at all on the menu description of the item that suggests it's actually a glorified bag of Fritos for way too much money.  At the end of the night, I didn't feel like we spent our $20 well. I was still hungry when we left.

I'm addicted LOL  Here are my favs... the Taco de Pescado and the Walking Taco! The guac is amazing and I have to have the Fist City beer. SO yummy! I only wish it was open just a little bit longer on the weekends or at least late night walk up window for those of us who go to the bars on the weekend :p

I've been hearing about Big Star for a few years, so this past Saturday(my birthday weekend) I got to see what all the hype was about. The sign is literally a big 'ol star.  Seems to me they have a large outdoor seating area that's probably popping in the better weather months.  The weather on the night we visited it was a toasty 37 degrees, so the 45 minute wait just to put your name on a list for a table was fine comfort wise.  They also provide outdoor heaters that were blazing hot.   Once inside, we gave our name and were told we'd get a text in about an hour for our table. No biggie, because the bar are is huge and the bartenders are on their job.  A beer(Shiners Birthday Beer) and 2 shots later(Prairie Dogs) the hostess actually came to find us to take us to our table. So the atmosphere here isn't made by the cinder blocks or lawn furniture, it's all about the food. Tacos. Tacos for days y'all.  We had Taco de Panza(pork belly), Taco Al Pastor(pork shoulder), Taco Carne Asada, and the Queso Fundido.  My favorite was the Taco Al Pastor because it had these tiny pieces of pineapple that really brought the flavor.  The Queso Fundido was a cheese lovers dream, melted perfectly over this delicious homemade chorizo. Excuse me while I reminisce and drool.   To avoid long waits, my dining partners suggested coming here during lunch or grabbing a taco at the carry out window.

Right off the Damen blue line stop in Wicker Park. This is a super fun taco place. I've been here a few times for Taco Tuesday's with friends. They don't really have a Tuesday special, but the prices are reasonable to begin with ($3-4/taco, $3 tecate). The tacos are really good. I like the fish, but they also have chorizo, al pastor, pork belly, etc. I also highly recommend the margarita.  You have to order chips and salsa if you want them. Normally I would criticize a Mexican place for not having these on the table when you walk in, but it doesn't feel wrong at big star. Maybe because this isn't an average Mexican place.

I have to preface this review with the fact that I work in this industry. And have for almost 19 years. This place is great! I consistently have had solid service, even when it is outrageously busy. Do they come off as flippant sometimes? Yes. But rightfully so. Dealing with the hoards of people who have "discovered" Big Star can be challenging, I imagine. I have never waited ages for any taco or menu item. In fact, I have never waited longer than 15 minutes for anything.  Delicious and consistent food, honest atmosphere,  and great people watching.
Only one word for this place.. Amazing! Fish tacos highly recommended always packed always fast!
Best place in Chicago for a taco and a whiskey. Bring cash - no credit cards here. Summertime's patio is fantastic when playing hooky from work.

Ok. This place is OK. If you want to see what a hipster looks like, be sure to head over to BIG STAR. Cookie cut-outs of the same look all over. ANYWAY... went for the fish taco (ha) and margaritas. Both were good. They have this thing with fritos that is also good.. great hangover type of food.. but its pricey but minimal ingredients. My tacos were sad looking, in that there was barely any filling to them. Eh, guess it doesn't matter when people get boozed up on margs anyway. Sauces were tasty.. I could never tell who my waitress was since they looked like patrons, very very laid back place but then again, i felt completely like a fish out of water. If you aren't a "trendy" person you may not feel at home here. Everyone seems to judge you and your outfit as you travel to the teeny bathroom in back.  Bright. Cool.. before it was cool.. type of thing. Won't be back.. I go out for the food, not to be annoyed by the people that go there. If you're with a group of fun friends I'd do it, or maybe earlier times.. otherwise just be prepared to deal with the worst people in Wicker Park and the people that travel to WP just to say they've been there.

Fun environment, killer tacos, delicious drinks! I love that the Big Star Margarita has some mezcal in it.  As for food: the pescado and panza tacos are amazing. And the walking taco! As much as I love this place in the summer, it's just as fun in the winter. Only 4 stars because (even though they have an ATM right inside) it's annoying that it's cash only.

I went to catch up with my friend and parking was so difficult to find. I drove in circles so many times.  When I get into the restaurant, the setting is great. It was open and very casual. There's seating in one section and a bar in the other but the day bar was so nice. There was a wait but the waitress said it would be 5 minutes and we waited for 30 minutes. We thought we were forgotten about.  When we were finally seated, we ordered some tacos. The tacos were so good but small. I ordered three and then ordered another one because I was still hungry.  For me, the place was subpar. I think this place is too overhyped and is just another taco place without the Mexican restaurant.

Came here about 2 years ago and had THE best spicy chicken tostada I have ever had in my life. I've been dreaming about it ever since. The flavor was perfect and the heat was amazing, actually spicy unlike a lot of places! It's hard to find a good flavourful actually spicy taco,/tostada/whatever anywhere. This place had it and at a good price. Not to mention the Guacamole, oh man, the Guacamole. Service, for the amount of bodies in that place was also pretty quick and efficient. Wow, I really need to go back. Hopefully they've got those tostadas still!
Great food. But I put my name in for a rezo @ 6:30 & they said they'd text me when my table was ready. It's 11:00 & still no text. What kind of service is that?
Great place w/really nice outdoor seating & delicious tacos & salsa, but needs to accept credit cards its the 21st century!

What happened to big star? The food - especially the take out food - seems to be consistently going downhill. From receiving the wrong items to dry, inedible meat, this is not the experience that I expect from them. They used to have the best fish tacos around - now the tacos are all fish and no sauce. It's a fine balance they used to do really well. And then they brought out the chicken taco, and it used to be delicious - spicy, but with a yogurt sauce to cut the spice. But then they got rid of the yogurt sauce, and I just now had the driest chicken taco ever. Not good.

Fantastic food! Went with my wife and friend, we started with fundido, with the chorizo on the side (vegetarian in the group) and it was fantastic! We all shared four different types of tacos and left stuffed!! Washed it all down with a margarita! Great way to start the week and we definitely will be back soon!!
I love this place, be warned its cash only! The tacos

The el pastor and pescado tacos are amazing. The guacamole is always fresh and the chips that go with it are awesome. The margaritas are tasty and delicious. In the summer, the agua fresco, is very refreshing. The only problem with Big Star is the wait for dinner, especially in the summer. I've become a big fan of going for lunch or using the pick up window. I'm looking forward to their new pick up window seating area next summer.

UPDATED REVIEW: 4 STARS: So I am updating my review, truly for only one reason. Not only did I review Big Star on here, I sent a email directly to the restaurant expressing my disappointment and explaining what happened. Not too long after emailing Big Star, the General Manager Mark called me (which he had to track down as I did not leave my phone number on my email). He communicated that he received my email and felt horrible for what happened. He stated that what had happened was not communicated properly to me and that if he knew what was said and if he could have, he would have driven my order over to me personally. He seemed extremely genuine in his response to me and offered to have my food delivered to me right away.  I communicated that I had already ordered food from somewhere else and he immediately offered to send a gift card to me. Now, this was AMAZING customer service. I cannot yet comment on the food, but I am now willing to try Big Star sooner rather than later,  thanks solely to the GM Mark who gets a big shout out.  PREVIOUS REVIEW: 1 STAR: I am extremely disappointment in my experience this evening with Big Star. This way my first time ordering food to be delivered and first time trying Big Star. After placing my order online the food showed up really fast. After realizing that my order was wrong(they delivered someone's order who had walked up to order not ordered online), I called the restaurant which the lady who answered the phone seemed to not know how to handle this situation and did not seem to care. Finally, I was told that the restaurant was too busy to redeliver my food and that I would get a refund. TOO BUSY?!? I honestly find it ridiculous that a restaurant that makes a mistake on their end decides to tell their customer that they cannot redeliver their order. What kind of customer service is that? I thought that I needed to pass along this information and my disappointment, as I stated in the beginning this was my first time with Big Star and I had heard such great things about the food. After tonight, I do not think that I will be trying Big Star anytime soon. Wish Antique Taco delivered... :(

After many failed attempts to eat at Big Star, I finally had a chance this past weekend during a trip to Chicago. I will say, it definitely lives up to the hype and was worth the wait! I absolutely loved the carne asada taco as well as the pastor. The pastor had a unique fusion of flavor between the pork and pineapple, while the carne asada had the perfect amount of kick to it! I also had a walking taco and that was the only thing I was mildly disappointed with. It was strange at best. I look forward to trying other items on the menu the next time I'm in town. Oh, and don't forget the Big Star margarita...it's a must!

This is a really cool place in the summer!  I love the set up and the taco selection as well as the location. The service isn't good, and the margaritas are not strong, but I still enjoy hanging out here.

I'm not going to try and pretend I'm adding anything new to the wealth of information and reviews out there. This really is more a reminder for myself than a review, because while I don't go to Big Star often enough to remember which tacos I love the most, I certainly revisit enough that I should have a frame of reference by now. Sadly, I don't. I blame the margarita pitchers and the whiskey shots for this embarrassing tragedy.  Luckily, there exist writing utensils and paper with which at least on one occasion I had the sense to take notes. And from one such scrap, I found the following: "Pescado, pastor, pork belly, chicken, walking taco, papas." And that's my rank of the tacos from most to least worth re-ordering. That's pretty much it.
Awesome!!! My go to taco place. Always on point. Fun for a large group, group of girlfriends or just you and your date for a late night bite (this is my favorite time to dine).

WORTH THE HYPE. Amazing tacos. The only downside is the extreme HYPE. The wait is always a bit long, if you're hoping to sit inside. And yes, what've you heard is true - it's cash only.  But order as many tacos as you can (skip the chips and guac to save room for tacos) and get a pitcher of margarita.

place has a lot of hype especially for its shrimp tacos. Visited recently and the menu was rather small and tacos overpriced. I was disappointed to learn that they no longer offer the shrimp tacos, and had to settle on beef tacos. I was highly disappointed at paying $4 a taco and it being very tiny and regular in taste.  Sticking to authentic Taquerias, with better tasting tacos and way better priced.
The best taco in town.  Love the atmosphere and ambiance.  Great spot for a quick delicious tacos after few drinks.

Ive had their tacos before and they're ok but we live in Chicago, there are amazing tacos everywhere! I'd rather go somewhere that wants my business! Their food is overpriced and their staff is pretentious.  Went there last night with two other couples and headed straight to the bar. While we were ordering drinks we saw two booths open up so I walked over to the very unpolite hostess (either she was unhappy or just had RBF) who told me that I needed to wait to be seated. I was watching her put our name down and we were third on the list so I was hopeful that one of them would be ours.  In the mean time I received my drink, a vodka soda, which was actually tequila soda, everyone in my group tried it and agreed. When we told the bartender, two of them proceeded to tell me that it was made with vodka, CH distillery vodka, and their vodka happens to taste like tequila. Ummmm....I work at the building on Clinton and Randolph...I'm at CH distillery for happy hour all the time....their vodka does not taste like tequila and why all the sudden is another bartender jumping in telling me, "I watched her make it. It's vodka." Instead of a lesson on "this is how vodka tastes" can you just offer up another beverage other than tequila soda? I prefer to drink my tequila in shots. I can't sip it with soda water.  And why did another bartender have to jump in? Eventually, I was the one to ask for another drink and was told that it was the only vodka they serve. Shouldnt I be offered something else since I'm clearly telling you I don't like how the vodka soda tastes? Make a suggestion on another drink possibly....one that doesn't taste like tequila soda. As this was going on, the hostess walked up to my husband to seat us at one of the booths but since we were still trying to figure out why I was given tequila soda. She gave the booth to another group. Eventually all 6 of us were sat at a 4 top aluminum table.  My husband and I left and got real tacos elsewhere. At the end of the day, their food is overpriced and service is unfriendly. The only reason to go is the patio for the summer. Get tacos elsewhere when the patio isn't open.

I love the food!  The table service and atmosphere was great, but beware of your change when you order a drink at the bar.  I was short changed $10 twice.  The first time I wasn't 100% sure whether I gave the bartender $40 or $30 so when I was shorted $10 I let it go.  The next time I knew what I gave him.  Sure enough I was shorted $10 again.  After he waited on two more customers, I asked for my change, and he went right to what appeared to be a tip box and gave me my $10. I'm sure this tip scam works a lot of the time and the guy takes home a nice untaxed piece of change each night!  As for me, I will take my hard earned money to a restaurant where I don't feel like I was robbed when I leave.

Great tacos, ambiance is average in the winter but would be great in the summer with the outdoor patio. Service was nice and fast - almost too fast. We ordered chips and guacamole (which was quite overpriced for what you get) and less than a minute later our tacos came out. Would have liked some time to enjoy the chips before the tacos since we didn't want the tacos to get cold.  Note: check ids at the door, cash only.
Whiskey and tacos, two of my favorites. Get here early to grab a booth seat, and then settle in for a fun night. Also, queso fundido is my third favorite.
The service here was very friendly and the tacos  where good.  But they do not take credit cards so make sure you bring cash!

I stoped by today and tried an El Pastor taco. The main ingrediants were pork, pineapple (!), and cilantro. I thought it was a bit pricey ($4 for a small taco), but have to admit they were pretty solid. Not quite what I was expecting though.  Next time, I will try the pork belly tacos.

This place is a Chicago institution.  If you've been living in the city recently for more than say 6 months and you don't know what this place is, then you might get weird looks. I'll be honest - the place is overrated for its food. Yes, they have an extensive list of whisky and their drinks aren't bad. The place is buzzing usually and has an at least decent vibe usually. If you're coming here for the drinking, then no problem with that. The food is what I have the problem with. No it's not bad food, but it's overrated. You will hear people describe it as the best tacos in town, which is downright offensive when you consider the plethora of authentic taco joints in town that are much better, especially on the SW side of the city. The tacos are in no way bad, but they aren't even close to the best that this city has to offer. They are usually about average when compared to what you'd get in the Mexican parts of town (which are many). If you aren't familiar with tacos and think that Cantina Laredo offers great, authentic Mexican food, you'll probably think these are great too. However, if you have a lot of experience with authentic Mexican food and especially good tacos, you might be let down by these if you have heard the hype. Anyway, not a bad place, and the food is not bad, but be suspicious of people who claim these are the best tacos that Chicago has to offer. I could list you at least 50 better places for that.
Taco's are decent at best. The service is sub-par. It's more crowded than a Tokyo subway 95% of the time.

I am a taco purist... That is unless we are talking about Asian inspired fusion tacos, then I can deviate.  The tacos here are overdone and overdressed using too many ingredients to try to make these acceptable.  The guacamole was bland and the wait was entirely too long for what you end up getting.  All the while, the crowd around you is getting more annoying because they think the food is amazing.   The service was good, but I never go to a restaurant because the service is good. Not recommended.

Oh Big Star, I want to like you. I really do. I'd like to join the bearded and schwinn riding masses that line up for your tacos and bask in your newly renovated patio (which is quite nice) but you've blown about every chance I've given you. First, I ask for a Walking Taco with no beans. Stopping to inform a customer that the beans come mixed with the meat was too much work for you so you opted to take my money and give me a bag of Frito's with shredded cheese and lettuce. Thanks for not taking an extra 1.5 seconds to give decent customer service, but ok I thought. I'll give it another shot. It was busy that day and there was a line of people behind me. I'm a reasonable person after all. Second, I decided to dine in with a group of friends. It was noisy and obnoxious but the atmosphere was fun and the margaritas were killer. Everything was going great until my boyfriend took a bite of his taco and proceeded to pull a giant black curly hair out of his food. No amount of margarita can make someone forget that unfortunately. The waitress was great and replaced our entire platter of remaining tacos (or at least that's what we were told) but we took her word for it because she was nice. Now as  I sit here taking shots of pepto to ease my food poisoning from the 3rd attempt at liking your food, I can't lie to myself anymore. Not worth the hype. The service is good if you get lucky enough to have a decent server, there are some hygiene issues to be addressed, and please check the freshness of your food. The second star is only being generous because the margarita pitchers were fantastic.

You're most likely going to have a wait a fair amount, but you can leave your number and go hang out somewhere else.  We went and sat on a bench in a park nearby and waited to get called.   The patio is bustling but really nice.  Had some good whiskey drinks, my girlfriend a margarita, and we both enjoyed them.  The tacos are really good, fairly priced, and definitely worth it on a nice day.
I used to live in the neighborhood, miss Big Star so much, great tacos and limeade.
Yupster hotspot. Love this place. Food is fast. Staff is very indifferent, got a bit of a 'tude. Cash only

Okay, I'm a fan again. After a very rude experience we tried again and hot damn they have some tasty tacos. Go there when it's not too busy and you'll probably be a happy camper like we were. Pricey, but you pay for quality.

I visited Big Star on a recent weekend trip to Chicago after getting several recommendations from friends to try it out. I really loved my experience there, not because the tacos were the absolute best I'd ever had (although they were still quite delicious), but because Big Star really excels at being a great late-night spot where you can wind down, sober up, and have some great drunk food. (I'm sure it's also wonderful all day every day in the summer, as their outdoor space looked awesome). My husband and I had two tacos each - 1 al pastor, 1 potato, 1 asada, and 1 chorizo - and enjoyed all of them, but I have to say the al pastor with the grilled pineapple was a favorite. Had I not had several other cocktails already that evening, I might have opted for their $3 whisky shot of the day, but instead we got 7 oz. mini Miller High Life's for $1! Very fun. Great spot in the heart of Wicker Park, and a place I will definitely return to for late-night eats and cheap beers next time I find myself in Chicago.
Very tasty food! I don't think I've tried better tacos than here. The only thing I didn't like is super loud music (you have to scream to be heard) and cash only deal. Otherwise highly recommended!
I really like their Walking Tacos. Always crowded, but they are quite fast and efficient. Also love the Pork Belly taco too, very flavorful, great margarita.

Nice vibe, nice service, nice tacos. We had the Pastor, Papas con Rajas, and Pollo Pibil tacos. All were solid. I liked the Pastor best and while I did really like the pickled onions in the Pollo Pibil taco, the meat was pretty dry and the overall flavor lacking a bit. I have been spoiled on some excellent Puerco Pibil (a.k.a. Cochinita pibil) so maybe I was expecting too much when I saw Pibil as a taco option. It's a cool place with a cool staff. I'll be back.

Popped in to grab some drinks and tacos while waiting for Violet Hour to open. We were able to easily grab spots at the bar, which would have been unheard of in the warm months of April / May. Per ALWAYS, get the pork belly tacos (the pineapple on top delish). Cash only.

Love this place!    Everytime I come visit my sister we make a date to get big star. It's delicious.    Started with the chips and guacamole. . So tasty with the right amount of spice.  I got three tacos, the fish- which for the most part I wouldnt eat much of, but here I love it! The pork with the pinapple is my favorite! !and the Carne asada. All.of which were great!!    It's a little pricey. 3 to 4 dollars a taco.   The atmosphere is fun, it's loud and crowded but it's worth it. They have nice seating outside in the summer but I'm always here in the winter :/    Cash only!!

Phenomenal place!  Been going here since it basically opened, its a great date spot, great place to mingle and have some yummy food. all staff is great and its worth the wait because, yes, you do have to wait a little while to get seated, but go to the bar and have a drink while you wait, if you ask me, the food tastes so much better if you sit at the bar lol..... P.s. Don't you ever leave without trying one of the following drinks. Michelada, Pitcher of Bigstar margarita and/or TEXAS SERENADE... Its mind blowing!!

I sat at the bar on a Thursday night. The place was packed. I was informed it's usually like that. I got a pitcher of margaritas to split with 1 other taco lover. The bartender that was helping us seemed like a no bullsh*t kind of person, which I can appreciate but the eye rolling was unnecessary. I ordered the pastor, papas con rajas and the pescado. All were very good. I can see why the papas is ranked one of the best in the city. It's cash only and there's an ATM. Price point is good and they have some good whiskey specials. This is a party place. You go for drinks and shove some food in your mouth at the same time but I wouldn't recommend it for a nice dinner.

Finally had a chance to experience Big Star.  Stopped in on a Sunday night and waited about 20 minutes for a seat.  While waiting, I sipped on the Big Star Margarita. It wasn't bad but nothing to write home about.  We ordered the queso fundido and chips and guacamole for an appetizer.  The queso fundido was too thick and hard to scoop as it was stuck to the dish it was served in.   The guacamole was pretty flavorful but I wasn't a fan of the chips as they were warm but too many of them were soggy.  The carne asada and pescado tacos were decent.  The hostess, bartender and waitress were all very friendly and prompt, but this service does not justify waiting any more than 5 minutes for a seat to eat "meh" tacos.
Great tacos. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Be advised, Wicker Park area so parking is a challenge.

The tacos were very tasty especially the fish tacos.  Very fun atmosphere even though it was crowded and the wait was a bit long.  I'm looking forward to sitting outside next summer and sampling more of their menu.

Cool fun vibe on patio.  Food is good however without the patio is close to average Mexican you can get at other places in area. Staff is nice however they are not remotely urgent in taking order or visiting table once order has been placed.

I am a big fan of tacos and I must say this place is right around average for the food. Started off with the chips and salsa, and got 3 tacos for my main meal. The taco al pastor was tasty and was the best taco of them all in my opinion. Next I got the fish taco which was decent as well as the carne asada. The tacos overall were tasty and a good size but being so used to cheap, amazing tacos I wasn't all that impressed. However, I am a big fan of the overall atmosphere of the place as it is a really vibrant/fun place to be. On a nice sunny day make sure to grab a seat on the outside patio and it'll be a blast. I've also been here at night inside the bar area and it was a lot of fun. Drank a couple of old fashioned and I must say it was just fairly average. But once again had a lot of fun, great people and overall fun atmosphere. Come here to enjoy the company of your friends and just average,slightly pricey food/drinks. PS: It's cash only!!!

Finally made it to Big Star! ...on a Tuesday night in November. And there was still a wait. Not a long wait, mind you, but this place was hopping. We waited at the bar (with seats), not even long enough to finish a margarita when our table opened up. After trying the food, I'd wait that long or even a little while longer, but I would not wait an hour or two+ for these tacos... They're good and all, but come on now.  We started with some chips and salsa (they have two kinds at each table) - fresh, crispy, hot tortilla chips. Real good, especially with the margarita.  Food came out pretty quick, and we ordered a variety of tacos - he had the pork and chicken, I ordered the 'walking taco' (served in fritos bag), the fish, and chicken tacos. Everything tasted fresh and delicious - I liked the fish taco the best.  Fun place, great food, nice big patio for warm weather, but be prepared to wait - even in the winter, on a weeknight!

Ok first ill say the food is great! Tacos are well-seasoned and delicious. However, service sucks, the place is pretentious, cash only probably limits the amount people and tiny draft beers are ridiculous. The servers act like they are genuinely annoyed that you exist as a person, let alone would have the gall to try to come get some food at their establishment. If you think you are too cool to work at a restaurant then get another job! The food stands on its own and the beer selection is great, so they should just drop the wicker park charade and just serve up some good food and plentiful beer.

I was 8  months pregnant when I was at this establishment. I was with a group inside, dined at a table, and then walked outside later bc I was too hot and not sure if I was returning back in. As I decided to just go back in to use the restroom (as any pregnant person knows you have to urinate every 20 seconds), the bouncer would not lot let me back in. I was clearly PREGNANT. Perhaps about to deliver a baby while he was standing there being a d*ck. Were these bouncers raised in a barn? As I sat there arguing for 15 min, trying not to have pee trickle down on his feet, the waitress that had been serving me, spotted me and let me back in. As for the bouncer, what is wrong with people? You need to have some general compassion for human beings. I will never return. Your bouncers need to be schooled on how it feels to be pregnant, maybe have them hold their pee for 16+ hours straight

Taco al Pastor - You can really taste the pineapple, and the pork is a better quality than most, with strips of pork with more substance than what I have typically found in other such tacos with shredded pork. This is my favorite type of taco and I give this high marks.  Taco de Chorizo Verde - I almost didn't get this, but my wife suggested that I ask if they make their own chorizo. They do, and it shows. This is not the typical chorizo taco with the signature electric, red/orange grease running down your wrist. It is very flavorful, less greasy, and perhaps seasoned a bit more subtlety than usual. It was very good plain and also good with the tomatillo salsa on the table. While on that subject, the red salsa on the table had a distinct chili powder flavor reminiscent of what I found in New Mexico many years ago. I love chorizo, Mexican and Spanish (the latter being my preference), and this version was a little bit off the beaten path, in a good way.  Taco de Panza - I wanted to like this more because I love pork belly. Maybe I didn't love it because I really loved the al pastor and chorizo.
