There was  nothing wrong with this whatsoever, but this was third place for me.   Good guacamole with a strong lime component. Small beer selection on tap. LOTS of whiskey to choose from. Not horribly crowded, but I came on a Sunday, mid-afternoon. Friendly staff. Could not call ahead. The phone rings and when it picks up it asks you to enter your number. Huh? Typical Wicker Park crowd. Loud old school rock was blaring, which was funny as I assume that the 25-35 year olds had no clue what they were listening to. I was probably the only one there who could sing the chorus to Sunshine of Your Love.  Cash only. Well, I'm a small business owner. Can't blame them. Run a business and pay those fees yourself and you'll understand.  By the way, Paul Kahan of Blackbird/avec/The Publican fame is the Executive Chef. That, standing alone, is a reason to come.  Much better than what one would expect in gentrified, post-hipster Wicker Park. Is it pure, old school Mexican? No. Is it a nice, laid back place, with very good tacos that warrant making a special trip to Wicker Park? Yes. This place gets written up as one of the better in the City and I couldn't wrap my head around there being top notch tacos in Wicker Park, but I'm beginning to believe.  I'll be back to try other tacos, but I still want the chorizo and al pastor again and again. What does that tell you?

Big Star is A-OK.  I would go back, mainly for the walk up taco stand at 2:00 in the morning.  The fish taco is delicious but in general, this place is overpriced.  Drinks are just okay, stingy on the tequila.  Service was slow but not too painful to where I wouldn't come back.   Go for the patio on a sunny day, it's a decent place to enjoy with a friend!! But expect average drinks and slightly overpriced food.  They are still CASH ONLY so come prepared!  food: 4/5 drinks: 3/5 service: 3/5  so if I could give them 3.5 stars I would!

Delicious food.  Fantastic drinks.  And perpetually crowded. If you can get a seat outside on a beautiful day, welcome to heaven.  But doing so is nearly impossible.  The inside is nice, though very loud.  Best bet is to pony up to the bar. Shockingly good:  The guacamole.  I say shockingly good because places like this tend to cheap out on the guac because, well, they can.  You come to a taco place you're probably ordering the guac no matter what, so restaurants just serve you some cheap stuff.  Not here my friends.  Delicious and fresh. I've never had a bad taco here either, though my favorite is the chicken one.  Sounds boring, I know, but very delicious. 313/365

OVER. RATED. Yeah, I said it. Had the pescado and steak tacos here last weekend. Pescado was alright, but on the small side. Steak was simply unimpressive. And at $3-4 bucks apiece, it's not worth the hype. Especially considering the noise levels and crowded space. If you want delicious tacos for the price in Wicker Park AND be able to use your credit card, Antique Taco is the spot for you.
cash only, no rice and beans, and no free chips, but reaaaaaallly good food and drinks!!!

After three years in Wicker Park, Big Star is still one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago. It's a great place to bring new people from out of town because the food is consistent and delicious. Pork belly tacos are fire. Don't feel like waiting the 20 hours you'll need to wait for a table, post up along the bar. Bring cash.

I love this place! Their fish taco is the best I've had by far. The  staffs are very accommodating, but expect to wait because this place gets packed.  It can be a Kid-friendly, but it's best if you get a babysitter instead. I'm just saying, the atmosphere is loud and crazy in a good way, of course!

We ate outside which was the best! The patio and atmosphere are so fun. I thought the food was good, I wished they had a bigger menu and more guacamole/salsa options, but what they do have is really tasty.

Food was great, I had the Fish tacos. The service was superb and very quick. I ordered and extra taco and turned around and it was right there. The only knock is that they are cash only.  There is also great people watching. I went on a Friday night and there were tons of people.

Great for lunch. Had the  talapia  taco  which was  So So grilled would have be better than fried ,    the cerezho  taco was  probably the best I ever had  and I also had the Chicken  one  which was very good  , my son had another on  with the pork shoulder and pineapple   he said it was great ,  we sat at the bar  and the severs were great  I highly recommend this place if your in the area .

This place lives up to the hype. I'm a vegetarian, and this still has two solid vegetarian options: the papas con rajas (potato) and the walking taco. The guacamole is pretty good, but definitely has a strong lime flavor, so it depends on what you like. The horchata is also solid.  I don't often have the patience to wait for a table for dinner, so I will often either pick up or go for lunch. The newly opened patio and redesigned pickup windows are great additions.  Be forewarned - it's cash only. Slightly annoying but you just have to plan for it.
Oh baby, these tacos are delicious. I ESPECIALLY recommend the corn taco and the fried fish taco.  The margaritas are super strong and delicious. CASH ONLY.

Maybe I'm missing something but I can't figure out how this terrible place is so highly ranked as a "Mexican" place. Living in Canada I'm used to horrible fake Mexican and always try to seek out something decent when I'm in the states. Even the shit that passes for Mexican in Canada is good compared this waste of a storefront. Highly disappointed in this town for thinking this is good food.

Big Star is found in the heart of Wicker Park.  Seating is outside and decor is laid back and creative. Parking is free on Damon.  First come first served seating and cash only! I came with three friends and we waited an hour and a half until we were seated.  I ordered the Taco de Pollo (chicken taco), Taco al Pastor (pork taco) and Ensalada de Big Star (salad) as well as trying Queso Fundido (multiple cheese quesadilla). I enjoyed my meal, but wasn't blown away to the point where I would come running back.  Tables are really close together, so when this place is packed it almost feels claustrophobic. Okay food with a ridiculously long wait.

Im only giving this place two stars because the food was really good.  The service- THE WORST!  My waiter was so arrogant.  Its like he was too cool to be waiting on me.  PLEASE.  First it too FOREVER to get a table, then we sat and waited literally 15min for someone to even take our drink order.  I wish I knew the name of the guy who waited on us.  He was such an asshole & because of him- I will NEVER go back.

The pork belly tacos, fish tacos, pastor tacos and mushroom tostada are out of this World!!! I will give them 10 stars if that was possible!!! Yes, it's cash only, and yes, sometimes the service isn't very good but on their favor, this place is always packed...

I'm from Texas so...I imagine it's probably a smidge harder to impress me with tacos and a Texas themed place in Chicago. My only problem was the cash only thing. Hello...that's important. I wasnt impressed at all by the pork taco thing but my drink was good (I dunno how you can get a mezcal neat wrong). The atmosphere was cool and the waitress was super sweet. We made a food stop here before we went over t0 the Violet Hour. Not super impressed but it wasnt bad. Its just trendy. It is what it is...

Came on a rainy day after the Chicago Marathon.  The place was inviting, the bartender was attentive and nice.  We enjoyed 4 or 5 different tacos none of which were amazing.  I think its a cool place for a stop by for a drink but I wouldnt go out of my way to eat here.

Just ok. Don't believe the hype here, as much as it's a great location with a fun lively vibe that is where my love for this joint ends.  The food is good but being a Mexican American I know good tacos, I make good tacos.   I think the problem is that many people have not experienced amazing tacos so when a place like this comes around people flock, different flavors, decent drinks and great presentation go along way.  I can't knock it totally. Big star found a great niche in a trendy hood but for people in search of authentic amazing tacos, you need to look elsewhere, like 18th street or little village is your more adventurous :)

We were headed to Las Vegas and I managed to twist Sharif Productions's arm to stop in Chicago for at least ONE hour on this God forsaken journey to stretch our legs, eat some good food and drink some good coffee.  It was a miracle that he obliged so, out of fear that this sudden endorsement of fun would take a turn, I hurriedly texted my new friend Richard Cole for some restaurant suggestions. --Richard curates shows with "Get Off the Couch Presents" and we met when he brought me into town with Jeff Taylor for a show at Reggie's Joint.  I remember that show well because Richard and his gf Becky were so cool, the whole room was filled with their friends and musicians who were also cool, and everyone was just really polite and supportive of the whole evening.  The guys in Jeff Taylor's band met a couple of sweet and beautiful girls, so we all pulled up chairs at their table.  Unfortunately the aforementioned sweet girls were also really loud talkers and everybody in the room kinda hated them for pulling focus while the other bands played.  I tried to slowly inch my chair away from the table, but it was a little late for that.  We were already associated with these girls and officially on the shit list of most people in the club.  (Sorry about that Richard!  We had no idea.)  -- Richard is sort of a man about town and, despite his British roots, I trust his taste in good food.  He highly recommended "Big Star" for lunch and when our bass player Chris Holm heard the word "Mexican," he clapped his hands, did three jumping jacks in the van, and we set our digital sails for Wicker Park.   The first thing we ordered when we sat down was the guacamole and I will tell you with confidence that it is the BEST guacamole I've ever had.  Chris ordered the chorizo taco and the mushroom tostada.  He enjoyed them both, but the taco was a lot more exciting for his Norwegian taste buds.  Sharif Productions ordered the mushroom tostada and the Al Pastor taco, but, similar to Chris, he feels the tacos are a much stronger choice.  I ordered the mushroom tostada with a side of beans and rice and loved it. This place has indoor/outdoor seating, the aesthetic is on point, the food is great, and the staff is quick and polite.  We were in and out super fast, which is good when you have a Tour Mangaer that feels like you "don't have time" to do A-N-Y-T-H-I-N-G, so there's really no reason NOT to come eat at Big Star.  Just remember to get the GUACOMOLE! ~Herremannen

There are some delicious tacos at this joint.  Our group got some tacos at their take out stand they have next to the main restaurant. Big Star has some nice outdoor seating. It is a great place to eat and hang out on a beautiful late night in Chicago. As for the food, we got some some fish and pastor tacos. Both were really good but I liked the fish taco a little bit better. The tacos are filling; two to three tacos were more than enough to fill us up. If you are looking for a Mexican or Tex-Mex restaurant, Big Star is not the place you want to go. Personally, I would classify Big Star as American or Mexican-American, which is closer to but different from Tex-Mex cuisine. As many others have pointed out, it is cash only. For the price, you get a decent number of tacos. Overall, don't go in with super high expectations and you will have a taste of some delicious tacos.

Nothing too much to rave about here. Much talked about, certainly over-hyped, taco place in Wicker Park. Split 2 tacos with a friend, the al pastor and the crispy pork. Both were just okay with basically the same sweet sauce making them almost indistinguishable from each other.  Guacamole was good, needed salted, over priced at $8.00. $1 mini bottles of Miller Highlife greatly enjoyed. Big restaurant and bar, lots of outdoor seating, take out window. It's a cool place, I totally see why people go here but it's not Mexican food to brag about. It's a cool place in Wicker Park, not a good taqueria. I want good, authentic tacos and knowing how many great little restaurants are out there in Chicago I feel like bit of a sell out for even trying this place. Go for the atmosphere and to day drink, not for authentic Mexican.

I rarely feel the need to express online my dissatisfaction with a restaurant because I understand the business is a tough one...BUT it's Monday night and i am still upset  about my visit to Big Star in Wicker Park over the weekend. I was extremely underwhelmed. Somebody told me that they had awesome, authentic reasonably priced tacos which being from Los Angeles made me excited. I moved to Chicago a year ago and have been on a hunt for awesome Mexican. Unfortunately Big Star was a Big flop for me. Tacos are around 3-4 dollars which is fine until one of our tacos came in a Frito lay bag which was a sad attempt at being original. It looked like something you pick out of the trash and notice a homeless person threw up in it. It tasted so mediocre and was not appetizing at all. The taco sizes were way to small and it immediately makes you hate that you paid 3 dollars for it and how dumb you look when you see how tiny these things are. ALSO, I was royally insulted when I saw they charge $37 dollars for a "pitcher" of margarita. Mind you half of it was ice and we barely got 4 glasses out of it. Unless that was Anejo Tequila which I know it wasn't. there is no reason a margarita pitcher needs to be nearing $40 dollars. It was insulting, over-priced and the fact that they are only cash just adds to the annoyance of this "taco joint"  I will not be revisiting this establishment.  3 words -- overrated, unoriginal, overpriced  I hope this helps anyone who is on a search for REAL TEX MEX.

We waited for about 20 minutes for a 2 top on a Saturday night which wasn't bad. Ordered drinks and I had the pollo tacos (soooo good I'll dream about it for the rest my life) and one vegetarian potato which was way too spicy IMO.  My husband had the el pastor and the pork belly one (forget the name) he loved them both.

The Taco De Chorizo Verde is outstanding as is the bourbon selection. Prices are very reasonable though the portions are small. The guacamole is priced like a table appetizer but the portion is for one. The service is solid. Cash only.

How on earth could this have fewer than a 4+ star average??? One of my favorite places in Chicago--only for the take-out taco window and picnic tables, though. The main part is too loud. Just my taste. DELICIOUS.

This is one of my favorite spots in the city. They'd get 5 stars if it wasn't for the fact that they don't take credit cards. It's 2014, stop trying to dodge paying taxes and start making it convenient for your customers.  Other than that, great food and a great atmosphere

Good tacos, awesome patio, decent beer. It's a busy spot, and you wait a while for a table, but it's worth the wait. On a nice day it's awesome to get a beer and sit outside. It's a bit loud from the street noise, but you hardly notice.

Tacos are pretty good. But the staff feel a little snobby. Also they only take cash. I think it's pretty cheap of a company that size to make me pay a $7 ATM fee instead of just taking cards. Basically they don't want to pay credit card fees....

These were good tacos, but I've had good tacos a lot of places. The atmosphere and energy were fun. But the service was pretty slow, he forgot to take our order for quite a while. Everything was good, but its not a place I'd seek out again unless we just happened to be walking down its street and hungry.

I'm not much of a fan of mexican food or tacos, but this place had some of the best tacos I've ever had. A little tricky if you are gluten free or have food allergies, but even ordering items without xyz in the tacos, they were still tasty and good. Nice place to chill with friends and order tacos throughout the night. Fun bar and outdoor area. Small bathroom for the size and popularity of the place. Easy to get to off the l line. Cash only spot.

Great good/atmosphere but service that even makes industry employees cringe. (Sad sigh). Im all about building relationships with fellow employees, but maybe not when your bar is lined with patrons.  Love, Disgruntled Chicagoan who brought out of state family here.

So many fabulous taco places in Chicago, and Big Star falls into my top 10 for sure. Every single taco is better than the next. Amazing guac and chips too, and accompanied by great salsa. I have to say my favorite taco is the pork belly, but the Tilapia follows a close second. Love their 5 dollar shots of whiskey too. If you're brave try the bacon wrapped hot dog, you will leave stuffed. Great patio, only downfall is it's always packed and often a long wait. I have a thing about places that don't take reservations....annoying. Other than that, you must GO. Just be prepared to wait, and don't be in a hurry, service is not the fastest here. Although tacos come out quick and fast once ordered.

Big Star is the Grand Poobah of taco joints. The energy and atmosphere is amazing. It is quite loud but I guess that is what you want in a popular lively place. The food is equally as good. The taco menu is quite expansive and the tacos have such exquisite flavors. Tacos Al Pastor is an automatic one as the pineapple seems to work well with the spicier more defined flavors. My other selections included the potato tacos and the Bean Charro Tacos....All excellent and satisfying without leaving me feel full. Overall great food great environment that wont break the bank. Just remember its cash ONLY!

All I really have to say is: Take your taco crave to Pilsen!  To elaborate, four of us came for lunch on a Monday afternoon. Each person should have 3-4 tacos to be filling. We tried the taco de pollo (roasted chicken leg), taco de panza (braised pork belly), taco de papas con rajas (potatoes), taco de pescado (tilapia), and taco de chorizo verde (pork sausage). If I must choose a favorite from the batch, it would be the braised pork belly. The flavor was there but I was really disappointed with the texture. The meat was dry and barely any fat found on there. When I order pork belly, I demand to see some slight fat clinging to the lean meat!  Will I return? Doubtful.

The first time I had Big Star tacos was a late-night excursion about two years ago and it was not a good experience. I think it was mostly just bad luck - I ordered a chicken taco and got a filling that was more fat and gristle than meat. I had taken a bus to Chicago from Madison after work and hadn't eaten in like, ten hours, so starting off with a mouthful of skin (or whatever it was) put me off Big Star real quick. Fast forward to last weekend where I had both a chicken and pork taco from Big Star catered in at a party. Much better the second time around. They aren't the best tacos I've ever had, but they were pretty tasty. I don't think I'd object to future Big Star trips, but it's not anything I'd particularly look forward to, either.

Came for some quick tacos. I had al pastor and the fish (so #$#$# good). The tacos are straight up delicious, but I can't give five stars because of the price per taco. I still feel like I can get something just as good for half the price.
Strike a star for cash only! The drinks flow, servers are wonderful. I miss the tongue tacos though. Always a joy to sit outside on a nice Chicago day.

For good times and good eats, big star is a highly recommended spot in wicker park. Don't go if you're looking for a low key night ... The margaritas won't allow for that, but they'll give you a kick that's your money's worth. Fish tacos are my favorite. I can't stop at just one serving. The only thing downside of big star is that it's cash only which is a little inconvenient. Otherwise, grab friends and sit in the big booths along the left side for a good time.

I wanted to give 3.5 stars...I really did...but decided to round down because I didn't really dig their chips and this is a tex mex spot so you sort of have to have awesome chips in my book and because the chorizo was not the red chorizo sausage like I am used to either and lastly because for $8 we really should get more guac than that...I know, I know, avocados are expensive, but if just chips and salsa you charge $3 for (which is another thing I think should just come with a tex mex experience without having to pay extra for it...) for $5 for guac, I would have liked a little more guac love.  But this is a fun spot to grab some tacos for sure, and their queso fundido was super tasty--nothing quite like melted cheese and poblano and some pretty tasty fresh tortillas to brighten up my day. The taco de panza (aka pork belly) was also pretty tasty too, and the boys at the table were fans of the fish taco too and the al pastro with that pineapple salsa topping was also a table fav. Combining this with outdoor seating and if you are in a rush they had their food truck up and running outside too, so clearly this place knows how to operate a business. But their margaritas were a little pricey for what they were and we had to track down our server quite a bit too, but in general, we had a good time here, and it was a happy space :-)

Want to start by stating that I'm Mexican and very picky about my Mexican food. Said this, this place has completely amazed me. It's a simple place with a simple menu but all the items are amazing. I was hesitant to eat here as I live in San Diego, which we should have amazing mexican food but we do not. So to go to the Midwest to a Mexican restaurant was almost scary! But my Asian friend (I know funny! Ah?) said they were the best and she was not  kidding. !!! We went there on Sunday night for a late night snack and tried the tacos de papa con Rajas, chiles toreados and tacos al pastor... And they were all fabulous. So fabulous I had to go there again the very next day before catching my plane back to San Diego. The second time I tried the queso fundido con Rajas and chorizo. The tostada con calabacitas and they were to die for. Great job with this place! I wish we had a place like this in San Diego.  Oh and the service was outstanding both visits. Definitely a place I will go back next time I'm in Chicago. And thank you for not compromising with the recipes to appeal other cultures! I'm so happy that the flavors a very true to what they are supposed to be. I

My, my. It looks like they've expanded. Let's hope the quality of the food hasn't...  Hmm, this meat on my taco isn't even room temperature. What's up with that. These sauces are a tad crumbly too. This can't be good. Ah, but the beer. The pretty people. The friendly bartenders. The awesome patio. Yes, YES! This is why Big Star is my first stop every time I drop by Chicago. But alas, after some years and tasting hundreds of tacos around the country, my favorite Tex Mex joint has become yet another average staple. Not that it'll keep me from returning. I shall return. I just wish my meats were at least a little hot when it comes out. Is that too much to ask?

Good food, good environment, solid margaritas. I got the pescado taco, and the panza (pork belly one). The pork one was very good and the fish one was solid. We did have to wait a REALLY long time, like almost 2 hours, but it was all groovy because we weren't in a rush and checked out some trendy wicker park bars.

Very belated review for their amazing catering service. Margaret, the catering coordinator, was spectacular during the catering planning for our wedding in 2013. I know that there are a lot of people with strong opinions about wedding food and how it should be done, but frankly I'm not that person. We like their tacos. They would deliver them to the venue. That sealed the deal for me.  But Margaret blew all of my expectations out of the water! First, before we even booked our wedding or Big Star tacos, Margaret was already paving the way for us. She had traveled to the venue to convince the somewhat uptight event planner that Big Star was a respectable-enough taco joint for this place. Some other bride had gone to the mat for them and strong armed our venue into allowing the tacos months before we got there. We all won for that, so thank you, May 2013 bride.  After securing service at the venue and our business, Margaret really rocked that "coordinator" label and spoke with literally everyone involved in the planning to make sure they had what they needed. Because it's a wedding and why should anything be easy, that meant she spoke to the table rental people, linen people, venue people, server people, and my mother-in-law who wanted to help with decorations. The woman rang my mother-in-law to figure out where she could put her table decorations. There's no way she's being paid enough for this kind of nonsense, but she was so cheerful and helpful, I have to think she enjoys it. I was called exactly once to make sure I was ok with everything. I immediately high fived myself for choosing such a great caterer.  The food was amazing - so many compliments (which everyone is going to do at a wedding anyway, but my photographer is a pal and pulls no punches, in addition to having been to hundreds of weddings, and she was floored by how good everything was). The servers they brought were kind and helpful. Everything was fresh and hot. The whole room smelled like guacamole. I've never been happier. (Also, wedding day. Wedding day + guacamole is about as good as life gets.) The restaurant is always fun, always a good time. But you already knew that. Their catering service, and Margaret in particular, really blew me away. Big Star is one of like two things that went well in wedding planning, and it really helped my sanity for the whole event.
Big Star has excellent tacos, service, and beer. The price is decent for a Chicago spot, and the atmosphere is cozy. Also, really great place to try for to-go orders with a walk around Wicker Park.

I wanted to see what all the hype was about so I decided to check it out. Right off the bat, I was impressed with the setup of the restaurant. They have an outdoor and indoor eating area. The menu is short and sweet. I tried the AL pastor and chorizo taco. The tacos came out quick but it didn't seem like they took the time to make them. Chorizo taco was too salty and packed with too much flavor. AL pastor was overpowered with the pineapple. I would only go to big star if I was drunk or to get drunk.

Food: 4.5/5 Love their guac and tacos, queso not so much. Drinks are great too. Their whiskey sours are excellent and old fashioned are a bit too strong. Margaritas are good too. Service: 3/5 This is where they run into trouble. The wait is super long and their hostesses can't keep things straight. Wait staff is alright, they rarely check on you and your food. I usually try to get a spot at the bar because their bartenders are pretty awesome and make up for the lack of service in the overall dining area.  Atmosphere: 4/5 Nothing fancy, your cozy Mexican join to eat some tacos and drink some whiskey.  Overall: 4/5 Minus one star for their service, but otherwise this place is dear to my heart.

Ever wanted to go to a taco place and have your order delivered incorrectly and be kicked off the patio mid meal? Well you've found the right place!  We showed up, ordered food, and waited about 45 minutes for tacos. The food came out and this guy came up and informed us that the patio is closing in 10 minutes. Even though we just got our food. He can back 10 minutes later and told us we had to go inside. We asked if there was a table and he said ask the hostess. So we were just supposed to carry our food and drinks around in our arms hoping there was a table.  Food wasn't great and that guy with the handlebar mustache is the worst. Turns out their rating and their name are the same. Just one "Big Star."

I don't get the hype.  I was told when I moved here that this place was the bee's knees and was disappointed.  The tacos were decent, but over priced for what you get and so were the drinks.  I can think of a multitude of places that are better for the buck.

ABSOLUTELY PHENOMENAL.  I am from Texas and have HIGH standards for Mexican. I was blown away by this place. Wherever you are, this is worth the drive or train ride to get here. And if theres a wait... WAIT. The vibe is incredible: Hipster, Beachy Mexican The food is insane: Chips & Guacamole (thick, crunchy chips with flavorful guacamole), The Walking Taco (goofiest menu item I've ever had- Bag of Frito Lays with queso, guac, and fixins), Mushroom Torta (chunky, incredibly flavorful mushrooms- a must order), Fish Taco (fresh, crunchy, crisp- would order 65 more times, at least) I cannot wait to go back. Please go, I'm telling you. Thanks for the rememberable and happy experience Big Star. Y'all rock!

My husband brought us here on our first date and we gladly go back any chance we get. We even had them deliver a "build your own taco" bar for late night snacks at our wedding! Loves: absolutely cannot go wrong with the pork belly tacos. Also a huge fan of the walking taco and pork shoulder. The guac. Queso fundido. Atmosphere - great, casual place to hang out. Outdoor patio space is awesome, cheap. Dislikes: The margarita is average, cash only, and it can be a super long wait if you go at somewhat of a popular time. Not necessarily a good choice for a larger group.

Amazing! Tex mex, good whiskey and Violet Hour across the street. Cozy outdoor seating, always seems to be open, and always delicious! A must go for those stopping through and want a taste of good Chicago street food.

I have been here a couple of times so I think it's time for an official review. Big Star is very spacious inside and our and has the traditional feel of a hipster establishment, but with the style of a modern restaurant/bar.  The pork shoulder and belly tacos are obviously delicious and flavorful, but don't skip past the fish tacos. You get a golden deep fried piece of fish that's not to greasy or flaky. The beer selection is good and has a lot of craft beer options. I would like to see a section where they have  speciality original cocktails as I think it would be a huge hit in the hot summer months. However, I understand that would probably not fit into their image so I should probably not hold my breath. Good original tacos and quality beers. You can't go wrong with that.

Amazon food for cheaper then it probably should cost. Drinks are awesome, atmosphere is nice yet laid back. I wish they had more seating though! At the bar or outside, I always am waiting at least 20min before I can even enter the place (drinks etc) but it's worth it!

This is a great place to talk about where you should talk about where you are going next.  The rundown: Hostess: dumb as hell. No clue what's going on inside the place. Plus side- she can work an iPad just like my 3yr old niece. Worst part- she farted on me, pretty sure that's true.  Door guy:  ink poisoning, really bad case. Arms are bigger than my head- take that how you please.  No farts smelt.  Bartenders:  awesome actually and really good about recognizing  people in the bar. Probably the best service crew in the place, not sure about bus boys.  Wait Staff-  haha. Okkkk.  Food:  good, solid food. That and the bartenders got this up from a negative 5 to a solid 1 start.   They should rename the place as "big 1 star on yelp".

Very poor service at the bar last night. 20 minutes before I was even acknowledged. Three blond young ladies sat down next to me and got water and drinks immediately. I had to ask for water and had to sit w an empty glass for another long while. We got up and walked out. It was almost like they didn't want my business. Sad because I heard they have the best tacos in Chicago. In all my years in the industry I would say Very Poor attitudes at the bar. Maybe more staff would help and teach bartenders about since of urgency.

My husband and I drive an hour for these tacos. The al pastor taco is the best taco I've ever had. We get eight al pastor tacos and an order of the guacamole, and it's our favorite date night. Be prepared to wait a while for a table!

A really really great late night hang out spot in Wicker Park to eat. You're just not going to find better food this late at night -- at least you won't find better food w/out the risk of getting hepatitis B. Big star does tacos really well. Everything just has a little extra something that makes it special...the pastor comes with little chunks of fresh pineapple to give it that gourmet/balanced touch that everyone who's anyone is looking for.  The sleeper hits though are the queso fundido and the VEGETARIAN tostadas. Queso fundido is usually melted cheese over grilled peppers (rajas) but Big Star adds chorizo (choriqueso i suppose) to it. Eaten with some warm tortillas, this is late night comfort food at its best. The veggie tostadas are fantastic and I actually PREFER them to the meat tacos because they're really flavorful and fresh. Had the steamed carrot tostada w/ the peanut sauce as well as the summer squash one. Never looked back. Enjoy. Only problem is that it's cash only, but there's an ATM inside.

This rating is really a 3.5 stars.  The tacos are cheap (cash only) and delicious, but the wait is often ridiculously long. Came here with a big group so we tried most of the taco varieties, my favorite was the Tacos de Panza (pork belly).   I've come here a few times prior trying to get in and the wait was too long so we just opted to come back another time.   Final verdict: good tacos, cheap prices, worth trying...but not worth waiting a long time to try. Go during slow hours!

If you love tacos, and I do, Big Star is a must! We ventured over at 2am after a night of libations and got a variety of delicious tacos to share among the group. All were amazing and I plan on going back in the daytime ;)  But remember, cash only!

The fish tacos. So delicious. The guac and chips aren't too bad either. I just wish some of this stuff wasn't so expensive. This place is usually pretty crowded and you might have to stand and eat. It's been packed every time I've been there during the afternoon.

I like tacos, I like whisky, and I like Big Star.....just not on the weekend.  This cash only establishment has definitely carved out its niche in the neighborhood. The food is reasonably priced and they are one of the few places that offers a true brisket taco. They have a $3 whicsy shot that changes daily and that alone makes this place legit. The only problem I have with this place is that it turns into Lincoln Park west on the weekends, the crowd just sucks. After Pontiac closed down, I had heard that the owners were going to try to keep a similar appeal and similar crowd...well they failed.  But - the place is always packed, and being as it is cash only I'm sure the owners are raking in the $$$ and don't really give a shit about the "old crowd"; can't say I blame them. If douchebags and dickheads get on your nerves, enjoy Big Star during the week and avoid on the weekend. 5 stars for food and service, 3 stars for crowd and ambiance.

Besides a line without reservations making it shorter, its worth the wait. Or get there early. I miss the old Pontiac but I tell ya, these tacos F'ing ROCK!!!!!!! Margaritas like no other, and their pitchers of them are nothing to mess with... joking, def mess with them....so good. Bring friends, order lots. This place is a keeper.

Visiting Chicago, this place came highly recommended.  Former gas station turn to taco bar? What is there not to love.  Arriving at this place, there was a line to get in, and the bar scene was bustling.  After about 30 mins, was able to get in.... To put our name on a list for a table.  So we stood by the bar while waiting for our table.  I can see the charm of this place, if you go there with a large group of friends to drink, (the drink prices were very nicely priced, pitchers of margaritas, tequila shots, etc) finally got our table after waiting another 20 mins and order fish, pork, and pork belly tacos.  Fish was overly cooked and tasteless, pork was dry and burnt, and pork belly tasted the better of the three, but too burnt and salty.  Order nachos with two different types of fresh home made salsa.  Now what do you think they means?? You guessed it, ketchup bottle salsa sitting at the table.  And it taste like.. Bottled salsa with tostitos.  If I knew better, I would've just ordered from the take out stand next to the bar and save my self the trouble. I can see the charm of this local place if you are a local but not my cup of tea and what I was looking for that night.  Bad food and horrible to make me wait twice.

The WORST service I've ever had in a restaurant. We left without eating. When they asked where were going and we told told them we were leaving because of being repeatedly ignored the (I assume) manager replied "no problem, we're busy anyway." I'm sure the food is good, but not worth being treated like they are doing you a favor to eventually serve you a $3 taco.

This place is a joke! Yes the food is good but the people or should I say blonde bartender who worked on Wed night was the rudest bartender I have ever dealt with. I was a bartender for quite sometime and I know it can be stressful but you work on tips so you should always  have a smile on your face and treat your customers with respect. When we walked in we happened to get 2 seats at the bar well we waited 20 minutes to get our first drink! She even served a guy who sat next to us after we seated. In the 20 minutes we waited to be asked what type of drink we would like we tried to get her attention but she "couldn't hear us" then when we ordered our food she forgot a taco and when we let her know we still did not receive it so we just ignored it. At the end of the night she rudely told me to "move my purse" which was on the bar in front of me when i did i also told my friend "god shes been a bitch all night" well surprise surprise she actually heard me i thought she "couldnt hear us" guess i was wrong to get to the story she had us escorted out. I will make sure to never come back here which is unfortunate because we would go there a lot! Hopefully the bartender realizes she needs a new career if she cant smile or treat her customers like humans!

The most overrated place in Chicago. I came to "Big Star" with high expectations but it was a big disappointment by far. The tacos were tasteless! Not authentic at all. And way over price for whatever you call that. Because it wasn't a taco.  If you don't believe this review go once and try any taco ....you'll be very disappointed.  To be honest for good tacos "Raymond's Tacos" is the best place to go.

On this update, I'm writing about the new bar staff.  Bar is quickly losing stars...the female bartenders are always bitchy and tend to ignore female clients.  I'm still a fan of the food, but starting to think the wait is not worth it.  I have eaten at the bar,  gone home, taken a shower and ready for bed when I am getting called for a table.  LOL.  I also constantly watch the guy at the door hand pick people to advance the line.  NOT COOL.

Big Star? More like Dark Star because I pray to it and see it in my dreams. Time is a flat circle. P.S. water here is top notch and if you can by the snooty hostess' you can get yourself a fairly priced Lone Star.  Though, there's a lot of people there classin' up the place.
Superb food, but you feel nickeled and dimed on the prices ($8 for chips & guac, $3 charge to refill limeade).

One of the more famous taco joints in Wicker Park and one of my more favorite places in all of Chicago. Tacos are amazing, you won't be disappointed with any of them. The only downside is that it's cash only and seating is sometimes a hassle since over half of it is outdoors (not sure how it works in rain or cold).
Blah. Tasteless and lacking in flavor overall.  Wasn't even good drunk food.

So good.  Tried about 1/2 the menu with our party of 5.  The tacos are out of this world.  The big booth was perfect to share the orders.  We had a extremely helpful waitress too offering suggestions and willing to take additional orders for more food as we made our way through the menu.   Just wish we had big enough stomachs to try more.  Will definitely be back.  Remember cash only!

The only reason I will not give them 5 is because sometimes the servers and the host staff can be complete a-holes. However the tacos, drinks and ambience make up for it. I just love their fresh guacamole and chips. But I love their Al Pastor tacos more than anything else on the menu. It's a great spot for people watching too.

The tacos were good. The location is easy to find. Close to the train station. Easy access for a tourist like me in Chicago. They have good selection of Mexican beer but the Mexican Coca Cola is a really good choice. I was expecting more flavor in my tacos. I choose to go to this place based on CNN review the best Mexican Tacos in US. Oh well, to be honest, I have tried better tacos in another places in US. Now, the tacos here are very good, I just had high expectations. Try the chorizo verde and tacos al pastor.

The atmosphere and food is usually amazing but I went last night (a Wednesday night) and the wait was almost 2 hours. So we finally get seated and order our food and it never comes. About an hour later, we flagged down our waitress and she tells us that our ticket was never put in........ It was out quick after that, but we were still charged full price. In my opinion our meals should have been free especially since we were never even checked on during that hour wait but at this point I was just ready to get out!

Oh shi!t.  You want to hear about Big Star - place is f*cking amazing.  Or at least it was.   Five years ago when it first opened up and just killed it.  But the $3 tecate and $3 tacos ran Wicker Park's stock sky-high into the air.  Credit big star for the gentrification of Wicker.  Place is (was?) f*cking awesome. But here's the problem.  This place turned over into a sh*tty bar which held its popularity pretty well, for a while.  But it replaced that awesome manager at the door (f*ck, I forget his name, but chill dude) who used to text you from his old iPhone when your reservation was ready with two weird chicks and an ipad. Big star blew up - and honestly it blew up because it really is a kickass place to grab tacos and cheap beers... and I don't think that'll ever go away. But here's the issue - this place kind of sucks now.  It's not the food, or the beer that made it suck.  I can head to 10 different restaurants in Pilsen and get cheap tacos and warm mexican beer.  It sucks because that awesome guy running the front door is no longer around, and instead you've got two girls with an ipad who can't look you in the eyes taking your reservation.  I drive 20 minutes to go here and get treated like I'm an asshole.  And it sucks because you've got too many weird ass middle aged men hanging out here, who used to feel out of place, but instead, once one of them infiltrated this fucking formerly beautiful establishment, the rest of them somehow swarmed. It sucks because I feel like I'm doing the waitresses a favor when I show up - not the other way around. It sucks because it lost its charm.  Which was this fucking beautifully cheap and chill bar in this semi-remote part of Chicago where I could bring my parents or go on a first date and not feel like I'm at Planet Hollywood.  So.  Big Star peaked and is on the way down.  Or maybe it's plateaued.  But my guess is that it turns into the Ed Debevic's of Wicker Park where we pop into 20 years down the road for some kickass porkbelly tacos and guac.  This place did well - but they got lazy.   Service went downhill and the good vibes there are dead.   Thanks for killing it for a while.  But you're not as good as you used to be.  I'll still be back.

Hipster central. get your raybans, jean shirt, fish tacos and enjoy a beautiful summer night. music and lights set the mood. fun place! Loved the pescado (fish taco) and al pastor. Queso Fundido was super good too, lil spicy but i love a good kick. the fish taco is definitely my fave. growing up in california, im always looking for a good fish taco and this pretty good. other tacos were good but not fabulous.  beware: cash only and lines get long. go early or be prepared to wait a long time. We got here around 7 and waited 1 hr. another time i got here around 5pm and only waited 15 minutes. one nice thing is that they text you when your table is ready so you can roam around wicker park, stay in your car or go to the bank to get cash all while waiting for your table! #getstuffdone. there also a lot of cafes within walking distance like La Colombe, Stan's Donut, cafe creme, mindys hot chocolate - at 0.3 miles, its the furthest away on Damen. found street parking right in front. most people walk or use the L so parking was never a problem for me. double up the chair for kids - no high chairs here. i got my kid a quesadilla which is not on the menu but they will make it no problem.

Cash-only taco joint with a patio that was bustling all day long.  Veg/potato tacos were excellent and I loved the fresh salsas at the table.  I love that you can get a fresh cocktail for about $8 or a cold beer in a car for around $3.  And the huge basket of chips for $2.75 is a bargain.  My waitress, on the other hand, seemed like she was high.  I don't really care about that but she was spacey and not exactly attentive.

The tacos at Big Star are fantastic! They have great options, and the food comes pretty quickly. I have eaten at Big Star multiple times and really enjoyed everything I ate. The workers also have no problem with your table ordering a second round of tacos. All of the tacos for the table are served on one plate, so be careful not to take a friends. The outdoor seating area is very nice. I would gladly eat at this restaurant with friends, visitors, or alone. They have got a big bar inside, which looks great, but I have yet to utilize. Keep in mind, it's cash only!

A 3 hour wait.... Kind of. We left after 2 hours. They texted us an hour later.  OK - it is a happening scene. But 3 hours is rediculous. Plus, they won't give you any clue how many are waiting. Are they looking for bribes? Were we not hot enough? Just be real and say "there are 10 groups ahead of you and the list isn't really moving".... I won't frequent places with duechebag policies.

I am so disappointed to have to give this place 2 stars. The atmosphere was great, my margarita was STRONG, and the tacos were fantastic. I ended up ordering more because I couldn't stop eating them. Our food and drinks arrived so quickly we almost didn't believe it was our order. With that being said, what TERRIBLE service. Our waitress took our order, then we watched her gossiping from across the room the rest of the night. She didn't bring us drinks, food, or check on us once. Another girl helped us a few times (after I kept flagging her down) and brought us the bill. When I asked who would receive our tip, she said everyone puts it into a pile and splits the tips evenly. Well that explains the terrible service. I hope they improve on this because I CRAVE those tacos, but it's not worth the long drive into the city to be ignored. *CASH ONLY* I did not see an ATM here, but several banks within walking distance.

I am from out of town. Visiting on business, could not help but notice all of the taco restaurants in the city. Did some quick searching for lunch one day and identified Big Star as our destination.  First clue. Arrived at 11:25. They open at 11:30. There was a line waiting to get in... In the rain.  Once inside, they have a simple and straightforward menu. I ordered one each of a pork, chicken and fish taco. The food was right out. Every bite was a different flavor, rich textures of spice, cooling sauces (queso fresco on the pork), vibrant colors.  Loved it! $25 for two (six tacos, two drinks) is a pretty reasonable price for a sublime lunch.

Not a fan. In fairness, I can't say that I was able to rate the food. But I can surely rate the service. Big F.  I had a group of 3 on Sunday night and immediately checked in. When I asked how long the wait was the hostess gave me the run around "I don't know", rather told that there were 3 groups ahead of us. 30 minutes roll by and all the groups were seated as we were the only ones left waiting at the entrance.  To my surprise I saw new groups of 3 and 4 seated ahead of us. When I asked why groups were immediately seated before us I received a blank stare and asked how much longer. They said we were still third in line. We left after 40 minutes.  The patio was rockin no doubt, but the service and experience is certainly lacking.

The only reason I will not give them 5 is because sometimes the servers and the host staff can be complete a-holes. However the tacos, drinks and ambience make up for it. I just love their fresh guacamole and chips. But I love their Al Pastor tacos more than anything else on the menu. It's a great spot for people watching too.

Overhyped  I typically try and avoid 3 star ratings but U feel pretty neutral about Big Star. After hearing  a lot of extremely amazing things about Big Star, so I was really excited to finally go!  The food was good but there was nothing magical about it that would warrant 5 stars for it. Aside from that, the service as pretty slow and the noise level was outrageous!! I think the noise almost ruined the rest of our experience because I had to yell for the person sitting next to me to had me. We eventually gave up trying to talk and sat in silence. (This was inside)  The menu is very small so beware!! Additionally, they do not accept credit cards... you know, because it is only 2014. They have an ATM in the restaurant but it was not my banks ATM so there was a surcharge for using it and my bank charged me too... Wahhh :( Luckily, we had no wait for a party of 5 but friends have told me the wait is usually pretty long, so I would not recommend waiting for a long time! It was not a horrible experience but I would also not recommend it!

Loved the tacos: al pastor and the fried tilapia especially. Pretty solid beer menu with their own brew collaboration with Revolution. Chips and guac were plentiful but the guacamole had tons of large chunks that were too big for any chip (and hard to break up). Service was pretty horrendous from not being greeted when putting our name on the list to a server who showed up once and was somewhat disinterested in our order. The place gets busy but the hype is only valid for the tacos and not much else.

By far some of the most delicious tacos I've had in the Chicagoland area. I like that they take typical cuts of meat (such as their chicken & el pastor) and add more of a creative spin to it. However, it is quite difficult to get a seat right away, as it is always packed. But my favorite thing to do is to order tacos at their side bar and eat them inside the park literally adjacent.  You must try their pork belly taco! Sooo worth the extra calories!! P

AMAZING  Taco are delicious and super cheap! This is a great spot to hang out; we always go there on Sundays because there are tons of festivals/yard sales/flea markets/antiques around!  Definitely a "YES"!

We went last night and it was my 3rd time here. Second time for food. This place does not disappoint. The wait can be rather long though, but you can fill up on some good drinks and Margaritas at the bar while you wait. Remember that the bar portion is cash only, but they do have an ATM inside if needed. Their Guacamole and chips is a great choice for an appetizer, and I tried the Papas (Potato) Taco, the Pollo (chicken) one and a Chorizo one. Our group's consensus was that the Chorizo taco is the best. It is simply delicious. I've had their Queso Fundito before too and I'd definitely recommend it. The serve the tacos as family style, so they will all come out on one large platter. The only reason I'm giving this place 4 stars is because of the wait. I think the host forgot to put our name in last night. She told us it would be an hour wait, but after almost 2 hours and seeing people who arrived after us being seated, we asked here when our table would be ready. At that point she seem flustered and just sat us. Regardless, their service is pretty on point. This place is definitely worth all the hype. I dont think I've ever seen this place not packed.

After a few years or so of hearing about this place, I finally made it! But I can't say it lives up to the hype. I was suprised to see that this place is basically a patio bar. It's loud and there's a wait. Oh, and it's cash only. Awesome. We were quoted an hour wait for a table (it was Friday around 7pm) but we managed to get 2 seats at the bar. Our bartender/server took good care of us and we had prompt service all night. I really like the taco menu. There's something for everyone here and it's very reasonably priced, but I will say that the guacamole was disappointing. I got 2 taco de panzas and 1 taco de pollo. Both were really good in their own special way. My friend got 2 tacos and I was confused when they came over with 4 tacos on a tray and then a small basket with a bag of fritos in it. I didn't recall either of us ordering chips and I felt bad that my friend's fifth taco hadn't arrived yet. But she was a seasoned Big Star chick so she knew that her walking taco was served in a Frito bag! Cute... We shouted at each other to hold a conversation the whole time we were there. My margarita was fine and there were quite a few people ordering pitchers of them around us, but I can't say there were amazing as some other yelpers claim. Around 9/9:30 the bar wasn't as packed so we didn't have to shout at each other anymore. We left shortly thereafter and the patio was still PACKED with people, and there were people waiting to be seated. Would I wait an hour plus for a table here? no. I wouldn't wait more than 20 minutes.
All 4 stars for the fish tacos!!!  Bring cash if you want to buy from the pick up window.

Very crowded, very hipster and very tasty. I had four tacos: Chicken - Quite good, a bit bland, would have liked it to be spicier. The pickled onion was a great touch. Chorizo - Loved it, honestly the best part is that it isn't greasy. The potatoes were a nice compliment. Potato - Good, but I wouldn't order it again, especially since there are potatoes in the chorizo tacos. Fish - The piece of fish is gigantic! The veggies on top were a nice touch, though altogether it wasn't my favorite. The service was a bit egh, but I won't dock the rating because it was slammed.

Not sure if I really had a fish taco the first time, because I don't remember having a huge fried tilapia filet as a taco!  It's amaze balls and I highly recommend it along with the al pastor and chicken tacos... Really everything is great and they deliver!  Damn you grub hub, you're contributing to my expanding waistline!

I've been here on 3 different occasions. And the food has been great each time. This place is always ridiculously packed though so you need to be willing to wait quite a while for a table. My absolute favorite here are the tacos de panza which is topped with onion, cilantro, queso fresco, and salsa. Perfect combination of flavors. I also love the tacos al pastor and those come topped with onion, cilantro, and grilled pineapple. Delicious!  If you want quick food you can go to their takeout window and order tacos and beverages there, they also have a few picnic tables there you can sit at. Also one last but very important thing,  they are CASH ONLY.

I love going to Big Star in the summer to enjoy their outdoor patio, their margarita pitchers, and their amazing tacos! Their fish taco is my favorite, but the al pastor is a close second.  They do get ridiculously busy during peak lunch and dinner hours, but stay open until 2 am! They also are cash only.  You can also sit with your dog outside for those with pets

Recommendation ! During summer is always packed!! a mean always! They have the best tacos!! Not only that but is real Mexican Food so much flavor on it! If you don't mind waiting go around the corner to Trenchermen get drinks. Waiting here is 2 hours + Get  Tacos al Pastor Fish tacos Chorizo Fundido Frijoles  Tortillas a Mano!!!!!

We have been wanting to try this place for the longest, but somehow we always end up going somewhere else. This place is pretty busy and if you come during the winter season, the outdoor patio is closed, so expect longer waiting times. My impression? I honestly think this place is overrated. The food here is good, but nothing really stand out. We ordered taco al pastor, taco de panza, taco de pescado, taco de chorizo verde, queso fundido, and Sonoran dog. I felt like all the tacos are just okay for the most part. My favorite taco was the pescado as the fish was really fresh. The Sonoran dog was actually good and I would recommend getting this. Overall, it is good at best, but not worth the wait.

What is all the fuss? $3 tacos and a long wait. I had the al pastor and the el pescado. The al pastor was average and the el pascado was below average. Why are these $3 and why does everyone go here?? Do yourself a favor and find some $2 tacos at a more authentic place.
The best authentic "tacos al pastor" and "micheladas" in Chicago! Highly recommended.

Agree with the MEHs I see in a lot of these reviews. Everyone and their mother rave about Big Star, with their delicious tacos and refreshing cocktails. However, after numerous visits, I gotta say there's not that much there to write home about. They're good, but not great, let alone the best in Chicago; especially when you consider the ludicrous wait associated with this joint. Luckily the staff is amazing - a well oiled machine, if you will. If you have to wait, they will call you when your table opens, giving your party ample time to have a drink at the neighboring Violet Hour or Revel Room. Despite consistently being packed, the drinks and food always come out on time.  So while the food isn't as great as the rest of trendy, hip Chicagoans make it out to be, the place is relatively affordable with a cool ambience and very hard-working staff. I will be back in typical fashion. When my friends from other neighborhoods come here, I will make them wait... and meet them when the table is ready! Muah.

Meh...  just alright for me.  I had the fish and chicken tavos.  The fish was ok...  I prefer my fish tacos grilled.  The chicken was pretty tasty.  I give it three stars due to the patio and atmosphere.  It's a pretty cool joint.  There are better tacos to b had in Chicago tho.
Had great drinks and snacks here!  Still dreaming out the Michelada, could drink that everyday

Every time I go into the city and we are looking for a place to eat this is by far one of my top favorite places to go in the city. I love the pastor tacos and the ponza porkbelly tacos are pretty amazing too! The guacamole is must too. If your staying for drinks the jalapeño margarita is so smooth. Arrive early if you want a table but the take out order area usually has some seating on the picnic benches on the side or you can take it to go. Make sure you bring cash, no credit cards are accepted. There is an ATM right around the corner so no worries if you forget. Service isn't the best but the food is great and the pricing is pretty decent too.

I've been here plenty of times to form a good opinion about the place. First off, the drinks: I've only had their Micheladas & Margaritas, both which I absolutely love!  Be warned, their Micheladas can be a bit on the spicy side at times.  So if you suffer from acid reflux or don't like things too spicy I'd steer away. The food: Their guacamole, queso fundido, tacos al pastor, walking taco and frijoles were all phenomenal.  Their fish taco was okay, I've had better elsewhere.  They also had, what was called, a Sonora hot dog at one point, PLEASE BRING THAT BACK!  I could practically live off of that.  Every now and then they offer a tamale as a special, I'd pass on it as it's not all that great. Even though this place is ALWAYS busy, I've never experienced bad service.  My servers have always been very nice and attentive.  The service at the bar is as good as it can be; they have a lot of bartenders trying their best at serving a ton of people crowded around the bar. Side note, if you stand along the south wall, beware!  The darn vents build up condensation and drip on you!  Is there anything that can be done about that Big Star??

I really wanted to like this place but sadly didn't.  Love the outside seating and people watching.  The tacos....just kinda ok.   There is usually a long line which is not big deal but for average tacos?

Went there just for a few drinks with a friend recently. The place was nice and a fun environment- but this review is mostly for our bartender Lorenz. He was absolutely wonderful! So kind and attentive. I have never yelped a server before, but my friend and I could not get over how wonderful he was. Thank you, Lorenz!

I live very close to this place and i always see that it is very busy. In my opinion i thought because they may be adding crack to whatever they are serving which keeps people coming back! (RELAX I'M JUST KIDDING) My girlfriends and I came here because we were craving Tacos and Margaritas! It was about 10 PM on a Friday night and we caught an uber over to this place. This place was so freaking crowded, i literally had to bully my way through to find a seat at the bar. I honestly think that we were super lucky to find 3 seats right next to each other.  First off their Taco menu is DRY. I mean it was a waste of my time reading the menu because they did not have STEAK. All that other rubbish that was on there turned me off, where i then decided i was just going to drink and then go to Flash Taco and get myself a steak taco. When my girlfriends got their Tacos they were pretty much disgusted by what was served to them. Since i have already made the executive decision that we were going to Flash Taco after we got some drinks in us; they both were on board with my decision (its not like they were going to veto this decision).  The music was too damn loud as well. I felt like i was in a night club and couldn't hear Jack! I understand that this is a bar but lord please turn the music down just a bit! Also the majority of the female bartenders were just RUDE! I was looking for a reason why they could possibly ALL have nasty attitudes but it wasn't like supermodels were serving me to have a stank attitude. Maybe its a trend in there that they all collectively decide to be nasty to paying customers. I really wanted to like this place but NOPE! The only reason they are getting a two star was because the margarita they served me got me real ready for the night!
Love this place so much. Service is 'generally' good and their tacos are neck an neck with Antique. Great atmosphere, outdoor seating, good food: what's not to love?

We have been meaning to try this place for years and were incredibly disappointed when we finally did. Firstly we had to wait 3 hours for a table. You'd think after that long a wait anything would taste great but no. The tacos here are bland and dry. I sampled all 6 of their tacos. The "pollo" is alright. The rest are poor. I wouldn't waste your time waiting for this place. People seem to hang out here and drink but the ambience is basic enough. Overall it's terrible

I've heard so much about this place and have been meaning to try it for 3 years. We went on a Saturday night. I put our name down for a group of 6 l, the hostess told us it would be a 2 hour wait. 3 hours later we got a text saying our table was ready. Food was below average for the hype and wait. Bland tacos. Also they are corn tacos and for me that taste is too over powering. The pork belly which the waiter recommended below average u would say. The only one I liked was the talapia and it needed more mayo. All the tacos were just forgettable. Bottom line not worth the wait or the trek out to Bucktown which is full of crazies on a Saturday night!

Took me years to eat/drink here. Used the walk up window to snag a taco, it was pricey but I really liked the tropical hint of sweet. Stayed for a drink and it was crowded beyond my comfort zone, also my margarita was gross, no Buena for a mex joint I wasn't super impressed but it wasn't horrible either

People who wrote negative reviews on this place and complain about CASH only are truly lame! Yelp is here to offer an insite into the resturants food and culture. Yelp is not in place to bash the resturant because you had to wait two hours on a Saturday night. Gross! Get over your "me" first attitude and know in real life you have to wait for things you want. Big Star is located in one of the most popular neighborhoods in Chicago and is consistently crowded. For the space of the bar and the kitchen.... this place produces miraculously. The food is great, the drinks are strong and service is friendly. Whatelse are you looking for? For individuals who are looking to be babied and pampered this is not the place for you. This is a place for chill folks who are looking for a good time, not for people with an elitest attitude who think they are better than others and don't have to wait like everone else.  I love Big Star and I will be back!

Love the atmosphere, location and food! Prices are decent and love how they serve food until 1:30am! Service isn't the greatest, was there two times and got forgotten both times. Thought maybe it was a one time deal or maybe I got stuck with that same server.

Came in on a Saturday night. Left my cell phone number for them to text when we can get in. They said about 45 minutes, 15 minutes later we got the text. Gave our number after we got in to get a table. We ended up getting a bar spot and ate there. The chips and guacamole were good, tacos were ok, atmosphere was nice. Didn't have a bad time there. Never got the your table is ready text though, even though it was not busy by the time we left. Good decision on the bar.

NOTE: If you have a big appetite, but not a big wallet, don't make this place a go-to. That being said, the food here is of high quality and is very flavorful. Unlike most Mexican restaurants, whose menus play in the ridiculously large space, Big Star limits their offerings to a handful of options that they do very well. It helps you make up your mind. $3 for a small soft taco is pretty high. And if you're a hungry guy (like my husband) you could easily be 10-12 tacos in before you actually start to feel full. But that means you're also $30-36 dollars in the hole. For one person. I know they're charging for the quality of ingredients, so perhaps this just needs to be a snack or light lunch for those of us who don't like leaving a place hungry. The pastor meat is amazing, brightened by pineapple. I asked for a side of it to go atop the Big Star salad, which ended up being a good-sized meal and very fresh. The guacamole was mediocre; you can get much better at Las Palmas up the road on North Ave or at Irazu on Milwaukee. My husband was raving about the chorizo tacos, and the tortillas are corn-based and scrumptious. If you like to "be seen" and talk very loudly to your dining companions, try to sit at a table. If you're like us and prefer actual conversation in peace, order your food from the to-go window and take it home, to a park, or sit at one of the picnic tables by the to-go window.

We tried this place after the nearby, the Violet Hour.  Big Star has an impressive outdoor seating section and an indoor area as well.  We were there on a Thursday night and it was packed!  We found a couple seats inside quickly.  It has a very cool tex-mex theme.  Everything was very clean and the staff was friendly, quick and helpful.   We ordered a few different tacos, the chips and guacamole and a pitcher of margaritas.  The margaritas were delicious and the tacos were amazing!  I tried a bite of a couple different tacos and all were just awesome.  The guac was fresh and tasty also.  The food was all reasonably priced. This place is very popular so I could see having to wait on a weekend.  The food was great and the drinks were strong.  I would definitely recommend this place.  But keep in mind it is cash only.  It would probably be nice for a family earlier in the day.

Best. Tacos. Ever. Taco al Pastor and Taco de Panza are insanely good. So simple yet so flavorful. This place is a total must even if you don't wanna venture over to Wicker Park. I promise you that it is so worth it. Amazing. And don't skip the Tecate micheladas. They are a great companion drink to these insanely good tacos. This no frills places surprised me.

Great prices. Really good food. Awesome patio. Solid bar for waiting. Waits are long, but great system with text notification and confirmation. Respectable beer list and tap selection. They will have a bouncer pretending to act really tough and cool. Even though it's really lame, it's not enough to downgrade by a star.
The tacos here are awesome!  I usually get chicken tacos and/or the fish tacos and they don't disappoint.  Service isn't' that great if you dine in but still a good spot to pick food up.

Came in mid-day to celebrate (or recover from) our move.  Sat at the bar and got ok service from the bartender. We had one of each type of taco (don't judge, we were hungry!). None of them were that memorable -- fancy, overpriced tacos. Next time I want a taco, I'll get a real one. Drinks were pretty good. I'd come back again and give it another shot, if I wasn't so allergic to waiting for tables.

Went here with my gf after hearing rave reviews about this place.  This is probably great drunk food and the environment was pretty nice (outdoor patio and cool indoor bar), but I thought this place was just your average gourmet taco and margarita place. We tried every type of taco except for the vegan one and had a pitcher of the spicier margarita.  Margarita was average, nothing really pushed me to keep drinking our pitcher. Also margaritas were a bit expensive for Wicker Park ($40 a pitcher. Not worth it in my mind.) Some of the tacos were pretty good. I really enjoyed the fish and steak ones in particular. However nothing to blow me out of the water. All in all this place is decent.  Can be fun but there are better places out there. Maybe I'll come back if I'm with a group.

We had such high hopes. We were told we would get a table and waited for over 2 hours with nothing and watched others get seated who came after us. The worst was when the server in the gray onesie (that looked like what an infant wears) shoved herself into me on purpose,  physically harassing me when she got annoyed with us. HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT.

Ahhh, one can never go wrong at Big Star. I order a michelada, guac and ANY taco (pastor and fish are my favs) then commence people watching. Everyone in here is beautiful and happy. Cash only and long waits, but who cares?

I loved it here and after reading reviews from people who gave this place 1 star, most were for ridiculous reasons.  I think this place deserves at least 4 stars.   The drinks were delicious and they have a wide variety of whiskey, tequila, and beer.  I thought the chips and guacamole were pretty awesome, also.  The meat in the tacos was well seasoned of the ones I tried, there were an assortment of different sauces and finishings.  The only thing I would change is that the fish taco was heavily battered but it still tasted delicious.   As for the atmosphere, although it had a bit of a hipster vibe, everyone was friendly, drinking, chilling, and not overly deuchey or rowdy.  I loved the outdoor seating, and although it gets crowded we didn't wait too long for a table.  Me gusta mucho, I would definitely come back and bring friends. And one more thing...pretty damn cheap! :)
Worth the wait! Fish tacos go hard! Yummy. Really its worth all the hype and buzz. The potato tacos are very delicious as well.

I usually don't do this but um.....   I've never been more disappointed with a restaurant than after having lunch at Big Star.  Service was awful, food was worse, and the outside patio is left me in the most uncomfortable dining experience ever.  Our server took about 10-15 minutes to even approach our table and she then asked "are you guys ok?" um...no lady.. we would like to order..?  I felt like the Taco al Pastor I ordered sucked all of the moisture out of my mouth with it's dry, flavorless pork shoulder wrapped in a sock trying to call itself a tortilla.  The best thing about my experience at Big Star was the Fritos in my Walking Taco- you can't mess up Fritos. Hey, at least I was close enough to the table next to mine to vicariously taste their guacamole because my Queso Fundido was BLEH! Needless to say, I have no reason or desire to ever return.
Such a great and lively atmosphere! Love to bring out of town folks here :) their fish tacos and margaritas pitchers are bomb diggity

This is a great place if you are looking for something modern and trendy. They have a smaller menu then most places, and the prices have tax included which is great! The only negative thing is that it is kind of busy, and the seating is in somewhat close proximity. But the food was really good otherwise! I would come again.

THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU! You completely saved an otherwise awful Chicago restaurant day. We were in from out of town for a birthday celebration and in between visits to Longman & Eagle (they were crazy overwhelmed so our experience unfortunately suffered greatly) for brunch and Alinea for dinner when we popped into Violet Hour and were pointed across the street when we asked for a recommendation for something quick and fun to fill our bellies.  After a great cocktail at VH we put our name on the 45 minute wait list (which ended up being SPOT on!) but we actually ended up sitting at the bar when some seats conveniently opened up.  There is nothing in this world that I love more than a restaurant that knows what they do and do it well. The experience is indescribable for me, it just seems perfect. No fluff, no bullshit, just pure authenticity and hospitality.  Your staff was full of aces, all working extremely hard and with each other to provide a great experience. We enjoyed a few Micheladas, several tacos and the scrumptious, cheesy, oily and DELICIOUS queso fundido while admiring the bar staff busting their asses with smiles on their faces and laughs in the air.  Lively, delicious, affordable, fun, relaxing, vibrant, blah blah blah.... just fucking go and ENJOY!  Thank you to all of you for a seriously great experience. I will return as soon as my girlfriend decides to visit her sister again.

The atmosphere is fun and almost carnival like.  They offer indoor and outdoor seating and from the looks of it, they're expanding into the lot North of them as well.  We sat outside under a large covered area, but they also have multiple tables with umbrellas. Food was amazing and the price provides great value.  I order the al pastor, chorizo & fish tacos and they were all really great.  The fish taco, although more expensive than the other two, was huge and I'm sure if I ordered 2 fish tacos, I would have not needed a 3rd.  My pescetarian wife enjoyed the fish taco loved every bite.  The classic margarita she ordered was citrusy and not stingy on the tequila.  My only knock is that it's too bad they don't offer veggies to dip the guacamole instead of tortilla chips.  I don't know of any Mexican restaurant that does, but still sounds like an untapped option. One word to describe service: FAST.  We went at noon on a Monday so I'd be a little weary if it wasn't, but it was still faster than I would have expected.  We ordered our drinks and tacos at the same time AND GOT OUR TACOS FIRST! WOW! I don't know if that's ever happened to me at a restaurant.  Quite awesome! Overall: Great restaurant with great food.  Cash Only is kind of a bummer, but I think the savings is passed onto the customer so not too bad.  Just have to know in advance.

Al pastor and panza all day. I think the tacos are pretty darn good for $3. The dining/bar area inside is pretty tight but it's a good way to mingle with other people. I like this place more for the take-out window though. Better than the other quick taco places around the area.

Stopped in here on our way to downtown Chicago. The guacamole was terrific and not to be missed. I had the pork tacos and my wife had the tilapia. All of them were quite good, but I've had similar elsewhere. The atmosphere was "garage- chic" and seemed like it would be the perfect place for a group of friends to drink a few pitchers of the $37 margaritas, which were excellent

The tacos were good.  We ordered taco de panza, taco al pastor, taco de pollo, and the fish taco.  Panza and pastor were the good ones and the rest was ok. The service here was not great. The food took awhile to come out. The waiter never checked on us and it took a long time to wave her down to get the check.

They keep me coming back ;) between the margaritas and the tacos I'm hooked. The dishes are simple, but are complex in taste. My favorite drink is the twisted lizard, I love the jalapeño infused tequila and beer combination. They have found the loop hole of the old saying "beer before liquor never sicker...." Everything is fairly priced, the atmosphere Isn't for everyone, but I love that close encounter feeling, it's always a party.

Disclaimer: I'm a Chicago native who was raised in Mexico and I know how to make good Mexican food. So, I was starving and, instead of driving all the way home, I decided to check out Big Star since I was in the area. Let me reiterate: I was so hungry and feeling dizzy, after a day of non-stop work, that I probably didn't have the sense to go to a better place.  Anyway, I was appalled by the prices: $8 for guacamole. LOL. $4 for ONE taco. You can get better and less expensive food in Pilsen. The food wasn't bad.  I did enjoy my meal. But, I think the prices are unjustifiable.  ATMOSPHERE AND SERVICE: Absolutely awful. And let's just say that the atmosphere is NOT diverse. The waitress walked by our table several times, without asking if we were ready to order. When I politely told the hostess that we had been waiting for a while to place our order, she looked at me with a look of disinterest.  All in all, I don't think I'll be returning. The atmosphere was not conducive to a pleasant dining experience to warrant what we paid for our meal. There are SO MANY better Mexican restaurants in Chicago--hey, Adobo is way better, if you're too scared to go to the "ghetto"--with much better service and ambiance.

So glad I finally tried! Got the pork belly, chicken and fish tacos to-go. Granted they had to endure a long ride home on the CTA but they were still intact when I dug into them and the flavors were strong and zippity fresh! My fave was the fish taco, followed by chicken. Yum!

I came here on a weekday afternoon for lunch and I had no problem getting a table for four.
